issue.title: Rename {Eclipse Project, DTP, WTP} Incubator project to ...Labs
issue.description: The projects Eclipse Project Incubator, DTP Incubator, and WTP Incubator all contain a couple of experimental subprojects. Outside from Eclipse these kinds of project are called "Labs": - Google Labs: http://www.googlelabs.com/ - Mozilla Labs: http://mozillalabs.com/ - Apache Labs: http://labs.apache.org/ Especially for Non-Eclipse experts it would be great if Eclipse also applied this naming convention. Furthermore, "Incubator" could be easily mistaken for "Incubation" which is however not a place but a project phase.

issue.title: Event racing while initializing compare editor - garbled connecting lines
issue.description:
Sometimes the compare editor for Java Elements (compare with other element) starts with correct regions but wrong connecting lines. (cf. bug 297316 comment 5 for the original observation).
Inspecting this in the debugger revealed the following non-deterministic behaviour:
When running without breakpoints the problem can be reproduced. When setting a few breakpoints the behaviour was correct. The breakpoint that seemed to make the difference was actually a watch point (Modification) on StyledText.verticalScrollOffset. This leads me to the conclusion that some widgets may get painted before the vertical scroll offset is correctly initialized.
More specifically, I could observe: Method TextMergeViewer.handleResizeLeftRight(..) triggers method StyledText.scrollVertical(int,boolean) thus initializing the vertical scroll offset. However, before the method updates field StyledText.verticalScrollOffset, a call to scroll(..) may trigger update() which calls into the UI mainloop (gdk_window_process_updates()). Depending on event ordering (I assume -- this happens in native code) this may call back into doPaint() which invokes paintCenter() and paintSides() in an inconsistent state, since the verticalScrollOffset is used before assigned.

issue.title: [EDP] PMC makeup description is wrong, or at least not right.
issue.description:
In the Development Process document, in http://www.eclipse.org/projects/dev_process/development_process.php#4_6_Leaders It says <quote> Top-Level Projects are managed by a Project Management Committee (PMC). Sub-Projects are managed by one or more Project Leaders. The PMC Lead(s) of a Top-Level Project are the Project Leader(s) of that project. </quote>
But this isn't right. Project leads are not automatically PMC members, and PMC members do not _have_ to lead a Project. We've never done it in WTP that way, similar for "Tools" TLP. But, I know that does sound like the "Modeling" model.
You could fix by just leaving off the very last sentence, or, if needed, you could say something like "After the initial formation, the PMC members choose who they want to be on the PMC by their own criteria and decision process, which varies from TLP to TLP". Or, something like that.

issue.title: Add gcov feature to automated builds
issue.description: I have a patch to do this.

issue.title: [EMF Compare] Difference marked as local - should be remote
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
I have a non-EMF object included in the EMF model. On the remote copy, it is set to null (it has a value in the local and ancestor copy).
The difference engine identifies the change, but marks it incorrectly as a local change. It should have been marked as remote.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run unit test - testNullDifference

issue.title: Backport jar files in a directory can't be pasted to another system properly
issue.description: This bug is for the backport of bug 298440 to the RSE 3.0.3 maintenance stream.

issue.title: [EDP] Project Leadership selection process is wrong, or confusing
issue.description:
This is similar or related to bug 300002. In http://www.eclipse.org/projects/dev_process/development_process.php#4_6_Leaders it says <quote> Subsequently, additional Project Leadership (PMC members or Sub-Project Leaders) must be elected by the Project's Committers1 and the Board or EMO(ED) (for PMC members and Sub-Project Leads respectively). </quote> First, it's just plain confusing, in that it packs too much into one sentence. I can't unpack it.
Second, the actual process seems to leave sub-project leadership entirely up to the committers on that sub-project. Fine by me, but don't think that's the way it works in practice.
This sentence came to my attention when I was "elected" to be Orbit Project lead. I was "chosen" by the PMC, not the committers. And then a committer mailing list discussion followed about "how is the lead supposed to be chosen? ... did anyone else want to "run" for the job". [no one did, unfortunately ... ha ha, ha].
I think, for sub-project leads, it should be worded something like - - - Subsequently, additional Sub-Project Leadership can be chosen by the PMC, and confirmed by a vote of the committers of the project, or chosen by the committers and confirmed by a vote of the PMC. - - - Or, something like that. This does change the substance a little, in that it acknowledges a role for both the PMC and the committers. The previous wording sounded like to could be up to the committers entirely. Its unlikely one would ever not confirm the others choice ... but, seems only right to let (or, insist?) the Project Management Committee do some management. :)
You could sort out the PMC/Board/EMO(ED) clauses in separate sentences in similar ways.

issue.title: NullPointerException importing project set
issue.description:
I20100114-1100
I attempted to import the p2.releng project set. I had some of the projects already in my workspace, but was missing others. When prompted to overwrite, I selected "No to all" so it would just import the missing projects. This resulted in an NPE. There is nothing in the log or on stderr, but the error details indicated an NPE. Clearly the exception is not being properly logged...

issue.title: [EMF Compare] Priority in match engine schema marked as deprecated, but it is not.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
The priority field for EMF Compare match engines added via the extension point is marked as deprecated. However, it is still being used to determine between engines that match on the same extensions and there is not another way to make this distinction.
The removal of priority would result in arbitrary use of two competing match engines. This will happen when one creates a new match engine for "*", since the default is always available.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. N/A

issue.title: [project explorer] New projects are not immediately visible in Explorer
Pick a sensible default name when adding a new target platform
issue.description: When I add a new target platform, I go through the steps and finish and I end up with something called "New Target" in the list of target platforms. It would be nice it it could use the directory containing the target as the default name rather than "New Target" -- It can just change the default name if you did not change it beforehand.

issue.title: ITreeRidget - add API to refresh a single element
issue.description:
Currently we can only invoke updateFromModel() which refreshes all elements and resets the expansion state.
We should add API to refresh a single element (i.e. row) in the tree.

issue.title: tweek for templated jaxws build
issue.description:
I recently broke the jaxws build, by updating the wtp pre-req to WTP M4.
First, there was a typp in the M4 URL so the whole zip could not be found. Easy to fix that.
But, then ran into the problem where WTP itself already contains a build of JAXWS, so it is not re-build by PDE, but instead just attempted to be packaged up as already built. Thus, we need to delete the jaxws related features and bundles after installing/unzipping WTP itself.
I used to do that "by hand" on a case by case basis, to the zip stored in pre-req cache. This time, I solved by editing the customTargets.xml file, so that right after "get and install dependencies" I call delete task, with jaxws patterns. Namely,
<delete> <fileset dir="${buildRoot}"> <include name="**/org.eclipse.jst.ws.cxf*/**,**/org.eclipse.jst.ws.jaxws*/**,**/org.eclipse.jst.ws.jaxb*/**" /> </fileset> </delete>
It works for this case, but could get overly complex for other cases.
Seems a good tactical solution until we move to P2 based prereqs/installs.
One problem, though, is if/when I regenerate the customTargets.xml file from the templates, my hand modifications will be lost. Which is why I wanted to document it in this bug. :)

issue.title: Wrong representation of using declarations targeting more than 2 declarations
[DB] Develop a delta-mapping
issue.description:
This idea has been floating around in Eike's an my heads for a while. A mapping should be developed which combines the performance of the non-audit store with an auditing capability.
The result could be a delta-mapping for the DBStore which uses the existing non-audit mapping implementations and augments it with a mechanism to store reverse revision-deltas in separate tables. The behavior would be similar to RCS/CVS: the most current version (HEAD) would be stored as is (hence the reuse of non-audit mappings) and if a new revision is committed, the backwards delta is calculated and stored.
This trades off auditing performance for speed when working with the current version: When accessing an old revision, it has to be reconstructed by fetching the HEAD revision and applying the backwards deltas until the desired version is reached.

issue.title: [Sequence Diagram] InteractionOperand containment does not own MessageOccurenceSpecification
issue.description: When a message is created in an InteractionOperand, the message related MessageOccurenceSpecification should be owned by the operand.

issue.title: [Sequence Diagram] InteractionOperand owned element not updated after move
issue.description:
When the diagram is modified: - dragging Message / ExecutionSpecification inside or outside an InteractionOperand - moving or changing InteractionOperand / CombinedFragment size
the InteractionOperand content (regarding the OccurenceSpecifications) is not updated and may not reflect the graphical appearance (ex: Execution dragged in the InteractionOperand but the InteractionOperand does not own the ExecutionOccurenceSpecifications of the execution in the model).

issue.title: Link with Editor points to different project when file from the library is opened
issue.description:
1. Create few projects in the workspace. 2. In the editor ctrl+click on a predefined function (for example define).
The relevant file from the PHP library opens (for example basic.php).
If "Link with Editor" in PHP Explorer is selected it usually points to e different project. That means: if the file containing the 'define' is in one project, the "Link with Editor" points to the basic.php under the PHP Library under another project. The PHP Library is common to all the projects in the workspace, so the problem is that 'link with editor' shows another project after opening the file.
(related to Bug #253097)

Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [DataBinding] Need better support for binding collections of complex types
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
The way to observe properties (e.g. to refresh cell labels in a TableViewer) of a regular property (a distinct element) is trivial, but doing the same for a collection of complex types is awkward, and requires the application developer to write a significant amount of code using "obscure" classes.
This is one way to observe properties of a distinct instance: IObservableMap father = BeansObservables.observeMap(elements, "father.name");
I would like to observe children more or less the same way: IObservableMap children = BeansObservables.observeMap(elements, "children.name");
'children' would fire events whenever a child was added or removed, or whenever the name of a child was modified. (will attempt to attach a screenshot to illustrate)
For bonus points :-) In both cases, it would also be nice if I could specify a collection of properties to observe, and have the method return an aggregated map of some sort. This would allow me to compile all necessary observables in one single map. Although the typical use of the returned map might be to pass it as an argument to a label provider (which typcally accepts arrays of maps, e.g. 'org.eclipse.jface.databinding.viewers.ObservableMapLabelProvider.ObservableMapLabelProvider(IObservableMap[])'), returning a single, composite map would make it easier to use in contexts where an array is not accepted. One example could be to return a map from a factory passed to 'org.eclipse.core.databinding.observable.map.CompositeMap.CompositeMap(IObservableMap, IObservableFactory)'.
Hence, I would also like to have the following methods:
IObservableMap father = BeansObservables.observeMap(elements, "father.firstName", "father.lastName"); IObservableMap children = BeansObservables.observeMap(elements, "children.firstName", "children.lastName");
An extended version of the snippet org.eclipse.jface.examples.databinding.snippets.Snippet025TableViewerWithPropertyDerivedColumns could be used to illustrate the problem and the solution. Right now, it only holds columns with distinct entities. Adding a column with "children" would illustrate the issue.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open snippet org.eclipse.jface.examples.databinding.snippets.Snippet025TableViewerWithPropertyDerivedColumns 2. Add the property "Person.children" and let it return a Set or a List 3. Add a column to represent the new property, and have it updated whenever the collection of children changes, or any of the children has its name changed. 4. For the "bonus point issue": modify Person to have "name" derived from "firstName" and "lastName", and have all columns updated when either changes.

Is this supposed to be public or internal? Please make the necessary changes and polish before the API freeze in M6.

issue.title: [General] Move extra plugins in more appropriate directory
issue.description:
Some plugins are not directly part of the Papyrus distribution. They can be moved in another hierarchy. This will ease the creation of a main feature (Papyrus), and additional features linked to the extra plugins. Example of plugins: - java reverse - modisco adapter - example.* - umltools adapters - ... I propose to create a new dir called 'extraplugins' at the same level as the 'plugins' dir. In this 'extraplugins' dir, we will have one dir for each possible extra feature.
Example of the proposal: --trunk +--- plugins +--- extraplugins +--- reverse +--- org.eclipse.papyrus.java.reverse +--- org.eclipse.papyrus.java.reverse.ui +--- modisco +--- org.eclipse.papyrus.adaptor.modisco +--- sashexamples +--- org.eclipse.papyrus.example....

issue.title: About this project links to 'ws' instead of 'webservices'
issue.description:
I tried to get the IP log for our webservices sub-project. Following the "About this Project" links brings me to
http://www.eclipse.org/projects/project_summary.php?projectid=webtools.ws
and the IP Log link on that page does not work
http://www.eclipse.org/projects/ip_log.php?projectid=webtools.ws
But going to the Foundation Portal, it appears 'webservices' should be the shortname. And, in fact, the IP Log link works, if entered directly, as
http://www.eclipse.org/projects/ip_log.php?projectid=webtools.webservices
So ... is there something inconsistent in data bases?
Something we in WTP have defined wrong?
I'm not sure where some of these values and links come from, so would appreciate your help in getting it sorted out.

issue.title: Regression: SSLHandshakeException (... PKIX path building failed ...) when connecting to Jira
issue.description:
Build Identifier: org.eclipse.mylyn.jira_feature_3.3.1.v20091215-0000-e3x
I get the following error message whenever I try to use our departmental Jira repository:
javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target
This error occurs as soon as I enter the URL of the server (if this relevant - its a http address) _and_ provide valid credentials. If I provide invalid credentials I get the normal error message.
This behaviour appears to be a regression - it only occurs in 3.3.1 but not in 3.2.0.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start the Add task repository wizard 2. Choose JIRA (supports 3.4 and later) 3. Enter the http URL of the server (ours is an Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.13.5-#360) 4. Enter valid credentials 5. Hit Validate

issue.title: Better error when Query.setHint() called for native SQL queries (currently NPE)
issue.description:
Hi. Currently NullPointerException is thrown when an attempt is made to set a hint to a Query that is a native SQL query.
There should be a better exception / error message. For example, when a @NamedNativeQuery is used, and it contains a @QueryHint, IllegalArgumentException is thrown with a better message.
Steps to reproduce: Query q = em.createNativeQuery("some sql"); q.setHint("hint", "value"); // NPE

issue.title: Call to IResource.setEncoding() persists derived file's encoding setting in .settings\org.eclipse.core.resources.prefs
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090211-1700
When working with a source control repos - such as ClearCase - only non-derived files are supposed to be checked in to source repos.
We have derived files that we would like to set encoding setting for deployment - via the IResource.setEncoding() call - but such API call saves the derived file's encoding setting in the .settings\org.eclipse.core.resources.prefs file - which also contains encoding setting for non-derived files..
This is causing a problem that we are persisting encoding settings for non-files that are not in source repos...
We find there is no other API call/option that can save the derived file's encoding setting in a different place.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Improve performance of JavaExtensionStatement
issue.description: JavaExtensionStatement searches for the java method to be called on every call to getJavaMethod, especially on every evaluation and analyzer run. As a java method is not exchanged during a JVM's runtime so far, it is safe to cache the method object for faster retrieval.

attachments.attach: Cache the method object of the method being invoked

issue.title: Performance improvement of VirtualComponent caching
issue.description:
Build Identifier: wtp 3.0.5
Better caching is needed for VirtualComponent objects. Currently when we request a VirtualComponent of a project, the new component is created each time. Adding caching that persists unless resources changes would improve performance by allowing VirtualComponent functions to store their calculations (such as the different project references).
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [pull up] Pull up refactoring broken for pulling method from concrete class to interface
Xdebug: The breakpoints work but the results appear in web browser only at the end
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
My config:
1)I use wamp 5.3.0
2)I have configured eclipse with that step by step procedure: http://www.techiedesi.com/post/229-setup-xdebug-and-php5-with-eclipse-34-to-debug-your-php-website-at-runtime
3)In phpinfo: Zend Engine v2.3.0 with with Xdebug v2.0.5
-------------------------------
The page I want to debug (test)
<?php
echo "1"; echo "2"; echo "3";
?>
---------------------------------
Steps using option "Debug as a php script":
1-I added 3 breakpoints in the page that I wanted to debug. (one for each echo) 2-If a debug as a php script it works well. I mean it stops at each breakpoints. --It stops at first breakpoint --I click on resume and now I can see "1" in the debug output screen and in the browser output screen --It stops at the second breakpoint --I click on resume and now I can see "12" in the debug output screen and in the browser output screen --...
Steps using option "Debug as a php web page":
1-I repeated the same steps but now I use option "Debug as a web page" 2-a web browser automaticly opened (firefox in my case) 3-The page is an empty blank page (normal) 4-I can see that firefox is waiting for localhost... 5-Eclipse seems to stop at the breakpoint (the green line is on the first breakpoint in code) 6-I click on resume and now instead to see "1" in firefox the page is still empty (firefox still waiting for localhost) 7-I click on resume again and now instead to see "12" in firefox the page is still empty (firefox still waiting for localhost) 8-So I click on resume until the end and Now in firefox I see the output "123" at this url: http://localhost//test/test.php?XDEBUG_SESSION_START=ECLIPSE_DBGP&KEY=12639192512961 9-I click on terminate in eclipse and I new tab is open in firefox with that message: DEBUG SESSION ENDED
Notes: -same problem with IE -I tried on another machine using wamp 5.2.8 and another xdebug version but I have the same problem
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Delete tag on CVS
issue.description:
Hi there,
I already asked this question on the Eclipse Community Forums [1], but didn't receive an answer so far. I'm not sure, whether I am here in the right place, as this is more a question than a bug, but I'm posting it anyway. Feel free to direct me to the right place and close this bug. Thanks for reading in advance!
Our project created quite a lot of tags over a period of time. Now, it is quite complicated to find the tags that are useful. Therefore, as project co-lead I would like to clear the list of tags for the specific components, but I did not find out how. I have access to the dev server of Eclipse via SSH and can navigate to the CVSROOT. However, when trying to remove the tag called BRANCH_METAMODELEXT_20080710 with the following command:
cvs -d dev.eclipse.org:/cvsroot/technology rtag -d BRANCH_METAMODELEXT_20080710 /cvsroot/technology/org.eclipse.jwt/we/jwt-we
I receive the reply as follows:
The authenticity of host 'dev.eclipse.org (127.0.0.1)' can't be established. RSA key fingerprint is [...]. Please type 'yes' or 'no': no Host key verification failed.
If I answer "yes" instead, I receive the following warning which I was not sure would be right or not which was the reason why I skipped this process.
Warning: Permanently added 'dev.eclipse.org' (RSA) to the list of known hosts. Password: cvs [rtag aborted]: received interrupt signal
Am I trying it the wrong way or is there anything else I need to consider?
Thanks for your hint and best regards,
Florian -JWT project co-lead-
[1] http://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php?t=msg&goto=502272&#msg_502272

issue.title: [use scan] scope not honored in various report scenarios
issue.description:
Using HEAD.
I ran an API use report with the following settings:
Includes API References: true Includes Internal References: true Includes Illegal Use: true Baseline Location: C:\SDK-I20100115\eclipse Scope Pattern: org\.eclipse\.jface\..* Reference Pattern: org\.eclipse\.debug\..* Report Location: c:\temp\jface-scan\xml API Patterns: None Internal Patterns: None Archive Patterns: None Filter Pattern: None
The report showed *all* API references made by debug.* bundles rather than just those references to jface.*. It also included all references to system library code.

issue.title: [Designer] Outline doesn't refresh by the delete of the last element under a node
issue.description: When we delete the last element under a node in Outline, the tree is not refreshed. It is reproducible with 1.0M3.

issue.title: ProjectComponent should avoid a workspace look-up to find build.properties
issue.description:
Created attachment 156530 [details] proposed fix
I20100115-1100
Currently in our ProjectComponent, when calculating the locations to create classfile containers from we add jar entries from the custom location in build.properties. We do this by looking up the build.properties file in the workspace and using a bunch of internal PDE code to retrieve the entries.
With the changes made to leverage the PDE model for the workspace we have the handle to the IPluginModelBase representing the bundle. We should be using a call to IPluginModelBase.getBuildModel().getBuild(), instead of the search / internal code way we do it now.

issue.title: JIRA workflow transitions not supported
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 3.3.1.v20091215-0000-e3x
I'm not sure if this is a connector bug or a limitation in the JIRA API, but currently I cannot use the JIRA connector for Eclipse because it does not support JIRA workflow transitions.
For example, when changing the "Status" of an issue from "open" to "review" we defined that the field "Assignee" should be modified during transition, for obvious reasons of quality assurance.
This is what happens, when I'm changing an issue in Eclipse: The "Assignee" gets changed and after that the "Status" change fails with an error, stating that the "Assignee" must be modified when changing the "Status". I'm not fully into the API, but I believe, that JIRA requires the changes to be wrapped into one single transaction to succeed.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. create a JIRA workflow transition condition (e.g. Assignee should be changed) 2. open JIRA issue in Eclipse 3. change issue status including necessary transition change (e.g. change Assignee)

issue.title: [General] Papyrus shall provide a documentation view.
issue.description:
In addition to comments we need a dedicated documentation view to give the user the possibility to annotate any model element, graphical or not, UML or not. It can be comments on a UC, but also on a UC Diagram or on an author eAnnotation or on any other data.
The UML comment can be used sometimes for this purpose but it can not address situations when the model element is not UML (diagram or author for instance). So we need to provide a view contextual to the selected element and the data should be stored in a consistent way for any situation : i.e. in an eAnnotation.

issue.title: [General] Papyrus shall improve reuse between diagram editor
issue.description: Currently, every general mechanism available for any diagram (comment, search, stereotype,...) is developped for one diagram and then added to all the other diagrams through modification of the GMFGen model. We really need to work on a "commonGMF" mechanism that would allow to create GMFGen models included in all GMFGen diagram models so that each diagram plugin immediatly benefits from one new feature implemented in this "common" model.

issue.title: [discovery] support installing of multiple features per entry
issue.description: Integrators have requested to add discovery items that consists of multiple connectors, e.g. when multiple repository types need to supported through a single install. It is possible to work around this by creating an aggregating feature that includes other features but that has limitations, e.g. when aggregated features need to be updatable separately. To support this scenario better the data model and extension point schema needs to be extended to allow specification of multiple feature ids per entry.

issue.title: Annotation: need to support array of primitive types
[painting] Possible thread safety issue in AnnotationPainter.getWidgetRange(int, int)
issue.description:
Since R3.3.
Possible thread safety issue in org.eclipse.jface.text.source.AnnotationPainter.getWidgetRange(int, int): there's a small possibility that the code gets called in the non-UI thread, e.g. when a preference is changed in a non-UI thread.

issue.title: [discovery] provide hook for filtering of entries
issue.description:
If the discovery component is used in a particular context it can be desirable to filter visible items. An example would be a discovery directory that contains team and task repository connectors. If the discovery UI is invoked from the the synchronize view only team providers would be displayed whereas when it is invoked form the task list task repository connectors would be displayed.
The discovery viewer should support a viewer filter or a similar filtering facility.

issue.title: Project with JDK 1.6 cannot match with Java facet of 5.0
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
In Eclipse 3.5.1, I have a project with compiler compliance level of 1.6. I noticed a red X on the project, and the only thing I found was in the Problems view, where it said:
"Java compiler level does not match the version of the installed Java project facet."
In "Project Facets", the "Java" facet is set to "5.0". The only other value choices are "1.3" and "1.4".
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [Designer] Delete command is always disabled for Menu in Outline view
issue.description: In Outline view, when we select a Menu, the command "delete" is always disabled. The delete is impossible.

issue.title: Index locked
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 0.6.0.201001162204
I am trying to use EGit in conjunction with standard Git, on the same repositories. Standard Git is used to do the merge and to run git-svn. This works fairly well except when the standard Git needs to update index. In this case, there is always a failure if Eclipse is opened and EGit has been used. I suspect, the index is locked in some way by EGit. Closing Eclipse allows to fix the problem.
Cheers,
Michel
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Commit something with Egit 2.Run git merge or git svn rebase 3.

issue.title: [Backport] Separate the persisted version information from the version labels for translation in XLC UI
issue.description: Backporting the fix in bug 288005 and the NPE fix in bug 300011

issue.title: [efs] FileSystemResourceManager makes second call to efs provider on exception due to cancel
Updated articles are republished on planeteclipse.org
issue.description:
Articles that were published long ago, but updated recently are republished on planeteclipse.org. This is problematic, since updates usually do not warrant republishing. For example, I recently updated an article with a link to a new article that renders the old article content somewhat obsolete. PlanetEclipse now displays both articles.
The Atom feed for the old updated article contains the following XML:
pre. <entry> <id>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-1482979278030787271.post-242174787200674003 </id> <published>2009-05-08T15:49:00.000-07:00</published> <updated>2010-01-19T08:54:17.116-08:00</updated> <category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='SoyLatte' /> <category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='JDK7' /> <category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='Eclipse' /> <category scheme='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#' term='Java 7' /> <title type='text'>Eclipse 3.5 (Galileo) on Java 7</title>
Notice that the @<updated>@ tag has a recent timestamp whereas the @<published>@ tag contains the original timestamp.
RSS for the same article appears as follows:
pre. <item> <guid isPermaLink='false'>tag:blogger.com,1999:blog-1482979278030787271.post-242174787200674003</guid> <pubDate>Fri, 08 May 2009 22:49:00 +0000</pubDate> <atom:updated>2010-01-19T08:54:17.116-08:00</atom:updated> <category domain='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#'>SoyLatte</category> <category domain='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#'>JDK7</category> <category domain='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#'>Eclipse</category> <category domain='http://www.blogger.com/atom/ns#'>Java 7</category> <title>Eclipse 3.5 (Galileo) on Java 7</title>
PlanetEclipse.org should use @<pubDate>@ or @<published>@ to determine when articles should be published.

attachments.attach: the atom feed that caused the issue
the rss feed that caused the issue

issue.title: EGit messes up symlinks (on Windows)
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 0.6.0.201001162204
I have on Git repository mirroring a SVN repository (clone was created with git-svn). This repository contains a tracked symlink. Git has no problem with it: on Windows it is converted as a file with the target as the file contents and there is no change detected by git status. With EGit, at every commit, the symlink is considered as having been changed, if forgetting to uncheck the box in the commit dialog, the symlink is modified as a real file (which is committed back to SVN as a plain file instead of a symlink by git-svn dcommit).
Cheers,
Michel
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Track a symlink (commit it) with standard git command 2.Open EGit commit dialog 3.

issue.title: [JPA2.0] ElementCollection, 1-M, M-M Map UI support
issue.description:
In bug 258490 ElementCollection support for basic and embeddable collections was added. This bug will be for Map support and includes the following features:
map-key map-key-class map-key-column map-key-join-column map-key-attribute-override
AttributeOverride in java supporting "key." and "value."

issue.title: JPA 2.0 schemas are missing in XML Catalog
issue.description:
Build Identifier: org.eclipse.jst.standard.schemas_1.0.300.v200907180416
Both persistence_2_0.xsd and orm_2_0.xsd are missing from XML Catalog.
Currently, the two XSDs are referred to org.eclipse.jpt.core_2.3.0.v200912070000/schema where the files didn't exist.
I think the 2 XSDs should be in org.eclipse.jst.standard.schemas plugin where the persistence_1_0.xsd and orm_1_0.xsd are located.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Select "Window" -> "Preferences" 2. Select "XML" -> "XML Catalog" 3. From the "XML Catalog Entries" windows, scroll down to:
http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/persistence/persistence_2_0.xsd
The entry shows the the XSD is missing. Same problem apply on orm_2_0.xsd.

issue.title: Metamodel generation support for Maps
issue.description: Metamodel generation needs to handle attributes that are of type Map. This will be for 1-m m-m and element collection mappings and will take into account the generic types of the map, the target class, the MapKey, and the MapKeyClass

issue.title: Annotations: need support for attributes of type Enumeration with * multiplicity
issue.description:
I need support for annotation attributes which are of type Enumeration and multiplicity *. If I create such an attribute currently then it is not editable within the properties view. To recreate this issue change the multiplicity of the sex attribute of the Person class within the ecore model of the following project in the Eclipse Tigerstripe CVS:
org.eclipse.tigerstripe/plugins/org.eclipse.tigerstripe.annotation.example.person
Regenerated the genmodel and then generate the model code and include the plugin within a runtime eclipse instance.
You will find the attribute in uneditable.
The desired behaviour is as for attributes of primitive type with * multiplicity, i.e. property view displays comma separated list of enum literals, and the list is abbreviated and "..." added if the list is long. A button, at the end of the property view line, to edit the list (as for MultiLine Strings) that opens a dialg that presents a table of currently entered values with buttons for Add/Remove.

issue.title: [ui] Dialog for missing repository should offer a remove button
issue.description:
Created attachment 156541 [details] screenshot of the current dialog
3.6 M5. The dialog opened when a repository can not be found currently says: "No software site found at <URL>. Do you wish to edit the location" and proposes two choices: Yes / No.
I think it would be useful to instead have the 3 following buttons: Remove / Keep / Edit...

issue.title: [oslc] use CopyOnWriteArraySet in descriptor config
issue.description: ...to prevent concurrent modification exception.

issue.title: [UI] Move "Convert to a Dynamic Web Project" onto project Configure context menu
issue.description:
The action itself might be made redundant by bug 295544, but if not, it should itself be moved into the context menu to follow Platform convention. It should also be limited to the cases where it's actually usable.
<visibility> <not> <or> <objectState name="projectNature" value="??"/> <objectState name="open" value="false"/> </or> </not> </visibility>

issue.title: [expressions][run control][cdi] DSF is missing certain debug actions from editor's context menu
issue.description:
- Start a DSF debug session - Right click in the editor. Notice the following debug actions are missing (these are all available in CDI-GDB):
o Run to line o Move to line o Resume at line o Add Watch Expression...
Please see snapshot for more details.
I use the above actions quite frequently (especially 'Add Watch Expression'). When reading over code in editor, users want to see the value of an expression right away and this action makes it really convenient for them to do that.
The following bugzilla entries have been filed in the past regarding some of these actions:
bug#249165: Resume at line bug#249162: Move to line (or Set PC here)
However, I couldn't find any bugzilla entries for the other actions.

issue.title: Support JQL in the search page for JIRA issues
issue.description:
As of JIRA 4 it's possible to query for issues using JQL: http://blogs.atlassian.com/jira/2009/10/jql.html
With JQL it's possible to create queries that are not possible using traditional search fields. For example, it's possible using JQL to search for issues that I'm watching.

issue.title: 'In Lib Dir' checkbox being ignored when a jar dependency is added to an EAR
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 32
When a jar dependency is added to the EAR in the Java EE Module Dependencies page, a module entry is created in the application.xml, in addition to an entry in the .component file. The entry in the application.xml should not be made if the 'In Lib Dir' checkbox is checked.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: How developers are expected to discover injected values?
Notification needed for a project getting opened
issue.description: The FileChangeManager is not sending change events when a project is opened (and new files are added to the workspace).

issue.title: Lines styles are not fully respected when printing
issue.description:
Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a diagram. 2. Add a shape that supports line width. 3. Set line width to 5. 4. Select File->Print.
Expected: Line width looks the same on the screen as it does when printed.
Actual: Printed line does not look like it has line width 5, it looks just slightly thicker than 1.
Also, if line type is dashed, dashes on the printed version appear to be much closer than on the screen, which makes them difficult to distinguish from solid lines.

issue.title: Version increment for SSE UI
issue.description: Increment SSE UI's minor version for API additions.

issue.title: SWTBotGefEditor.directEditType does not work
issue.description: directEditType is using the wrong bot to find the text widget.

issue.title: [planner] Inconsistent feature patch application
issue.description:
Build Identifier: multiple
Applying a feature patch which updates a previous feature patch behaves differently and across eclipse version 3.4.2, 3.5.1 and 3.6 I20100115 build. The second patch is applied as expected only in 3.4.2 if original feature (not the patched) was installed with install UI and in 3.6 I build when original feature was dropped in.
My expectation was that this would work as expected and behave identical.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: Will attach more detailed steps soon and used plugin/features zipped up. Below is an extended summary what I am seeing.
There are 3 versions of the hello plugin and one hello2 plugin. Each was generated with the hello world eclipse generator but the action was changed so that each one displays a different text in the message box shown when the button is clicked.
These Plugins are: hello_1.0.0.200911201237.jar says 'Hello, Eclipse World' hello_1.0.1.200911201237.jar says 'Hello2, Eclipse World' hello_1.0.1.200911201358.jar says 'Hello3, Eclipse World'
hello2_1.0.0.200911201358.jar says 'Another Hello, Eclipse world plugin'
The original hello 1.0.0.* bundle is packed in feature 'hellofeature'
There are two consecutive feature patches: 1. feature patch hellopatch_1.0.0 which: -> updates hello to hello_1.0.1.200911201237 (msg: 'Hello2,...')
2. an update of that feature patch hellopatch_1.0.1.200911201358.jar which: -> updates hello to hello_1.0.1.200911201358.jar (msg: 'Hello3,...') -> adds hello2 bundle (msg:'Another Hello...')
I tested applying these patches consecutively by dropping them into Eclipse SDK version 3.4.2, 3.5.1 and I build 20100115 of 3.6.
The first patch applied always as I expected, which means that hello bundle was always updated to hello_1.0.1.200911201237.jar which says 'Hello2, Eclipse World'
However the second patch did only apply as expected (having both bundles of second patch active) in 3.4.2, or in 3.6 when the original hellofeature was installed via drop in as well. Here is a summary on how dropping in the second patch behaved.
I: If original hellofeature was installed via install UI: 3.4.2 OK. 3.5.1 second patch did have no effect. 3.6 I second patch did have no effect.
II. If original hellofeature was installed via drop in: 3.4.2 strange mix: original hello bundle and hello2 bundle of second patch 3.5.1 same as 3.4.2 3.6 I OK

attachments.attach: used plugins and features both as drop-ins and p2 sites
.log file showing exceptions mentioned in comment 8

issue.title: Ecore Editor should be able to resolve platform:/plugin URLs from plugins in the target platform
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
When working on related models in separate projects, it would be very helpful to be able to reference models from bundles in the target platform, rather than requiring that shared models be installed into Eclipse itself.
I don't mind that the tooling may not be able to auto-discover models from the target platform, but if the user edits the Ecore and Genmodel files as XML and updates the paths the runtime should at least be able to find them.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create an EMF model (org.example.common), and export it as an installable plug-in 2. Remove org.example.common from your workspace 3. Add org.example.common to your target platform. 4. Create a new EMF model which references the org.example.common model as platform:/plugin/org.example.common/...

issue.title: SWTBotGefEditor setFocus is not implemented
Annotations: Need support for annotations containing EReference of * multiplicity
issue.description:
It should be possible to use Tigerstripe annotation Eclass that contains EReference with multiplicity * to another Eclass.
TAF should allow at least (and possibly at most) one level of EReference with multiplicity * between annotation EClasses.
I'm not totally sure how this * multiplicity would be displayed in the properties view. Possibly as tree in the properties view as happens for EReference with single multiplicity currently, with the instances just numbered. Or it could all be done through a dialog that is opened via a button like that already used on the Multiline String attributes. The dialog could list the instances of the referenced class in a table with the attribute values of an instance displayed when it is selected in the table (with Add and remove buttons).
Which ever way the UI is implemented the referenced class may itself contain attributes of * multiplicity of either primitive or enums type.

issue.title: Any changes that reference detached object will cause detached to be inserted
SSE should protect itself from exceptions in foreign code
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
When BasicStructuredDocument (and really, anytime you call into foreign code) calls _fireDocumentAboutToChange or fireDocumentRewriteSessionEvent) to listeners, you should use SafeRunner to protect against exceptions. A failure in a single listener should not prevent the event from being sent to subsequent listeners.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: "Works With" CQ not showing up in Dali automated IP Log
issue.description:
For some reason my Works With CQ (https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=2775) isn't showing up in the Dali IP Log - http://www.eclipse.org/projects/ip_log.php?projectid=webtools.dali.
It used to show up in the past, but isn't now. This would appear to be an IP Log bug, but perhaps I screwed something up?

issue.title: Platform should specify default sequence table
issue.description:
Currently the default table name defined in TableSequence: public static final String defaultTableName = "SEQUENCE";
Some database platforms (Symfoware) don't allow "SEQUENCE" to be used as a table name. Therefore platform should provide default sequence table name.

issue.title: [ui] Selected site lost in the work with section on page change
issue.description:
3.6 I20100119
Setup: - Eclipse platform binary with out of the box options - Start and add the I build: http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/3.6-I-builds - Let the repo load, make sure you are in "groups items by category" mode - Shutdown
Steps: - Start eclipse - Quickly go to the "Install new software..." option - Select the I build repo from the drop down - Once the content is displayed, select the SWT Tools category - Type in the filter "Java", this reveals some the "Environment description for JavaSE1.6" but we are not interested in this. - Uncheck the "group items by category", this reveals "Eclipse Java Development Tools", select it - Click Next, as soon as the new page arrive, moves back to the previous page and notice that the site is no longer selected
Details: At this point I have only been able to reproduce this as soon as I start eclipse (probably cause repos aren't cached) and the steps have to be executed quickly. I have noticed that if you stay "too long" on the install details page and it has the time to compute the size, then the problem does not occur. At this point I would be tempted to think that this problem occurs when the artifact repos are loaded.

issue.title: [ui] Match not highlighted
issue.description:
3.6 I20100119
The matches of a filter are not highlighted when results are not grouped by items. Steps: - Select the I build site - uncheck the option to group items - Type in Java - Notice that the matches are not highlighted but simply listed.
I just noticed this but it may not be a bug.

issue.title: [CommonNavigator] PipelineShapeModification does not handle all set operations correctly
issue.description: The PipelineShapeModification is associated with a Set that can be manipulated by the user to alter what they want to appear. However not all of the Set operations are correctly supported by the Set's implementation class, ContributorTrackingSet. Either the restrictions on what you can do should be spelled out, or all of the operations should be correctly supported. Examples of unsupported operations are clear() and Iterator.remove().

issue.title: [ui] Drill down in license page is not pretty
issue.description:
Created attachment 156578 [details] License page
3.6 I20100119 I'm installing a product (one IU) that is composed of 10 features licensed under the EPL. Two comments about this: 1) The name of the feature and the version are presented in one column which makes it ugly (see attachment) 2) The dependency information is lost which makes it hard to relate the presence of a license to anything that I'm installing
#1 could be addressed by putting the name and the version in two separate columns #2 could either be added by: a) adding a context menu providing the relation ship to a root for each element (or maybe displaying that at the bottom of the page) b) preserve the tree presented in the install details page, but grey out the elements that are not applicable for a given license. So for example if you had two licenses used by one IU being installed, you would see the tree under each license entry.

issue.title: Performance Improvement: Improve marshal to UTF-8 Output Streams
Reporting of 'out of hardware breakpoint' unclear
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 6.0 (custom build)
If you create more hardware breakpoints than are supported, (for example by typing 'hbreak var1' into GDB console 5 times on x86) and the continue, you get an error. However, the error message box itself does not say you're out of breakpoints and you can only see that information in the details pane of the error message. Some users don't realize they have useful non-technical information in the details pane.
This patch adds exceptions message to the directly shown message, as well as some suggestions to the user.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [ui] Details section is too small
issue.description: 3.6 I20100119 In the default layout out of the box, the details section in most pages is too small. I was wondering about a different layout, but then I realized that changing the default form factor from horizontal to vertical would likely be fine and would also match with the experience using the Mylyn discovery UI.

attachments.attach: Review Licenses page in Install wizard with vertical layout
The same page a bit more narrow

issue.title: Launcher is broken in Photran 6
issue.description: "Run as Fortran Application" does not appear to work in Photran 6/Helios/CDT 6.1.

issue.title: NPE in ResolvedMemberImpl.appendSigWithTypeVarBoundsRemoved
issue.description:
Raised on forum at:
http://forum.springsource.org/showthread.php?t=83371

issue.title: The color of the title of the group control cannot be changed
issue.description:
Created attachment 156587 [details] Code snippet
On my system (windows 7) the title's color of a group cannot be changed but stays black. Especially using setForegroundcolor has no effect. With black background the title is effectively invisible. I believe this to be unwanted behavior.
This issue has been already discussed in a newsgroup thread (http://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php?t=msg&th=160475&start=0&) and could be confirmed by Grant Gayed. I provide a code snippet that shows the behavior.

issue.title: [ui] NPE upgrading SDK
issue.description:
I attempted to upgrade from I20100115 to I20100119. At the end of the upgrade I got an NPE, and then the system froze in the "do you want to restart" dialog. I wasn't able to interact with the dialog and I had to kill the system. After startup things seem to be fine. Note I don't know if the NPE is related to the freeze but in my case they occurred at the same time.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2010-01-19 17:36:56.109 !MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Update validate job". !STACK 0 java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.director.SimplePlanner.updatesFor(SimplePlanner.java:685) at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.operations.UpdateOperation.updatesFor(UpdateOperation.java:135) at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.operations.UpdateOperation.computeProfileChangeRequest(UpdateOperation.java:171) at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.operations.ProfileChangeOperation.makeResolveJob(ProfileChangeOperation.java:157) at org.eclipse.equinox.p2.operations.ProfileChangeOperation.resolveModal(ProfileChangeOperation.java:112) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.ui.sdk.scheduler.AutomaticUpdater.updatesAvailable(AutomaticUpdater.java:96) at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.ui.sdk.scheduler.AutomaticUpdater$6.run(AutomaticUpdater.java:316) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

issue.title: NullPointerException occuring in ProjectClassGenerator
issue.description: A NullPointerException is occurring in the ProjectClassGenerator when attempting to generate a project with a direct map mapping without a direct key field defined. The method addDirectMapMappingLines should perform a null check on the direct key field as it may not be defined.

attachments.attach: the patch adds a null check as was suggested by the filer.

issue.title: eventConsumerJob in org.eclipse.epp.usagedata.internal.gathering.services.UsageDataService is never finished
Reader creates WorkflowContext that causes Xpand generator to fail
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
There are two models, each one described by its own grammar. The first model defines data types and the second one contains entities. The entities model imports the data types by their fully-qualified names. When the generator workflow is executed, it is interrupted with the error message:
5689 INFO CompositeComponent - Generator: generating 'templates::Main::main FOR model' => [] 6299 ERROR AbstractExpressionsUsingWorkflowComponent - Error in Component of type org.eclipse.xpand2.Generator: EvaluationException : No Definition 'templates::Main::main for List' found! [23,38] on line 1 'EXPAND templates::Main::main FOR model'
The WorkflowContext created by the method Reader.invokeInternal() contains a HashMap with loaded models. The values of this HashMap are an ArrayList, whereas the Xpand generator expects a model element in org.eclipse.internal.xpand2.ast.ExpandStatement.evaluateInternal().
When I use FOREACH in the workflow file, the workflow execution doesn't succeed either:
3396 INFO CompositeComponent - Generator: generating 'templates::Main::main FOREACH model' => [] 3941 ERROR AbstractExpressionsUsingWorkflowComponent - Error in Component of type org.eclipse.xpand2.Generator: EvaluationException : No Definition 'templates::Main::main for types::Namespace' found! [23,42] on line 1 'EXPAND templates::Main::main FOREACH model'
That's right because there is only one Xpand template for the entities model and no template for the data types model.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Eclipse fails to start and gives no explanation when using 64 bit eclipse with a 32 bit jvm.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
When using a 64 bit version of eclipse and the 32 bit sun jvm eclipse fails to start and gives no details as to why.
I don't expect 64 bit eclipse to work with a 32 bit jvm but it would be nice if I got some kind of warning instead of the process just terminating itself without printing anything to the terminal session.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install 64 bit eclipse 2. Install 32 bit sun jvm 3. Start eclipse with 'path/to/eclipse/eclipse -vm /path/to/32bit/jvm' from a terminal

issue.title: Mylyn builds have failing test cases
issue.description:
Failing test cases should be the exception, not the rule. Let's improve our process so that builds succeed most of the time.
See this related article "Continuous Integration at Eclipse.org":http://greensopinion.blogspot.com/2009/12/continuous-integration-at-eclipseorg.html that explains some of the rationale.

issue.title: IMasterDetailsRidget - API to update apply button enablement
issue.description:
Sometimes the data in the details area is changed programatically, without event notification. We need a method to trigger a recompute the apply button enablement state.
Adding IMasterDetails.updateApplyButton()
See SnippetMasterDetailsRidget006 for details.

issue.title: [engine][planner] Move ProvisioningPlan Planner details
issue.description: The engine's ProvisioningPlan is currently used to hold details on what happened during Planning. As part of the API cleanup these methods will be moved from IProvisioningPlan and moved to a PlannerStatus in the director. The PlannerStatus can be retrieved by checking and casting the status returned from IProvisioningPlan.getStatus() and can then be queried for the various details of what happened. The engine will also now refuse to perform a plan who's status is an error.

issue.title: [1.5][compiler] Local classes inside enum constants generate default constructor without implicit constructor call
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
When you have an enum constant with a class body, and declare a local class within a method in the enum constant class body, Eclipse generates the default constructor for that local class without the required super() call. The verifier then rightly rejects that class.
See upcoming attached example.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run the attached program in Eclipse, and watch it fail verification. 2. Compile the same program with Sun javac, and watch it run successfully.

attachments.attach: An example program that demonstrates the bug

issue.description: Information in the overview and project page paragraph is painfully out of date and needs to be updated.

issue.title: classpathentry OPTIONAL attribute not honored for var entries
issue.description:
The OPTIONAL attribute for classpath entries doesn't appear to work for variable classpath entries.
For example, we'd like to use the following entry in our classpath file: <classpathentry kind="var" path="ECLIPSE_INSTALL/plugins/org.apache.ant_1.7.0.v200803061910/lib/ant.jar"> <attributes> <attribute name="optional" value="true"/> </attributes> </classpathentry>
Basically, we want our projects to use this classpath entry if the ECLIPSE_INSTALL variable is defined. But if it's not, then we still want the project to compile.
We'd like the OPTIONAL attribute on variable entries to work the same way it does for source entries. For example: <classpathentry kind="src" path="bar"> <attributes> <attribute name="optional" value="true"/> </attributes> </classpathentry>
If the folder "bar" doesn't exist, the project will still compile.

issue.title: [transport] Proxy details set within Eclipse are ignored by 'Install New Software'
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
Proxy setting in Eclipse are ignored for 'Install New Software'.
In order to run 'Install New Software' behind a web proxy you must set the environment variables http_proxy=http://<host>:<port> and possibly ftp_proxy=http://<host>:<port>. Authentication must also be specified in the environment variables.
Seems pointless to have proxy setings that are ignored.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Set proxy settings in Eclipse correctlly 2. Attempt to Install New Software 3. Eclipse fails to download repository information. 4. Exit Eclipse 5. Set environment variables http_proxy & ftp_proxy 6. Reload Eclipse 7. Attempt to install new software.

issue.title: [widgets] TreeItem.getTextBounds() returns width of longest visible item
issue.description:
I call this on selection on different TreeItems and the only time the width changes is on expansion or contraction if the expansion or contraction makes a different in the total width of all TreeItems (which are in the viewport or not).
I'm using TreeItem.getTextBounds() to determine the end location of the text (to draw a graphic).
Previously I used TreeItem.getBounds() which on Linux and Windows corresponded to the actual text width, however on Cocoa it's the entire width of the tree.
Let me know if you need a snippet and I can make one.
I suppose a workaround (and probably even a better implementation for what I'm trying to do) for my problem is to listen to the Paint event and draw the line there based on the data in the event (like Snippet220).

issue.title: [common.types] Provide additional functionality for types
issue.description: In Xbase type inference sometimes needs to find the common assignable type for a list of types. Therefore we need to retrieve the super types for a type. Based on that we should provide services like e.g. isAssignableFrom().

issue.title: Support remote cross referencing with a convenient API on the client and SPI on the server for the stores to implement
issue.description:
It would be great to extend CDO with the possibility to query all the objects referencing a certain object. The so-called crossreferencing (or xref) functionality.
Using the model available on the server it is possible to determine for each EClass what queries are needed to retrieve the referencing objects.
A thing to consider is how to handle larger volumes of referencing objects. It is clearly possible that multiple queries are needed to retrieve all cross referencers so it can be difficult to implement paging or sublist behavior. So maybe the client api can pass in a max number of returned objects.
To support xref I think we need: - an api and convenience method on the client - a server side api definition - implementation of this functionality in each store
Eike and others let me know if you have any comments or feedback on this.
Thanks!
Martin T.

attachments.attach: Utility class retrieving cross referencers by CDOQuery

issue.title: Monospace fonts in mediawiki editor look strange
issue.description:
We examined the WikiText mediawiki editor for documentation purposes, but in Windows machines we got an interesting formatting of preformatted text (that gets a monospace font-family): it becomes very large, and does not seem to respond to changing font-size (even to 1%).
This type of output was present on a Windows XP machine, a similar, but less obtrusive one on Windows Vista, while on Mac OSX the monospace font looked as expected.
We are interested whether a default setting is not appropriate (e.g. we did not found a font setting), or something in the Wikitext editor did go wrong.
Thanks for your help.

issue.title: In development mode, real bundle class path is inconsistent with bundle classpath header
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
Wenn deploying a bundle to Equinox in PDE, care is taken, that the bundle classpath is adjusted. For instances, the "bin" folder of the project is included in the bundle classpath, with the help of the "dev.properties" file.
So far so good.
But this bundle classpath is inconsistent with the bundle classpath header then, which can be queried by bundleContext.getBundle().getHeaders().get(Constants.BUNDLE_CLASSPATH).
Thus, framework that rely on this way to get the bundle classpath, will fail. (AFAIK, there is no other way to get bundle classpath...)
An example is Spring for dynamic modules: To support classpath component scanning it uses the bundle classpath header. In development mode, this will always fail, since it is only the root directory, but not "bin".
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create some bundle 2. In the activator, get the bundle classpath header by bundleContext.getBundle().getHeaders().get(Constants.BUNDLE_CLASSPATH) 3. Run the bundle with PDE. You will see, the bundle classpath header is inconsistent with real bundle classpath (which includes "bin" folder)

issue.title: 'Export > Deployable plug-ins > Install into host' does not offer default repository
issue.description:
I20100119-0800
'Export > Deployable plug-ins > Install into host' does not offer the default repository any more after the repository has been changed manually.
The first time, the default is: <workspace>/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/install/
You could add a button to set the default, or simply set the default when the combo loses focus and is empty. Or at least add the default to the combo list all the time.

issue.title: Rename or move file must execute "svn move" not "svn delete + svn add"
issue.description:
Build Identifier: Eclipse Platform Version: 3.5.1 Build id: M20090917-0800
If I rename or drug and drop file in Navigator window in console I see svn delete and svn add command. This not right behavour becouse the history of file changes is lost (After svn add file become as new).
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open project. (I use Perl Epic) 2. Select file in "Navigator" window and press F2 3. In "Rename Resource" dialog write new name and press OK 4. In "Console" window you can see `svn delete` command 5. Or if you attempt commit folder contain this file (right mouse click on folder -> Team -> Commit...) in change log you can see `<old_filename> Deleted` and `<new_filename> Added` commands.

issue.title: [Combo] Item is deselected but the text remains visible
PathEntryManager.processDelta() does not process all deltas
issue.description: When multiple projects are deleted in one operation, the root delta contains REMOVE deltas for all deleted projects, but only the first project delta is processed. One impact of this is that stale path entry information for the other projects remain in the various maps of the PathEntryManager.

issue.title: [formatter] Java source formatting of a section or a project failes when /*"*/ is inside a string concat
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
When a java file contains the line:
String s="X"+/*"*/"Y";
then this section cannot be formatted with shift-control-F or menu source-Format. Even worse: when using Menu source->Format on multiple projects or working set this small line completely cancels the formatting action. Therefore the bug is not just a minor one but has massive impact on the formatting feature which cannot be reasonably used anymore when having such sections in the source code.
The code snippet that causes this effect can of course be written differentlly, but anyway the code snippet is valid java code, compiles correctly and conforms to the java syntax rules.
The exception log follows: eclipse.buildId=M20090917-0800 java.version=1.6.0_10 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_CH Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -console -consoleLog -debug -clean

issue.description:

""" grammar org.xtext.example.MyDsl with org.eclipse.xtext.common.Terminals

Model: b = B;
B: "$b"; """

error(111): .../org.xtext.example.mydsl.ui/src-gen/org/xtext/example/contentassist/antlr/internal/InternalMyDsl.g:32:10: reference to attribute outside of a rule: b

issue.title: Shell computeTrim returns a wrong result
Unhandled event loop exception
issue.description:
Working with the FormEditor, and adding objects from the Forms ToolKit Items, give very often refresh errors and in the worst cases the objects in the editor become uneditable. The Java beans view page that usually shows the structure, becomes truncated at a high level (in the hierarchy) composite, no object is visible under it (I presume therefore no element becomes editable).
I tried: restarting the file, restarting eclipse and recreating the workspace but does not seem to solve anything. The only workaround that worked (which actually is not), was redo everything from scratch. (quite bad I think).

issue.title: Marker Example - Bottom buttons in MarkerSubModuleView not hidden
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
== Symptom ========== When the hidden checkbox at the top of the view is selected, all hidable controls shall be hidden. Currently, the 'Push' button as well as two radio buttons and a checkbox button remain visible.
In Riena, push buttons mapped to an IActionRidget are not markable and therefore cannot be hidden (because this is done through hidden markers). So it is expected behavior for the 'Push' button not to be hidden.
However, the radio and check buttons to the right of the 'Push' button *should* be hidden.
== Reason ========== I looked into this and found that the push button's presence meant that there was a corresponding null entry in the 'markables' array field inside MarkerSubModuleController.HiddenActionListener. This led to an uncaught NPE that aborted the loop over all ridgets to be hidden, and therefore setVisible(false) was never called on the remaining ridgets (i.e. the radio and checkbox buttons).
== Solution (see attachment) ========== * I added a check on null in the loop over the markables array to fix the bug in the example client. * As it seems, I am not the first (and most probably not the last) to stumble upon the 'Push' button's stubborn visibility. I therefore added a descriptive label below the button in question explaining that this is expected behavior, and why.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start example client demo. 2. Playground -> Playground -> Marker 3. Click 'hidden' checkbox. 4. Radio buttons and checkbox button (at the very bottom of the view) are still visible.

attachments.attach: Fixes the bug and adds an explanatory label to the view.

issue.title: Reorder of items in ToolBar and Menu doesn't reflect in Renderer
issue.description: When we DnD of ToolItem or MenuItem in outline of e4 Designer, the designer refreshes with a wrong result. For example, if we have two items: Open and Save in order. When we change the order to Save and Open by moving Save, in Renderer we have only Open.

attachments.attach: Patch to fix up menu/tb reordering handling
Patch to hack the Contacts demo to show the moving of menu/tb items

issue.title: [Browser] Problem with refreshing pages in internal web browser when IE8 installed
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20091210-1301
Internal web browser has sometimes problem with refresh its content when open new page. Moreover this problem disappears when you click "refresh" button. I have observed such situation when IE8 installed but some people noticed on older versions of IE. Generally caching some content is normal behaviour of IE. When you try to open any site in IE and then open it in new window or tab you will get cached version. But when we are developing web application and want to test it, this action is inexpedient.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create new dynamic web project and add index.html file in WebContent directory. 2. Right click on index.html file. Select "Run as -> Run on Server". You should see html file in your internal browser. 3. Modify index.html content. Select "Run as -> Run on Server" again. You get old content of file.

issue.title: ToolBar width is fixed
issue.description:
A problem is observed during the test of e4 Designer in Windows.
1. Create a project using e4 Wizard with the defaut setting 2. Open Application.e4xmi with e4 Designer 3. Open Outline View and Properties View 4. Select the ToolItem of Open 5. In Properties View, put a text in the property "label"
The ToolItem "Save" gets disappeared in designer. If you select it in Outline, you can find it under the "Open".

issue.title: Author name for Bredex Blog
issue.description:
Would it be possible to change the author name for the RSS feed from "blog.bredex.de" to "Bredex Team" or the to actual author of the entry? At the moment, my name appears, even when the entry was written by someone else.
Thanks for your help! Alex

issue.title: HttpClients opens too many connections that are immediately closed
issue.description: When running some load generation (for example for CometD), and capturing the traffic with WireShark, it is evident that HttpClient opens a connection to close it just immediately afterwards. This lead to unwanted resource consumption (for example after a while connections cannot be assigned anymore) and confuses the Linux kernel which thinks it's under a SYN flood attack.

issue.title: Repeatedly executed action site.p2
issue.description:
Steps to reproduce: Use the attached 'mail' standalone example project and execute the following Buckminster commands:
importtargetdefinition -A ${WORKSPACE}/com.example.mail.site/rcp.target import ${WORKSPACE}/com.example.mail.site/site.cquery build perform com.example.mail.site#site.p2 perform -D target.os=win32 -D target.ws=win32 -D target.arch=x86 com.example.mail.site#create.product.zip perform -D target.os=win32 -D target.ws=win32 -D target.arch=x86_64 com.example.mail.site#create.product.zip
The target site.p2 will be executed repeatedly, including compiling the sources multiple times (see attached build log).

issue.title: [Model] Need a solution to enforce the model integrity regarding UI
issue.description:
According the current Workbench UI model, the integrity control is not strength enough. It allows users to make easily some mistakes. Here is an example in e4 newgroups: http://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php?t=msg&th=160989&start=0&
The menu can be inserted in any MElementContrainer in references "children".
There are other cases such as ToolItem and MenuItem can be child only in ToolBar and Menu/MenuItem respectively.
Without an integrity control, the tool is very hard to use.

issue.title: Expose convert to faceted form action from configure menu
issue.description:
Created attachment 156638 [details] ConvertToFacetHandler
Bug 295544 introduces functionality that should be available from the Configure submenu in the context menu.
A first-pass implementation could look like:
<extension point="org.eclipse.ui.commands"> <command categoryId="org.eclipse.ui.category.file" defaultHandler="org.eclipse.example.ConvertToFacetHandler" id="org.eclipse.example.convertToFacets" name="Convert Project to Faceted Form"> </command> </extension> <extension point="org.eclipse.ui.menus"> <menuContribution locationURI="popup:org.eclipse.ui.projectConfigure?after=additions"> <command commandId="org.eclipse.example.convertToFacets" style="push"> <visibleWhen checkEnabled="false"> <and> <count value="1"/> <iterate ifEmpty="false" operator="and"> <adapt type="org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject"/> </iterate> </and> </visibleWhen> </command> </menuContribution> </extension>
The visibleWhen could be extended with a test if you need a specific project nature before you can turn it into a project that understands facets: <adapt type="org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource"> <test property="org.eclipse.core.resources.projectNature" value="the.nature.you.expect"/> </adapt>
http://wiki.eclipse.org/Command_Core_Expressions describes some more project properties that can be tested.
PW
