issue.title: [design] pulldown menus do not work
issue.description: When setting a menu contribution's style to "pulldown" and adding new items to it using menu:xxx locationURI, the contributed items are not shown.

issue.title: Compare Editor discards changes in local java file in Team Synchronization perspective (using SVN).
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090621-0832
It's not possible to use compare Editor in Team Synchronization perspective because if you open an changed *.java-File with the Compare Editor the local file will be reverted back automatically to the latest version of the file in the repository (we are using SVN).
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.edit a *.java file which is already checked in Subversion 2.save file 3.switch to Team Synchronization perspective 4.synchronze project with SVN in den Synchronize-View 4.double click on the file in den Synchronize-View to open compare Editor --> the changes are lost, the file ist marked as edited and compare Editor shows no differences (it shows the latest checked in version of the file on both sides of its compare view)

issue.title: Messages from svn shows incorrectly
issue.description:
Build Identifier: Eclipse Platform Version: 3.5.1 Build id: M20090917-0800
I have some hooks in svn repository and during commit in console I get some message like: svn commit -m"MY_TIKET-100 Test"
Sending trunk/htdocs/js/field/integrated.js Transmitting file data ..svn: Commit failed (details follow): svn: Commit blocked by pre-commit hook (exit code 255) with output: trunk/scripts/once/check_client_1_to_2_difference.pl: 69: Too long string length (90)
But if I send commit from eclipse I only see:
Some of selected resources were not committed. svn: Error while dispatching event: org.eclipse.team.svn.core.connector.ISVNProgressMonitor.reportError(Ljava/lang/String;)V
I want to see original svn message like in first example (console).
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. If you have restricted hooks in your repository, just send commit some wrong file. 2. Maybe try to send commit with wrong parameters.

issue.title: Custom file hiding filters in Project Explorer
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
When building a library with automake it generates intermediate files that are not covered by any, in CDT, existing file filter. For example, .Plo and .lo. It would be nice to be able to filter them out to decrease the number of files visible in the file tree.
The best thing would be the possibility to add new filters to the list. (Customize view..)
Second best alternative is to offer an edit box where one can put a comma-separated list of filters. Like for Package Explorer in JDT.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: XSL run configuration should allow selecting *.* files
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
When selecting the XML input file to run an XSL Transformation, the file chooser only allows the selection of files who are explicitly declared as XML files in the General/Content Types preference.
It would be more user-friendly if the chooser allowed the selection of files with any extension (*.*) as a workaround.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Line:Column information missing for errors logged due SAX parse exception when reading TOC
issue.description:
Created attachment 156646 [details] debug options for my infocenter
Build ID: I20091210-1301 (Eclipse 3.6m4)
I launch a headless infocenter with debugging enabled (see attached doc.options file, which I pass on the commandline via -debug doc.options). I see this in the workspace/.metadata/.log file:
!MESSAGE Error reading help table of contents file /"com.windriver.ide.doc.wr_gnu_compiler_linux/wr_gnu_compiler_using_gnu_compiler_collection_linux_4.3/html/wr_gnu_toc.xml, URL = file:/net/szg-rhfs/szg-rhfs03/t5-dev/daily_WB/201001200813/test_WB/docs/extensions/eclipse/plugins/com.windriver.ide.doc.wr_gnu_compiler_linux/wr_gnu_compiler_using_gnu_compiler_collection_linux_4.3/html/wr_gnu_toc.xml" (skipping file) !STACK 0 org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The entity "mdash" was referenced, but not declared.
and find it problematic identifying the exact location where SAX thinks that "mdash" was referenced. I think that Eclipse should know the location, since I see this on stdout of my infocenter:
[Fatal Error] :14:55: The entity "mdash" was referenced, but not declared.
and in fact the issue is on line 14 column 55 of the referenced file. Since Eclipse knows the exact location, I think it should be logged (like it is for errors during indexing).

issue.title: Renderer fails by moving of the Part in PartSashContainer
issue.description:
Suppose we have the folliwng elements in outline view of e4 Designer, Windows WindowTrim PartSashContainer PartStack Part - Main Part - Other Menu
When you move Part - Other over PartSashContainer, we get Windows WindowTrim PartSashContainer PartStack Part - Main Part - Other Menu
PartSashContainer has two children: PartStack and Part - Other. In the Designer, we can see only PartStack. When you save it and reopen it, you will get the Part - Other under PartStack.

issue.title: Add code formatting as an option in Editor Save Actions.
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
JDT has an option to trigger code formatting when saving a source file. This is great when a project tries to maintain the same formatting in all source files but people forgets to press Ctrl+Shift+F in order to format the file before saving.
Would it be possible to add this for CDT too?
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: When a project is not part of a train, add a visual clue to the translation tool
issue.description:
Created attachment 156647 [details] Screenshot
This is an idea I got from this forum post: http://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php?t=msg&th=161000&start=0&
In the translation tool, it is possible for translators to contribute without the project even being included in a release train. In the case above, CDT 6.0 was not associated with Galileo, and therefore the language packs were not being built.
See attachment. Putting a small visual clue directly in the tool, which would indicate that the project is not properly configured (and would link to opening a bug against Babel), would help avoid this.

issue.title: [Core] dispose() is not call on services
issue.description: The dispose method is not called on services when the main editor is disposed. Need to call the service.dispose() from the CoreEditor.

issue.title: Delete a Part fails SWTException
issue.description:
Created attachment 156649 [details] delete testcase
1. Load the attached file in e4 Designer 2. Select the Part - Other under Window (2nd Child) 3. Right click to get context menu and the select delete or cut
We get the following exception:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed Execute command error: at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:4068) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3983) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3954) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:467) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:340) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.getBounds(Control.java:1110) at org.eclipse.e4.workbench.ui.renderers.swt.TrimmedPartLayout.layout(TrimmedPartLayout.java:140) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.updateLayout(Composite.java:1237) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.updateLayout(Composite.java:1223) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.layout(Composite.java:626) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.layout(Composite.java:584) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.layout(Composite.java:547) at org.eclipse.e4.tools.ui.designer.E4UIRenderer.layout(E4UIRenderer.java:172) at org.eclipse.e4.tools.ui.designer.E4UIRenderer.access$2(E4UIRenderer.java:166) at org.eclipse.e4.tools.ui.designer.E4UIRenderer$1.notifyChanged(E4UIRenderer.java:157) at org.eclipse.e4.tools.ui.designer.E4UIEventPublisher.dispatchPublishedEvent(E4UIEventPublisher.java:75) at org.eclipse.e4.tools.ui.designer.E4UIEventPublisher.notifyChanged(E4UIEventPublisher.java:64) at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.BasicNotifierImpl.eNotify(BasicNotifierImpl.java:280) at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotificationImpl.dispatch(NotificationImpl.java:1033) at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotificationImpl.dispatch(NotificationImpl.java:1038) at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.remove(NotifyingListImpl.java:724) at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.AbstractEList.remove(AbstractEList.java:466) at org.eclipse.e4.tools.ui.designer.commands.DeleteCommand.execute(DeleteCommand.java:37)
In our DeleteCommand, we call: container.getChildren().remove(eObject);

issue.title: Invisible closing brace after "new" statement
[Subversive] - Bug report ID-XBNJF
PlatformURLPluginConnection#parse fails to load bundle with underscore in Bundle-SymbolicName
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 0.9.0.I20100114-2115
If a project name contains an underscore the applicationXMI file (specified in the plugin.xml) cannot be resolved when launching the product.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. In the menu select 'e4' -> 'Generate Example Project', Import Project Set 2. Open 'org.eclipse.e4.demo.contacts/contacts.product', click 'Launch an Eclipse application', app launches fine 3. Select 'org.eclipse.e4.demo.contacts', 'Refactor' -> 'Rename' to 'org.eclipse.e_4.demo.contacts' 4. Open 'plugin.xml', change value of the 'applicationXMI' property to 'org.eclipse.e_4.demo.contacts/Application.e4xmi' 5. Open the launch configuration, select the 'org.eclipse.e_4.demo.contacts.product' (Main tab) and the 'org.eclipse.e_4.demo.contacts' plugin (Plug-ins tab), click 'Run'
The application does not start, reporting a java.io.IOException: Unable to resolve plug-in "platform:/plugin/org.eclipse.e_4.demo.contacts/Application.e4xmi"

attachments.attach: Unit test, requires the original contacts demo in addition to the renamed one described above.

issue.title: Fix drawing of solid polygons
issue.description: Draw2d's Graphics interface allows the drawing of arbitrarily shaped solid polygons. OpenGL does not support this natively, so these polygons must be tesselated into proper triangles that can be handled natively by OpenGL.

issue.title: [ui] Dependency not shown in the installed details page when children is part of the request
issue.description:
I20100119
From the helios repo, if I choose to install the Mylyn Connector: bz and Mylyn wiki text, I can see "Mylyn task list" is installed because of the dependencies (see attached screenshot).
If I add to the set of things to install the "Mylyn task list", then there is no more drill down in the installed details and I can't really see that in the end I did not really needed to install the Mylyn task list explicitely.

attachments.attach: Picture showing the drill down when Mylyn Task list is not requested for install
Picture showing the absence of drill down when Mylyn Task list is requested for install

issue.title: New Job for amalgam
issue.description:
Please setup a new job for the amalgam project named :
cbi-amalgam-helios
with commiter id : cbrun
The code will be kept in CVS.
I don't know yet what we'll do with the former amalgam build jobs, I'll check if we can delete them soon to cleanup hudson a bit...
Thanks

issue.title: Add ctr+w - Select successively increasing code blocks - from intellij idea
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
One of the killer features in IDEA is the CTR+W shortcut that successively selects increasing code blocks in a very smart way.
Eclipse doesn't seem to support this so here is the feature request
"Ctrl+W/Ctrl+Shift+W When it comes to precisely selecting a value, expression, statement or any other block of code, these shortcuts are a real killer. Just try it to see how quicker it works than traditional Ctrl+Shift+NavKeys combo."
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Generate source features and bundles
issue.description: Our build process should generate features and bundles and deploy them to the update site.

issue.title: Tree in ScrolledComposite on OSX Cocoa does not scroll with mouse wheel
issue.description:
This is the same problem as in bug 246137.
See this attachment for the snippet that shows the problem:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=156660

issue.title: [Snippets] Snippet296 Double scrolls on Linux
issue.description:
The change for Snippet296 in revision 1.6 causes the scrolling to move twice as fast as normal on Linux GTK (however it "fixes" scrolling issues on Windows and OSX).
See bug 246137.

issue.title: [ui] install history not refreshed properly after deletion of entry
issue.description:
Created attachment 156661 [details] Picture of the problem
I20100119
Steps: - Open the install history - Select two entries in the list and delete - Notice the list now contains duplicate entries (e.g. current installations, see screenshot)

issue.title: bad interaction between Table and a Canvas with SWT.TRANSPARENT
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
when a Canvas with SWT.TRANSPARENT is drawn somewhere on the shell, the table scrollbars become very slow (they use much CPU resources, hang sometimes at scrolling). This happens although there is no connection between the Canvas and the Table (they are not drawn over each other); it seems that the table scroll triggers some unnecessary redraw on the Canvas. This problem does not occur with other scrollbars like the ones created from ScrolledForm.
Note: This bug may be specific to Windows XP.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Execute the Code snippet attached 2. Scroll the table a little bit, observing the UI response time and the CPU resources (e.g. in the Windows Taskmanager) 3. comment out the content of the method createCanvas and do 1. and 2. again 4. the UI should now response much faster, much less CPU resources are used now

issue.title: version of org.eclipse.equinox.p2.user.ui feature in 3.6 stream
issue.description:
The version compare tool is reporting that the version of org.eclipse.equinox.p2.user.ui feature should be 2.0.0. Looking at the plugins in the feature, there are indeed some 2.0.0 versions. Not sure what do to here because incrementing the version of this feature will cascade up to other features. Should this be ignored in the version compare tool?
<Info Code="1" Message="The version of the feature (id: "org.eclipse.equinox.p2.user.ui"; version: "1.2.0.v20100115-1055-837BFivFdHjNz-AkJAiX6iX_"; location: "/buildtest/I20100119-0800/eclipse-testing/test-eclipse/eclipse/releng/eclipse/features/org.eclipse.equinox.p2.user.ui_1.2.0.v20100115-1055-837BFivFdHjNz-AkJAiX6iX_/feature.xml") should be at least "2.0.0"."/>

issue.title: New Class wizzard should be able to create a class in enclosing method
issue.description:
New Class wizzard in Eclipse should be able to define a class in an enclosing method of a class. It is perfectly OK to do in Java standard, so it should be in new class wizzard.
New class wizzard should have another checkbox with enclosing method where a user could select a method where new class would be placed.
About source code placement of this new class, it should be ABOVE any references to this new class, if a class was created using Quick-Fix wizzard complaining about a class not found. I don't know why Eclipse enforces this, I think that class placement should be irelevant.
This should be a quick fix.
-- Configuration Details -- Product: Eclipse 1.2.1.20090812-1036 (org.eclipse.epp.package.jee.product) Installed Features: org.eclipse.jdt 3.5.1.r351_v20090810-0600-7r88FEoFI0WTo6Az-1qFRHm37ChJ

issue.title: IndirectList, IndirectSet, IndirectMap and NonSynchronizedVector should be 'generified'
issue.description:
Created attachment 156663 [details] first pass at 'generifying' EclipseLink's Indirect collections
should be:
public class IndirectList<E> ... IndirectMap<K,V>

attachments.attach: first pass at 'generifying' EclipseLink's Indirect collections

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Use native Synchronize naming for actions
issue.description:
Branch "branch_20091215_bug236169"
Initially we though renaming "Merge" to "Apply" was a good idea, as this is how the action is named in the apply patch world. We changed our minds, we will stick to the native Synchronize naming. The same thing applies to "Remove from View" which we though should be named as "Exclude", we will leave it as it is.

issue.title: [CommonNavigator] Popup menu items cannot be created in Project Explorer using the Command Framework
issue.description:
I tried to define a command in the popup menu of the Project Navigator using the following xml descriptor:
<menuContribution locationURI="popup:org.eclipse.ui.navigator.ProjectExplorer"> <menu label="Test"> <command commandId="com.optxware.commanddemo.helloworld" style="push"> </command> </menu> </menuContribution>
Using this descriptor no contribution item appeared. By replacing the ''popup'' part with ''menu'', it appeared in the menu of the view, as expected. By replacing the view ID with the JDT's Package Explorer (org.eclipse.jdt.ui.PackageExplorer), both the ''popup'' and the ''menu'' contributions were created as expected.
Do you have any idea what might have gone wrong? Thank you for your help.

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Merging a file with an unmatched hunk results in other hunks marked as conflicts
issue.description:
Branch "branch_20091215_bug236169"
Steps: 1. Synchronize with a patch that contains file with matched and unmatched hunks. 2. Do 'Merge' on the file. => Matched hunks are applied but a second later they are marked as conflicts in the Sync view.

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] 'Merge' and 'Mark as merged' individual hunks
issue.description: Once bug 236169 is fixed, we should consider adding an option to apply individual hunks displayed in the Sync View. Current implementation proposed in bug 298923 allows to apply changes for a single file, but does not let you apply single hunk.

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Inform when project from patch is not accessible
issue.description:
Branch "branch_20091215_bug236169", but soon in HEAD (bug 298923).
User should be informed that project from a patch is not accessible (doesn't exist, is closed, etc). Current implementation in the branch will not display the project. This may be acceptable when applying a patch for a single project (user will get a suspicious message saying the patch contains no changes), but for multiple projects this may result in omitting part of the patch without noticing it.

issue.title: [common.types] BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException if the targeted compilation unit doesn't compile
issue.description:
If a TypeResource is created for a Java Class that doesn't compile (in my scenario, its super-type wasn't available), the resource-object is created flawlessly, but its contents remains empty.
This leads to the exception quoted below when getEObject() is called.
It would be good to have some kind of protocol to notify the code which is using the TypeResource about the invalid state of the referenced Java stuff.
I observed this behavior in an Xtext-version from 2009-12-17. If it has changed in the meantime, let me know.
Caused by: org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException: index=0, size=0 at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.get(BasicEList.java:352) at org.eclipse.xtext.common.types.access.impl.AbstractClassMirror.getEObject(AbstractClassMirror.java:60) at org.eclipse.xtext.common.types.access.TypeResource.getEObject(TypeResource.java:36)

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Add 'Open' and 'Open With' actions to elements in Patch Contents model
issue.description: Elements displayed in Patch Contents model to not have 'Open' and 'Open With' actions available in the context menu. This is something that has to be fixed.

issue.title: [ui] Install always runs in background
issue.description:
I20100119-0800
1) Ensure "run in background" preference is *not* selected 2) Install something from the install dialog
-> The install always runs in the background. This is a regression - the install used to run in the foreground when "run in background" was not checked. It looks like the "user" bit isn't being set on the install job.

issue.title: Missing artifacts installing Eclipse XML editing tools
issue.description:
I20100119-0800
- Started with Eclipse SDK - Opened Helios repository - Selected "Eclipse XML Editors and Tools" and clicked install
The following errors occurred in the install. I'm not yet sure if this is a problem with the Helios repository or a bug in p2 that it's not properly retrying mirrors.
An error occurred while collecting items to be installed session context was:(profile=SDKProfile, phase=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.engine.phases.Collect, operand=, action=). Unpacking fails because intermediate file is empty: C:\DOCUME~1\jarthorn\LOCALS~1\Temp\work1263394807020419787\p2.optimizers.incoming4050162642111091193.jar

issue.title: [Undo] TriggeredOperations should implement IAdvancedUndoableOperation2
issue.description:
Created attachment 156672 [details] Fix
HEAD
org.eclipse.core.commands.operations.TriggeredOperations should implement IAdvancedUndoableOperation2.
In bug 291787, I tried to push the execution of refactoring changes to the background by letting our UndoableOperation2ChangeAdapter implement IAdvancedUndoableOperation2. When the Undo command is invoked, such a change adapter is being used as triggeringOperation in a TriggeredOperations, but the runInBackground() is not being forwarded to my adapter.
The attached patch implements this. The fix for bug 291787 does not work without this fix, but since it does not harm either, I've already released it.

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Refresh compare editor contents on local resource change
issue.description:
Branch "branch_20091215_bug236169", but soon in HEAD (bug 298923).
Compare editor opened for an element from Patch Contents model does not react to changes made to local resources. Once opened it displays the same content even when a file has changed in the meantime.

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Fix all major issues related to compare editor opened for Apply Patch synchronization
issue.description:
Branch "branch_20091215_bug236169"
This bug gathers all major issues listed in on the wiki[1] that are related to compare editor opened from Patch Contents model.
[1] http://wiki.eclipse.org/Apply_patch_in_Sync_view#Compare_editor_for_Patch_Contents_model

issue.title: [EditorMgmt] FileEditorMapping needs to implement hashCode(), and improve clone() and equals()
issue.description: See bug 236104 comment 4.

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Compare editor for an element from Patch Contents model opens empty
issue.description:
Branch "branch_20091215_bug236169", but soon in HEAD (bug 298923).
'Open in Compare Editor' for a patch file displays hunks in the structure view, which is fine. The problem is that initially first hunk is selected and nothing is displayed in the compare content area.

issue.title: [EditorMgmt] Create tests for bug 236104

issue.title: Launching of RCP products using Java Web Start (JWS) is not possible
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
After the migration from 3.3 I ran in several problems trying to launch the branded RCP application (product) over using Java Web Start. After changing the corresponding attributes in the JNLP file (launcher JAR, launcher main class) the following exception is delivered:
!SESSION 2010-01-20 16:34:08.421 ------------------- eclipse.buildId=unknown java.version=1.6.0_17 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 4 0 2010-01-20 16:34:09.625 !MESSAGE Application error !STACK 1 java.lang.RuntimeException: No application id has been found. at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer.startDefaultApp(EclipseAppContainer.java:236) at ... After some reasearch I found that the org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppContainer is looking for the branding oinformation and for the application information. Espcially I could observe the following confusing behavior:
1. the eclipse.product property inside of the resources block of JNLP file pointing to the product-id: the exception above is delivered 2. the eclipse.application property inside of the resources block of JNLP file pointing to the application-id: the exception above is delivered 3. both properties eclipse.product and eclipse.application set inside of resources block: the application (without branding) is started 4. the "-product product-id" is passed using two argument elements of the application-desc element of the JNLP file: theapplication (without branding) is started.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Follow instructions for "Deploying Eclipse-based application with Java Web Start" in PDE Help.

issue.title: Outlined and solid polygons do not match
issue.description: Often, a GEF 2D figure will draw itself by first drawing a solid polygon (rectangle or circle for example) and then drawing an outline over the solid shape. In GEF, the outline and the solid polygon are perfectly matched up, while in GEF3D, the outline is slightly offset by a few pixels. This can only be noticed when zooming close to the shape, but it should be fixed nevertheless.

issue.title: [Wizard] Generate abstract/concrete WSDL definitions
issue.description:
The New WSDL file wizard currently generates an "all in one" WSDL definition. This definition file contains both the abstract (types, messages, port type) and concrete (bindings, services) components. In order to maximize the re-use of the abstract components, customers tend to split the two set of components in two or more WSDL definition files. This allows them to create additional bindings/services that re-use the port type definition.
This enhancement will modify the New WSDL wizard to provide support for generating two WSDL definitions: an abstract one and a concrete one.

issue.title: ImageStore should support pathes to images

issue.description: It should be possible to specify post-actions on the element creation, to update the semantic element. For example, an association could be created with aggregation style on one of its end

issue.title: [Palette] Palette Customisation should allow graphical element customization on creation
issue.description: It should be possible to specify post-actions on the element creation, to update the graphical element. For example, element could display stereotypes using icon style instead of text style

issue.title: Automatic different datasource testing on server

issue.title: SWT_AWT bridge and a Transparent Composite cause 100% cpu
issue.description:
Created attachment 156693 [details] Repro case.
In our application, I've determined that using the SWT_AWT bridge to display an AWT control, and also set the SWT.Transparent flag on an SWT Composite, leads to 100% cpu under Windows XP. It seems the AWT control may be constantly painting. It only occurs in this configuration.
I've attached some code to repro the issue.
Please run SWT_AWT_BridgeTest on a Windows XP system (bare metal), using SWT 3.5.0. This bug does not occur on Vista, or when running XP in a virtual environment under Vista.
Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks. James

issue.title: Task with status closed is not appearing as complete in the task list
issue.description:
Status is *Closed* with a resolution of *Cannot Reproduce*, however the task in the task list is not shown with strikethrough gray font. Also I can schedule it in Mylyn, which leads me to believe that Mylyn thinks it is not complete.
Mylyn should consider resolved and closed tasks as complete regardless of resolution. Either that or Mylyn should provide a means to configure what statuses or resolutions are considered complete on a per-repository basis.

issue.title: properties command should have an optional page id
issue.description:
Just like the preferences command, properties should allow an optional page ID to be specified.
PW

attachments.attach: Property Dialog with initial page v01

issue.title: [xml editor] double clicking does not properly
issue.description:
Double clicking inside XML markup inside the MWE XML editor yields wrong selections. E.g. in the following text, when double-clicking on "class", everything between the *closing* quote of the property and the *opening* quote of the bean will be selected:
<workflow> <property file="path/to/file.properties"/> <bean class="my.package.Class" platformUri="${runtimeProject}/.."/>

issue.title: [repository] Composite repository loading could happen in parallel
issue.description: I20100119 The loading of the children of a composite repository should be happening in parallel. Today this seems to be done sequentially and makes the opening of a large repo like the 3.6-I-builds rather long since it has at least 10 children. The space where this is the most point is when you are returning to the repo and you know the content is already cached.

issue.title: Provide wizard for cleaning EMF-generated artifacts
issue.description: Core EMF tooling does not provide a way to clean generated artifacts. This is often necessary as the model evolves, class/package names change, etc. Mint has the ability to identify Java/workspace artifacts that are generated from a particular Genmodel element. This functionality can be used to delete these artifacts.

issue.title: InterruptedException from servlet container thread
issue.description:
We have this exception occur sometimes when we logout of our RAP application.
The way we log out is that we have a custom widget that redirects to a JSP page when we set a URL on it. When this happens, we occasionally get the exception below. The application has a UICallBack registered as well and this seems to cause the problem.
11 Jan 2010 11:36:47,254 | 9451458 [ERROR] {http-8080-Processor17} (org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool) Unexpected exception java.lang.InterruptedException at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method) at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:485) at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:661) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
The interrupt is coming from the UICallbackManager.blockCallBackRequest in the beforeDestroy implementation of the SessionStoreListener.
The problem only manifests itself if you use Tomcat as the servlet container as it logs the InterruptedException in it's HTTP processing threads. Other containers such as Jetty seem to ignore the exception completely.
I have attached a patch that fixes the problm for us.

attachments.attach: Clear the interrupted flag after the interrupted thread has returned.
Slightly modified version of previous patch

issue.title: About e4 platform
issue.description:
Hi,
I'm not sure how difficult this is but could you add the build number to Help -> About e4 compatibility platform. Currently this dialog is empty.
"Standard" Eclipse shows here the build number which is nice.
Best regards, Lars

issue.title: JAXB Externalized Metadata JUnit: Enable commented out tests in XmlAnyAttributeTestCases and XmlElementRefsTestCases
issue.description: There are a number of tests in these classes that are either commented out or start with an 'x' such that they are not run. Any invalid tests should be removed, such as adapter tests with xml-any-attribute, and the valid ones enabled.

attachments.attach: Valid tests are enabled and invalid ones removed.

issue.title: No "format" in registers view popup menu
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
If I start debugging, and visit the 'registers' view, the popup menu does not allow me to change the format between decimal, hex and binary. Popup menu in expressions and variables view do have the "Format" item. It appears that org.eclipse.cdt.debug.ui/plugin.xml simply forgot to contribute the "Format" item to this view. See:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.cdt/all/org.eclipse.cdt.debug.ui/plugin.xml?root=Tools_Project&view=markup
I attach the obvious patch to fix this.
Reproducible: Always

attachments.attach: Patch to make 'format' item appear in register view popup menu

issue.title: Need Incubator Update Site
issue.description:
It would be nice to have the ability for the Incubator projects that aren't necessarily on the same release schedule or requirements as the main WTP projects to have their own incubation site. This can be one combined site.
The Mylyn project already does this
Mylyn - download.eclipse.org/tools/mylyn/update/incubator
They provide both a stable project update site, as well as a separate site for those projects and components that are incubating. I think it is a good model to follow as it clearly separates what is considered a stable project from those that are still incubating and under some more drastic changes and development.
It would be nice to have Vex, RelaXNG, XQDT, and XML Security milestones be able to be installed from the Update site. I believe p2.director has some functionality to make this happen.

issue.title: Backport Allow user to choose the attributes for remote search result
issue.description: This bug is for the backport of bug 296877 to the R3_0_maintenance stream.

attachments.attach: patch updated for case after remote all

issue.title: Enhancement Request - Add "create" methods to DynamicEntity
Switch to ICU4J 4.2 in build
Deleting obsolete code - VirtualComponent.cleanUpReferences
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 305
The above mentioned method is causing references to deleted projects, that have been intentionally left in by the user in adoptor product, to be removed.
We removed this method, and tested the rename and delete scenarios and both work fine. We will also be running the junits suite to make sure this change does not result in a regression.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: IJavaTypeDescriptor2 is not correctly genned
issue.description: The eIsSet method generated in IJavaTypeDescriptor2Impl is not in sync with the package feature identifiers. This may cause stack overflows doing eIsSet checks on this object.

issue.title: add keywords plugin for remote project properties pages
issue.description:
The org.eclipse.ui.keywords extension points allows you to add additional keywords to properties/preference pages that register when typed into the filter text box. This aids users in navigating to what they need because all properties can get overwhelming. CDT has this in place for the preference page, and it would also be useful for remote project properties.
For example, the keyword "includes" should be added to the Remote Paths and Symbols page.

issue.title: [site.xml] Re-install of a feature cannot find artifacts
issue.description:
I20100119-0800
!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine 4 4 2010-01-20 16:54:17.109 !MESSAGE An error occurred while collecting items to be installed !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine 4 0 2010-01-20 16:54:17.109 !MESSAGE session context was:(profile=SDKProfile, phase=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.engine.phases.Collect, operand=, action=). !SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.equinox.p2.artifact.repository 4 0 2010-01-20 16:54:17.109 !MESSAGE No repository found containing: org.eclipse.update.feature,com.mountainminds.eclemma.feature,1.4.3
I installed eclemma and then reverted. Now when I try to re-install eclemma I fail with the missing artifact message.
If I remove the site and re-add it I can again install eclemma. This might be a problem in our storage of site.xml based update sites. I was running in shared mode so this might also be related.

issue.title: Modernize the Eclipse Logo
issue.description:
This bug isn't truly against the website, it's really a marketing question, but I didn't know where else to put it.
In bug 274551, we started discussing a significantly revised splash screen. This brings up the question of logo and related marketing materials.
In e4, we are designing an updated visual style for eclipse (see bug 293481) and I assumed we would do at least some updating of the splash. (The e4 tech preview had its own splash).
In bug 274551 we were discussing the UI elements within eclipse, as well as the marketing materials outside of the software itself that are based on the eclipse splash logo:
- window icons - about dialog graphics - plug-in branding icons - marketing images shown in http://www.eclipse.org/artwork/index.php
The big picture question, then, is are we going to redesign the basic theme/logo for Eclipse for e4?
If so, then the splash would follow this new design. If not, then we may choose to just update the splash in other ways - keeping the basic image and typography and updating the background elements or color choices.

attachments.attach: My modern eclipse logo - color version
My modern eclipse logo - one color version
My 2nd modern eclipse logo - color version
My 2nd modern eclipse logo - flat color version
My 2nd modern eclipse logo - 3D color / white background version
My 2nd modern eclipse logo - 3D color / black background version
My 2nd modern eclipse logo - flat bw / white background version
My 2nd modern eclipse logo - 3D color / blue background version
design strategy comparing Firefox and current Eclipse contexts

When adopting a the latest post M4 OCL build.

issue.title: [ui] Change private method to protected on RepositoryNameAndLocationDialog
issue.description:
I previously had to ask that a operations package get exported so I could reuse a constant from it in PDE. The purpose of that was to reuse the add repo location dialog without it preventing duplicate entries in the agent. Using the constant I can prevent the error, but the ok button still becomes disabled if there is a duplicate entry.
To override this behaviour I need the setOkEnablement method to be protected rather than private. The change seems reasonable to me as the majority of other methods modifying dialog elements are protected.
Patch attached. Please get this in for M5, sorry for leaving it so long.

issue.title: Need e4 splash screen and need to define scope of change
issue.description:
When e4 ships, it will presumably have a cool, new splash screen. We had interesting ideas/submissions for the tech preview, and I'm sure there will be lots of creative ideas for the final release.
I think the scope of change needs to be figured out the foundation/marketing level first. Many of the marketing materials are derived from the logo in the splash screen. If the basic logo is to change, that should likely be addressed first.
For example, we could hold a contest, but I think the contest should first establish the logo and branding, followed by the splash itself. If the basic logo/branding is not to change, then we can scope the splash to be more of a "sprucing up" of the existing splash. Using the same logo (image and typography), but perhaps playing with color or backgrounds
I opened bug 300271 against the foundation for the broader question. This question can track the specific issue of a splash once we've scoped the larger question.

issue.title: Java Class Constructor class

attachments.attach: Version 01 - 2 ideas: constructor from scratch or wrapper for NewTypeWizardPage

issue.title: standard schemas version should get a minor bump
issue.description:
While fixing bug 300090, it appeared to me, if I am reading branches right, that the jst.standard.schema bundle should get a "minor" version number bump.
It appears its only gotten "service" updates so far.
And, especially with Helios, and all the Java EE 6 stuff, seems it is definitely "new function".
I'm not sure there is any practical consequences, but seems we should "follow the rules" as best we can, just in case.
I did not want to make change in version number at the last minute before an I-build, so opened this bug ... and will leave it up to others to decide when is the right time to do it. Before M5? After M5?
Thanks,

My XServer Hummingbird Exceed version 11.0.0.0, crashes reliably when: 1) Get the R3_4_maintenance branch of org.eclipse.releng.eclipsebuilder 2) open org.eclipse.releng.eclipsebuilder/eclipse/buildConfigs/sdk/packager/sdk.product 3) open the history view 4) scroll down until the current version (bolded) is visible 5) XServer crash
I also crash if the history view is large enough so that scrolling is not needed.

issue.title: Can't connect to files on a networkshare
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
I tried to open my git repo on a windows network share (samba, cifs). First I used file://server/share and I tried file://P:/ while P: is the mounted network share. Then I tried smb://server/share/ but it doesn't work. I guess it the problem is that java get the files mapped correctly from Windows API. The solution is to add a new Transport Class and add it in 324 org.eclipse.jgit.transport.Transport; public static Transport open(final Repository local, final URIish remote) or better make a way to add Transport plugins to support flexible protocols.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Just try to open a git url on a network share

issue.title: [EMF Compare] Unrelated non-containment deleted
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
I have a model that has a node with a two non-containment references:
1) noncontainmentHolder 2) noncontainmentNoncontainmentHolder
The first one points references an object that it does not contain. The second references an object that it does not contain and that object references another object it does not contain.
In the unit test, I change the first reference in the right model, but leave the rest of the references the same. If the second reference does not belong to a resource, then it will be deleted by DefaultMerger.removeDanglingReferences(...).
This happens because the CrossReferencer returns it in the iterator and it is then removed by the DefaultMerger.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run unit tests - testDisappearingNoncontainmentReference()

issue.title: Add debug trace for xdc.useModule
issue.description:
When debugging a config script, often need to know who is bringing in some module. loadPackage trace isn't enough, especially for central packages like xdc.runtime.
xdc.useModule() should emit trace on who is calling it.

issue.title: xgconf: need a GUI way to enable trace in config scripts
Refactoring confuses subversive and leads to unresolveable conflicts
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
Any task in eclipse (such as refactoring) which results in a folder being moved causes Subversive to get in a very confused state. I'm experiencing this while using maven as the build environment, I have not tested outside that environment.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: Test1.java Test2.java
Commit to SVN Update SVN
Refactor>rename the package to test.newpackage.
Now try and commit the changes and it will get confused on the new files as they have already been copied to the new location on the server
It becomes even worse if some files are not in SVN.

issue.title: xdc.runtime.Error's E_memory needs xdoc'd
issue.description:
In the default config, E_memory's msg contains 2 arguments - "out of memory: heap=0x%x, size=%u".
The xdoc should document for both raisers and observers what those arguments should be. Is the first arg an index or an instance handle (or up to the raiser!) or ...?
http://rtsc.eclipse.org/cdoc-tip/xdc/runtime/Error.html#.E_memory

issue.title: Newly created breakpoints not selected in breakpoints view
issue.description: When a breakpoint is created, it is not highlighted in the breakpoints view. However, a selection event does get fired, as the detail pane will update for the newly added breakpoint.

issue.description: Bug 299332 introduces a NewJavaProjectConstructor that takes care of the nitty-gritty details of creating a Java Project. We should simplify the wizard to make use of the constructor.

issue.title: did I mess up wtpBuild permissions or group?
issue.description:
Or did you? :)
a week ago, (at least) wtpBuild was creating directories/files with an owner group of 'webtools.releng-dev', with the group having RWX permissions. Now it is creating them with 'users' group, with no group write permissions.
This appears to be causing our WTP builds to not work right (I think maybe only "tests" don't work right). I'm not sure how/why this would effect my scripts, but thought I'd open this bug while I continue to investigate.
If this was an intentional change, fine ... but thought maybe "wtpBuild" was put in wrong "group" or something?
david_williams@build:/opt/public/webtools> ll projects total 0 drwxr-xr-x 4 wtpBuild users 144 2010-01-20 22:44 jaxws-R0.5-I drwxr-xr-x 4 wtpBuild users 144 2010-01-20 22:59 jsdt-R1.2.0-I drwxrwxr-x 5 wtpBuild webtools.releng-dev 176 2010-01-10 00:03 patches-R3.0.5-P

issue.title: Could not load SWT library
issue.description:
I20100119-0800
After moving up to latest I-build, started seeing this problem loading/finding the "swt library".
This _might_ be only on PPC? It _might_ be only if XULRunner path specified, as we (have to) do on build.eclipse.org. It seems to work ok on a linux x86 box, where I do not set the xulrunner path.
On build.eclipse.org, for our production builds, I set
org.eclipse.swt.browser.XULRunnerPath to /shared/common/mozilla-xulrunner181-1.8.1.4-30.ppc
(and have been for month or more, using M4, at least).
I'm not sure where the "tmp" comes from in the following stack trace. That looks suspicious?
But I do set -Djava.io.tmpdir to /shared/webtools/tmp/ ... can't imagine why SWT would be using a tmp directory? I'm just mentioning it in case relevant.
I've set to blocker, since if I'm seeing this right, we in WTP can't run our JUnit tests with this build.
Thanks,

As of v3.6M5 Eclipse Debug Platform now supports columns in the Expressions view. For java, the expressions view should show the Instance ID and Instance Count columns just as in the variables view.
See bug 235646.

issue.title: Eclipse compiler chosen complaince level as 1.4 with source 1.4 target 1.5
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20060921-0945
I am using ANT (version 1.6.2) and eclipse java compiler (version 3.2.2.r322) to compile my java project.
In javac task, I specified target="1.5" and source="1.4" to compile my sources. I am getting an error saying that "[javac] Compliance level '1.4' is incompatible with target level '1.5'. A compliance level '1.5' or better is required"
<javac compiler="org.eclipse.jdt.core.JDTCompilerAdapter" destdir="c:/tmp/bin" target="1.5" source="1.4">
I saw the comptability table in the site http://help.eclipse.org/help32/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.jdt.doc.isv/guide/jdt_api_compile.htm and there it is mentioned that a compliance level of 1.5 can have the source=1.4 and target=1.5
But in my case, compliance level is chosen as 1.4 by default.
I have attached build.xml with this entry and I used the following command to execute this build file in the command prompt.
ant -lib c:/tmp/lib
I copied the ecj compiler in c:/tmp/lib directory.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Get the build.xml file attached with this entry and paste it in C:/test 2. Copy the ecj.jar into C:/tmp/lib directory 3. In the command prompt (goto C:/test directory), execute the following command "ant -lib c:/tmp/lib"

issue.title: JPA2: shared library deployment validation fails on SPACE in javax.persistence spec jar MANIFEST Specification-Version: 2.0 PFD
issue.description:
>The javax.persistence specification jar's MANIFEST.MF specification-Version should not have any spaces between 2.0 and PFD.
>Reproduction: Deploy as shared library from Eclipse 3.5 EE WebLogic server plugin in Window | Preferences | WebLogic | Shared Libraries
The "2.0 PFD" version on the spec jar in TRUNK does not pass deployment validation as a shared library - from the MANIFEST.MF Specification-Version: 2.0 PFD we get "Version identifiers may only contain alphanumerics, period, underscore, and hyphen"
<Jan 21, 2010 12:43:02 AM EST> <Warning> <Deployer> <BEA-149124> <Failures were detected while initiating deploy task for application 'javax.persistence_2.0.0.v200911271158 [LibSpecVersion=2.0 PFD,LibImplVersion=2.0.0]'. Error is: '[Deployer:149115]Cannot deploy or redeploy application 'javax.persistence_2.0.0.v200911271158' with invalid version identifier '[LibSpecVersion=2.0 PFD,LibImplVersion=2.0.0]'. Version identifiers may only contain alphanumerics, period, underscore, and hyphen, and be less than 215 characters in length.'>
- The workaround is to hack the javax.persistence jar and modify the version - this should be done formally in the build target in the ant script though. MANIFEST.MF Specification-Version: 2.0 weblogic-application.xml <wls:library-name>javax.persistence_2.0</wls:library-name> <wls:specification-version>2.0</wls:specification-version>
>After fix (remove the space)
We now get successfull shared library deployment
eclipse.buildId=M20090917-0800 java.version=1.6.0_17 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US Framework arguments: -product org.eclipse.epp.package.jee.product -showlocation Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -product org.eclipse.epp.package.jee.product -showlocation Thu Jan 21 00:58:16 EST 2010 Library module javax.persistence_2.0#2.0@2.0.0 was deployed sucessfully.

issue.title: pserver delays
issue.description:
Hi,
since the last technical restructure of the CVS server infrastructure the pservers are not in sync with extssh access. There is also no easy way to tell how up-to-date pserver is.
While this was done to make extssh quicker (help committers) it creates a problem for contributers. It happened to us more than once that active contributors in our project where searching for fixes for bugs that only exists on contributers computers and not on committer computers and were due to the fact that pserver is several hours behind the committed code.
At the same time running automated builds and tests also now is error-prone since fixing a bug and running the build again sometimes works, sometimes we have to wait a few hours and try another build.
I know that you could make the build checkout using a committers userid and password, but I am not sure why I want my committers userid and password to be spread in scripts or property files. In my feeling it contradicts the idea that the userid identifies me as a person and make me personally responsible for changes in CVS.
Still it wouldnt help the contributors.
I am pretty unsatisfied with the number of disadvantages we experience with the pserver delays.
I would like to know why pserver cvs is several hours behind (and not only minutes or seconds)?
Would it be possible to have a status page either per CVS or for all CVSes what the last timestamp was that was synced to the pserver CVS copy ? Then at least when we commit something at 13:32 we had an easy way to check when that code is in the pserver copy.
At last not least, I would vote for reverting the change and put pserver and extssh back in sync. The time we lost in issues related to this in the past month is WAY MORE than time we lost in delayed CVS access in the time since Riena started 2 years ago.
thanks christian campo

issue.title: Remove parameter does not work in web service data set[0707]

Build: <2.5.2.v20100120-0630>
Steps to reproduce: 1.New a Web Service Data Set from Data Explorer, specify the WSDL Descriptor. http://webservice.webxml.com.cn/WebServices/WeatherWebService.asmx?wsdl 2.Choose the "WeatherWebServiceSoap->getWeatherbyCityName"operation from the operation list. 3.Click next, and specify default value of the parameter in SOAP Request template: theCityName = Houston 4.Click next and select the table mapping (/SOAP-ENV:Envelope/SOAP-ENV:Body/getWeatherbyCityNameResponse/getWeatherbyCityNameResult) from the SOAP Response. 5.Select the column mapping: Location: /string[1] City: /string[2] Date: /string[5] 6.Finish and preview the dataset. 7.Remove parameter and preview the dataset, click ok to close 8.Open dataset and check the parameter is still there
Actual result: After Step6£¬city is Houston, it's the right result. After Step7, Remove parameter treated as the parameter value is null and default city is ÉÏº£ After Step8£¬Remove parameter does not work. Parameter still exist and value change back to 'Houston'
Expect result: Parameter shoud be removed or set value as null

issue.title: [web connector] correct task summary gets garbled during refresh
issue.description:
Scenario of our local repository: Use the web connector to connect to our repository that shows the list of bugs in a HTML table (param urlTaskQuery), but if you query detail data for a specific bug (param urlTask), the resulting web page does *not* have the headline of this bug in the <title> tag. In our case, the title of a detail page always shows something like "Details for bug AP00786567".
Refreshing the bug list works fine, this is using the table view and the queryPattern. But whenever you refresh the bug data page, the correct summary line (in the Task List view) changes to the useless "Details for bug AP00786567".
Reason: In org.eclipse.mylyn.internal.web.tasks.WebRepositoryConnector.getTaskData(TaskRepository, String, IProgressMonitor), WebUtil.getTitleFromUrl() is used, and later in WebRepositoryConnector.updateTaskFromTaskData(TaskRepository, ITask, TaskData) the retrieved title is written to the task data. This makes sense *only* if the detail page shows the task summary in the title, which is not always the case.
Request: Make this call to getTitleFromUrl() optional, setting via a preference of the repository.
BTW: For our local needs I patched the code. If that helps, I can attach the patch. It's not for production, as it has no user option. It simply does not change the task summary on a refresh - hardcoded :-(

issue.title: formatting broken on wiki for "definition lists"
issue.description:
Try the following wiki markup:
;item 1 : definition 1 ;item 2 : definition 2-1 : definition 2-2
It looks correct when using the "Show Preview" button, but once you click on "Save Page", you discover that the formatting is completely different.
The syntax and the expected result are documented here: http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Formatting

issue.title: replace 2D font textures with 3D vector fonts
issue.description: In the current version (rev. 436), fonts are rendered as textures. Thus, the quality of text is not too good. In order to improve the render quality of fonts, vector fonts should be used instead of texture based fonts.

issue.title: set up automatic build system
issue.description: Setup build system based on Athena, Buckminster, and/or Hudson to enable releases and nightly builds.

issue.title: design and implement an animation system
issue.description: Design and implement an animation system that allows certain aspects of a scene (figures, layers, camera) to be animated in a controlled manner. That means that an animation must have a defined timeframe and not be dependent on FPS. Sometimes, animation involves model changes, in such cases, the update manager must not trigger an immediate redraw, since the animation should take care of that. The user must be able to cancel an animation (for example a camera track) and regain control at any point in time. Changes performed by an animation must in such cases be rolled back. GEF already supports animations, however more sophisticated concepts may be needed in 3D

issue.title: Support billboard figures
issue.description: Billboards are figures (especially layers) which are always screen aligned and are not transformed with the camera view. These figures can be used for controls or labels.

issue.title: add navigation controls
issue.description: Especially for activating camera tracks, but other things as well, special controls are needed. These could be implemented as simple actions (and using SWT buttons in the tool bar). But like scrollbars, these controls are closely related to the canvas. On possibility would be to implement these things as a transparent billboards, similar to the navigation elements in Google Maps.

issue.title: design and implement camera tracks
issue.description: Develop a design and implement how to activate a camera track (handles, double click, actions, tools) and how to describe a camera track (start/end position and view direction, track described by splines?), undo for camera tracks (i.e. look at a special object and then return to old location), special targets (move plane to front, i.e. view plane in 2D manner; overview, i.e. look at whole scene; etc.), extensible track description, extensible targets. This is also related to the general problem of animation, since a camera track is nothing but an animation.

issue.title: add support for handles for 3D operations
issue.description: In order to move elements in z-direction or for rotating, additional handles are needed. Besides, possibly other handles may be required, so a general design may become useful.

issue.title: interactive rotation and 3D positioning (movement, resizing)
issue.description: Currently, only 2D content or 3D elements located on a plane can be moved in 2D manner. Besides that, elements (and especially planes) should be movable in all 3 directions (x, y, and z!) and be rotatable (around x, y, and z axis). This not only requires handles (see #300320) but special requests etc. The graph demo editor should implement this feature.

issue.title: Cannot identify attachement as patch upon creation of bug
issue.description:
I'm not sure if there is anything that can be done about this, but when I create a patch and add an attachment during the creation, I cannot mark the attachment as a patch. I have to go into details as a separate step to do it.
It would be nice to be able say the attachment is a patch right at creation.
Note that to get the 'diff' link, an attachment must be marked as 'patch'.

issue.title: add support for highlighting figures
issue.description:
Especially in larger 3D scenes, finding a figure can become extremely difficult. Highlighting figures, e., in order to visualize a search result, would be useful for many applications and should be implemented in the framework itself. In order to enable highlighting in a general manner, an infrastructure must be provided similar to selections.
Visualizing the highlighted figues: One idea of highlighting is to simply draw a transparent colored cube around the bounding box of a figure. Another idea would be to implement a spotlight-like mechanism: Instead of highlighting a figure, all other figures are dimmed. This could be achieved by implementing a proxy around the Graphics3D implementation which tweaks the setColor-methods. This is described in Bug 278351

issue.title: camera move in drag operations
issue.description: When dragging an element, currently the camera cannot be moved. A design (and implementation) on how to enable camera movement with the mouse button pressed is needed. Two possible ideas are: - implement "hot edges", i.e. move the camera when the mouse cursor reaches an edge of the view - implement "spring navigations", i.e. move (into the scene) when the mouse cursor hovers over a plane or figure in the back (question: how to get back) Another alternative would be some sort of basket that can hold elements. It would work like this: Drag objects into the basket, move the camera, drag objects out of basket and onto target.

issue.title: level of detail techniques
issue.description:
Elements far away from the camera could be replaced by special shapes. E.g., a plane with a diagram could be replaced by a simple label. This will not only lead to higher performance but to better readable large diagrams as well. This feature is closely related to rendering in general.
Actually, there are two lod activation strategies: - automatically controlled by the renderer - controlled by edit parts

issue.title: export 3D scene as bitmap
issue.description: Enable screenshot like export of a scene, maybe with special background, omitted layers, and rendered in a higher resolution.

issue.title: scrollable planes
issue.description: Implement scrollable planes in order to enable large 2D diagrams. 3D planes which have scrollable content should also have a widget button that allows to them to be "maximized" so that the entire content is visible. We need to think about what happens to 3D connections of 2D nodes which are currently not visible (because they are scrolled out of view).

issue.title: 3D model importer
issue.description: Implement (or find a possible contribution) for importing 3D models (3ds, obj etc.) in order to be able to use existing 3D models as figures.

issue.title: support (OpenGL) material
issue.description: Support OpenGL material in order to improve 3D visualization quality

issue.title: support lights
issue.description: Implement lights in order to improve 3D awareness.

issue.title: support depth of field effects
issue.description: Implement depth of field effects, e.g. only elements at a certain distance from the camera become sharp, in order to improve 3D awareness

issue.title: combine SWT overlays with camera tracks
issue.description: Enable SWT overlays in order to enable GEF's direct edit mechanism and combined graphical and textual models. This is related to camera tracks as the camera may be moved in order to see a 2D-like perspective of an element which is then edited with an SWT widget. Actually, SWT overlays are already working, but not correctly positioned at the moment (and dure to missing camera tracks, the overlay is not very nice embedded into the scene).

issue.title: SWT overlays with popups
issue.description: Draw a "popups" when directly editing an element and add an SWT widget into that popup. If the user double clicks a text label to edit it, show a pop up that is shaped like a speech bubble above the label and display the SWT widgets in there. The popup helps reducing irritations due to differently orientated (i.e., transformed) label and SWT widget.

issue.title: support 3D direct edit
issue.description: Instead of using SWT widgets, text may be edited directly using a 3D enabled text editor.

issue.title: implement SVG export
issue.description:
Exporting 3D diagrams to a vector format would be a very nice feature.
Note: X3D export is already implemented, but it is no longer working and will be moved to an archive branch. (IMHO X3D export has been a nice proof-of-concept, but in my experience X3D viewers are that bad that it doesn't make sense to support that format in the future).

issue.title: implement dynamic 3D layouts for planes
issue.description: A very simple stack layout of planes in a 3D scene is already implemented. Kristian implemented a cube-like layout in his master thesis, and I could think of other standard layouts similar to coverflow or time machine. As these layouts are dynamical, they may require additional controls or navigation handles.

issue.title: 4 failures in jpa.wdf.test for initial nightly run
issue.description: following test will be switched off with an annotation (@Bugzilla) query.TestConditionalExpression.testMemberOfHandling query.TestCount.testCount relation.TestMap.testEmptyOffice relation.TestMap.testOffice

issue.title: support extrusion effect
issue.description: It would be nice to add 3D effects to 2D content, i.e. render 2D boxes as 3D cubes with a default high. This pseudo 3D effect is called extrusion and it should be very easy to implement for 2D content because 2D content is now rendered with real 3D vertices.

issue.title: remove restrictions related to 2D textures
issue.description:
One tricky task would be to remove restrictions related to the old technique of projecting 2D content onto planes using textures. This technique is still available, Kristian implemented a kind of switch in the renderer functions in order to still support the old strategy.
However, there were some "restrictions" only related to the texture based projecting. E.g., at the moment, 2D connections can only connect two figures on the same plane. The DispatchingConnectionLayer is a result of this restriction and it could maybe implemented less restrective. As 2D figures are now rendered just like 3D figures, they are not restricted to be placed onto a surface anymore. OK, the surface is still necessary in order to calculate the 3D coordinate for a 2D figure, but it isn't required for rendering anymore!
Besides, already now we have to handle effects of 2D figures no longer to be restricted to a plane, e.g. when computing bounding boxes or when moving 2D figures outside a plane.

issue.title: support figure/diagram proxies
issue.description:
One "visions" is to use GEF3D as an integrated modeling environment and support very large (3D) diagrams. Instead of fiddling around with configurations files or megamodels using tree based editors, transformation chains (or model chains) could be simply set up by dragging models (or their diagrams) onto a single GEF3D scene. The multi editor feature of GEF3D is already supporting this, actually in this context GEF3D provides more functionality then only 3D (multi editors and inter-model-connections are not only related to 3D! ).
One problem in this context would be the enormous amount of model elements and figures when all models of a larger project are to be visualized in a single 3D scene. For that reason, we have to support some kind of diagram proxies. That is, similar to level of detail (see 8) ), a diagram is rendered only as a simple (labeled) box, and its content is only visualized on (user) demand. The user should be able to load and unload (!) diagrams. Loading/unloading diagrams actually means (un)loading two things: the models and the GEF stuff (edit parts and figures). The first issue is EMF related, the second one may could be solved or at least supported by GEF3D. Maybe we have to talk to the GEF and GMF guys about that issue, as it may occurs on larger 2D diagrams, too.
Remark: Unloading the models is not necessarily related to EMF, since GEF does not require the model to be EMF.
This feature certainly depends on level of detail techniques, in order to replace figures of a diagram with a single label.

issue.title: investigate in RAP/WebGL support
issue.description: Webapplications are becoming more and more important, and one technique is the Rich Ajax Platform (RAP). A prototype combining RAP with WebGL (an upcoming standard for using 3D in a browser) has already been implemented by a student in a master thesis I tutored. We should investigate further in this direction, since web applications become more and more important. A first step would be to at least enable GEF3D viewers embedded into a web application using WebGL. In this context, the two main issues are: - extend RAP in order to support the GEF/Draw2D/3D API -- this probably is the hardest part - implement a WebGL based Graphics3D implementation, shouldn't be too hard as WebGL is based on OpenGL ES 2.0

issue.title: support stereoscopy
issue.description: Hardware for real 3D, using red/green, polarized or shutter glasses, is becoming more and more available. Implementing support for red/green glasses may easily be implemented. Although this technique is not the best one, it is relatively simple to be implemented, in order to prepare GEF3D for better solutions. Actually I tried to implement a prototype for that technique some time ago, unfortunately without success -- there are some problems hidden under the hood. This is why I think we should implement a very simple solution soon, in order to be prepared.

issue.title: create webpage with screenshots and links to sample applications
issue.description: We should create a page (on the GEF3D project website) with links to GEF3D based applications. The examples coming with GEF3D are rather simple ones, and they are in deed only used for demonstrating how to 3D-fy existing editors.

issue.title: [CommonNavigator] Missing and duplicate context menu items
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
I deleted some unneeded projects from my workspace, by deleting the project folder on the filesystem. Eclipse was not runing.
(these are 4 project, all with name beginning with "test...")
Then I started Eclipse and this happened: - the deleted projects were shown as closed (see screenshot) - I tried to delete them but failed: -- the delete key has no effect on them -- in the context menu of the closed project there is no "Delete" item - in the context menu of some (but not all) other project, there are two "Delete" (and other) items

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Use the same conflict/unmatched decorator in all models

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Use the same conflict/unmatched decorator in all models
issue.description: Use conflict ('double-headed red arrow') icon instead of 'red X' icon for unmatched hunks in Patch Contents model.

issue.title: Localization improvements (translator + array)
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
Improvements for the localization feature. Such improvements comprise: - allow integration with online translation services - allow translation of a set of cells or an entire column
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: deploy Rotated Label Plugin
issue.description:
Created attachment 156777 [details] Rotated Label jar.
Hi,
I implemented rotatedLabel and had the rotatedLabel jar file, and if i deploy it in eclipse with birt plugins, i can use the rotated label and generate rotated labels in pdf. But if i copy the jar file in plugins folder of the reportEngine folder, and run the same report from a application that uses this report engine, the rotatedLabel not appears. Any idea?
Thanks in advance.

issue.title: folding enabled and clicking outline kills mouse
issue.description:
while editing an xsl file, i enabled preferences->general->editors->structured text editors->[x] enable folding when i clicked an element in the outline view, the mouse partially stopped working: the left button did not do anything any longer and after a while, even moving the mouse over eg the autohiding kicker panel (of kde4) did not make it appear as it used to do.

so far i've seen it only with the XSL outline, not sure if it is specific or may happen with others too.

issue.title: declared "release" variable with no value set causes a stackoverflow exception in eclipse when the Release: tag references the variable.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
When creating / editting a spec file in the spec file editor (text, not form), an "Unhandled event loop exception" occurs if a variable defined as "release" is created without a value and referenced by the Release entry. If the spec file is left open while eclipse is closed, eclipse will crash every time it is opened for as long as this syntax error is in place.
Will attach a stack trace and session data.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a spec file (general file or from template) 2. Set "Release: %{release}" 3. At the top of the file, define release with no value - "%define release" 4. Move the cursor to the EOL of the %define line.
sometimes a space + backspace will trigger the exception.

attachments.attach: A spec file that causes the exception.

Would appreciate if some one could find out the problem?. or can we have a decorator disablement check in the DecoratorManager code.

issue.title: [Model Explorer] Handle stereotyped element for diagram profile based
issue.description: Diagram based on a profile allows the user creating stereotyped element with specific representation. When you are selecting the created element, it's linked with the stereotype application in the model explorer. Link with editor should be done with the base element of the stereotype application.

issue.title: Enhance promote.xml to promote to sftp
[expressions] FormattedValueVMUtil does not always set active format value property
issue.description:
Created attachment 156784 [details] Fix
Whether FormattedValueVMUtil.updateFormattedValuesWithAvailableFormats() sets the property IDebugVMConstants.PROP_FORMATTED_VALUE_ACTIVE_FORMAT_VALUE or not depends on the order of property keys provided by the set iterator.
E.g. if the property comes last, it will never be set. As a consequence, the value column of an expression in the Expression view stays blank.
Attached patch solves this.

issue.title: Run configuration Working Directory should be clipboard copyable
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
If you want to change the working directory of a run configuration to a subdirectory of the current working directory, the easiest would be, to copy&paste the value of Default into Other and add the subdirectory. Unfortunately the Default is greyed out and cannot be copyied. Default should be made copyable.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: DOM Source Preprocessing Job proces stack at execution and Studio
issue.description:
Step to reproduce: Open Web Browser Tools perspective Open some URLs or HTML files from workspace Perform some operations (bout 10-20): - Compare some nodes from one and from different files - Look some HTTP Requests - Change some CSS rules - Look browser console Go to main document node from DOM Inspector and look DOM Source
Expected result: To have displayed HTML Source Code at DOM Source
Actual result: HTML Source Code is not displayed at DOM Source View, Computer CPU is go to 100$m and DOM Source Preprocessing Job is working without a way to cancel it

issue.title: Import Plug-ins wizard does not allow to add missing required plug-ins any more
issue.description:
I20100119-0800
The behavior change mentioned in bug 18500 comment 53 kills our workspace update scenario:
> There is a change in behaviour with this fix. When the user imports a plug-in > with a conflict and chooses not to delete the project, previously we would skip > importing that plug-in. After this fix, instead of ignoring, we import the > plug-in and give it a different name.
Before, we performed these steps when new plug-ins got added to a build: - Import > Plug-ins and F. - select 'required by existing', as binary - Select All - When asked whether to replace existing, say 'No to All'
Now, we can only delete existing projects. If we deselect all in the "do you want to delete?" dialog, we get duplicate plug-ins in the workspace. But replacing existing plug-ins also fails because bug 300354 only imports one version.

issue.title: Restore method Convert.fromPlatformBytes(byte[] source)

Patch from bug 297228 adds a parameter to Convert.fromPlatformBytes(byte[] source) which causes a reflection call fails on Linux. Fail happens while trying to put information about symbolic link target from the native code.

issue.title: [Tooling] Support browsing IApplications
issue.description: With the support for IApplications (see bug 277689) we should add all available IApplication extensions to the list of available entrypoints in the launcher.

issue.title: [Coolbar] Visual hover defect for toolbar buttons added by menu contributions.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
1. Contribute a button (or better to say a command) by using the menu contributions to a view toolbar. 2. Add handler programmatically for that command that disables itself (using the setBaseEnabled method when activated). 3. Add another button somewhere (maybe inside the view), that programmatically enables the above handler again (also by using the setBaseEnabled method of the above handler). 3. Move with the mouse pointer over the button in the toolbar. The button correctly gets that normal hover decoration. 4. If the button is clicked then it gets disabled. 5. When the mouse pointer leaves the disabled toolbar button and click the other button (the one of step 3) then the toolbar button is enabled again, but still has the hover decoration (although the mouse pointer isn't above that toolbar button anymore).
-> wrong hover decoration of toolbar button.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Resource Working Set shows inexistent project that cannot be deleted in Package Explorer
issue.description:
Created attachment 156787 [details] Screenshot showing the error dialog
Build ID: I20091210-1301 (Eclipse 3.6m4) on WinXP
In my Workspace, I have two closed projects which I cannot delete any more: When I try to delete the project, no matter whether I choose to delete the underlying filestore, I get a dialog (see also attached):
Delete Resources A fatal error occurred while performing the refactoring Found problems: No input element provided No context information available [back] [cancel]
As an end user, I am confused by this dialog because it talks about a refactoring (which I did not initiate, I wanted to delete a project!). It also gives me no indication how to resolve the problem.
I investigated the issue a little, and found that in the case of these two closed projects, the underlying location is displayed as <resource does not exist> in the project properties. I tried deliberately reproducing this case but could not; this state might have been initiated through my team provider (ClearCase Remote Client v7.1 Eclipse plugin), but I am not sure. The workspace was carried over from several older Eclipse versions. I can provide more data if needed.
Expected behavior: ------------------ Deleting a project without the "Delete file system resources" switched on only unregisters the project from my workspace. This should always succeed regardless of whether the unerlying location exists or not. Furthermore, in case "delete file system" was chosen and the operation fails, the error dialog should be improved to not talk about a "refactoring" which is confusing for end users.
I'm marking the issue as "major" since there is no workaround for getting rid of the stale project.

Starting with the I20100115-1100 build and the N-Builds this week we have been seeing the testMirrorSuccess test fail for update.tests.core. It seems p2 related according to the log:

See bug 276033 for the reason of new layout policies. Please find attached a patch, could someone review and apply it ?

issue.title: can not install test framework into sdk using p2
issue.description:
using eclipse-SDK-I20100119-0800-win32
I unzipped the SDK, then unzipped the corresponding test framework in another directory. I added that test framework directory to "available software sites" and disabled all other sites.
The install failed, saying:
An error occurred while collecting items to be installed session context was:(profile=SDKProfile, phase=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.engine.phases.Collect, operand=, action=). No repository found containing: osgi.bundle,org.apache.derby,10.1.2.1_v200803061811
So, that doesn't seem right. I think should be able to install without derby (or, for derby to be included).
To work around this, I re-enabled the /releases/helios site. It did seem to eventually find a copy of derby to install, but then get a message in console about failing to unpack the derby...pack.gz file. But, did eventually ask me to restart workbench, so I assumed it installed something.
