issue.title: [formatter] Fup of bug 287833
Update Mint branding for Helios
issue.description: Mint feature and plugin manifests must be updated for Helios.

issue.title: Virtual Resource API inconsistencies
issue.description:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #296691 +++
I still think IResource#isVirtual() is wrong and I haven't heard a valid argument why it shouldn't be moved to IFolder (as explained in bug 296691 comment 3, it can be moved up to IResource if this becomes necessary in the future).
> > The API would also be easier to understand if you would explicitly state > > that a virtual folder is a special linked folder. IResource#isLinked(int) > > already returns true for virtual folders (although its API currently says > > that links can only be created with createLink). > > This is an implementation detail that virtual folders are implemented using > linked resources. This may change or can be hidden in a subsequent milestone.
The API of IResource#isLinked(int) is currently inconsistent, and that should be fixed. Even if you leave this unspecified, it would still break clients if you change virtual folders to not be linked folders in the future, so it would be better to specify this upfront.

issue.title: Allow full .app folder path in launcher name
issue.description:
In the profile we keep the launcher name, for the mac I think it is best if we support the full .app path : "Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse"
This removes any ambiguity around trying to generate that path from a bare "eclipse".
This is particularly important when the name is something different: rcp.app/Contents/MacOS/rcp Rcp.app/Contents/MacOS/rcp EclipseTest.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse (bug 299955)
Currently, in the eclipse touchpoint there is Util#getLauncherName(name, os), in 3.4 this properly handled a full .app path, but a change was made in 3.5 which looks wrong to me.
I think we need to fix this in 3.5.2 because otherwise we can't update to metadata containing a full path which could make fixing other related bugs more difficult.

issue.title: remove WONTFIX test cases from jvmpi automated tests
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
There are a couple of cases in the JVMPI automated tests that refer to bugs currently in the WONTFIX state. These tests have been automatically marked failures in test passes since around the time of the original bug being logged.
We should remove theses cases from the test suites.
They are: ArgumentsTest - https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=131786 GarbageCollectionTest - https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=133954 MultiThreadedTest - https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=147360
The last on is an intermittant failure on a case we still do execute. I have not seen it fail in a long time. Perhaps we can leave it but no longer fail it by default.
Reproducible: Always

attachments.attach: changed files to remove WONTFIX test cases

issue.title: Base64 bug in PreferenceService#getByteArray
NPE during SVNTeamUIPlugin.start
issue.description:
I am sometimes getting NPE like below during subclipse UI plugin activation. If this happens, the only way to get Subclipse UI is to restart Eclipse.
I debugged this a little and the root cause of the problem seems to be circular dependency between svn.core and svn.ui activation logic. At least in some activation scenarios svn.core bundle activator eagerly loads extensions from svn.ui plugin, which triggers svn.ui bundle activation, which assumes svn.core has already been activated. As a result, overall activation sequence works if it is started from svn.ui plugin and fails if started from svn.core plugin.

issue.description:
The extension point id specified in the plugin.xml for org.eclipse.ide4edu.scheme.core, "org.eclipse.soc.ide4edu.scheme.interpreter", shows a bit of the history of the project. It should probably be something like "org.eclipse.ide4edu.scheme.interpreter"; extenders of this extension point will need to be updated.
Similarly, the name of the schema file for this extension point, "org.carleton.scs.scheme.interpreter.exsd", shows even more of the history of this project. issue.title: BinaryResourceImpl mangles characters with code 128-255 during load
issue.description:
Build Identifier: org.eclipse.emf 2.5.0.v200906151043
All characters between code 128 to 255 are not properly reloaded, e.g. German umlauts: ö,ä,ü.
Fix:
The method BinaryResourceImpl$EObjectInputStream.readString() uses ---> this.characters[i] = (char) value; to read a one byte-character back from the input stream. value is a byte variable. If byte is negative the resulting char will be -1, but originally written was 255. Replacing the line with: ---> this.characters[i] = (char) ((value) & (short)0xff); will fix this problem, since the value is cast to short and masked before converting it to char.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: Create a model with at least one string attribute and try to save and load an instance of it using the BinaryResourceImpl. If any of the strings contains characters with code 128-255 the string will not be reloaded properly.

issue.title: update to S20100120144102 Orbit build for 3.6M5
LaunchingResourceManager.isContextLaunchingEnabled should consider the external tools launch group

I20100119-0800
While fixing bug 295022 I found the code pattern:
LaunchingResourceManager.isContextLaunchEnabled() && !getLaunchGroupIdentifier().equals("org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.launchGroup")
everywhere we perform context launching. Since we always do this, we should push the !getLaunchGroupIdentifier().equals("org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.launchGroup") up into LaunchingResourceManager.isContextLaunchEnabled().

issue.title: [ftp] Deadlock due to NOOP command not receiving response on the main thread

Created attachment 156810 [details] In this session RSE crashed
I'm not exactly sure what is happening here. I'm editing some files on my server at home, and suddenly my Eclipse crashes. At some point RSE can't sync or list a file or folder contents. The process of doing so is pending in the background. Every action after this (save, refresh etc) gets me to a full crash where Eclipse won't respond to anything i do and i have to manually kill the process.
I can't really get much clearer then this. Sometimes i can work for hours without any crashes, sometimes i have crashes for every 2 files i'm trying to edit.
In the meanwhile my files are not saved or synced so I'm losing work here.
I am using * Eclipse 3.5.1 from the ubuntu repositories * Ubuntu... (2.6.31-17, but had same with 16) * RSE End-User Runtime 3.1.1.v200907301400 * java-6-openjdk
Today i've been so lucky (...) to have lots of crashes, so it was pretty easy to get a clean logfile. Attached file ([projectfolder]/.metadata/.log) was empty when i started the session, and this is whats left after i killed the process. However it doesn't look very informative for this particular problem.
The logs in .metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.rse.* are empty. Are there any more places i can look?

issue.title: Problem with excessive checks for existing unpacked objects during clone
issue.description:
During the clone on the client side, for each fetched object, it is checked if the unpacked object exists in the objects directory. For big repositories on windows (600MB) this delays clone process by 1.5-2 times. The stack trace for these calls is like the following:
at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:106) at org.eclipse.jgit.util.IO.readFully(IO.java:86) at org.eclipse.jgit.util.IO.readFully(IO.java:67) at org.eclipse.jgit.lib.UnpackedObjectLoader.<init>(UnpackedObjectLoader.java:76) at org.eclipse.jgit.lib.ObjectDirectory.openObject2(ObjectDirectory.java:254) at org.eclipse.jgit.lib.ObjectDatabase.openObjectImpl2(ObjectDatabase.java:231) at org.eclipse.jgit.lib.ObjectDatabase.openObject(ObjectDatabase.java:196) at org.eclipse.jgit.lib.Repository.openObject(Repository.java:274) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.IndexPack.verifySafeObject(IndexPack.java:752) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.IndexPack.whole(IndexPack.java:735) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.IndexPack.indexOneObject(IndexPack.java:686) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.IndexPack.index(IndexPack.java:310) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.BasePackFetchConnection.receivePack(BasePackFetchConnection.java:525) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.BasePackFetchConnection.doFetch(BasePackFetchConnection.java:218) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.BasePackFetchConnection.fetch(BasePackFetchConnection.java:184) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.FetchProcess.fetchObjects(FetchProcess.java:197) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.FetchProcess.executeImp(FetchProcess.java:137) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.FetchProcess.execute(FetchProcess.java:103) at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.Transport.fetch(Transport.java:807)
The attached patch solves the problem by remembering state of object's directory before starting fetch and using it when verifying pack.

attachments.attach: The patch that fixes the problem

issue.title: Validation of the issue number using bugtraq:logregex is broken
Adopt Windows 7 DirectX 2D API - use it instead of old GDI+ API
issue.description:
Draw2D suffers from GDI+ painting performance with anti-alias enabled. In particular the performance degrades when dash-lines are painted. Draw2D solution for this problem would be paint without anti-alias and then when UI thread is free paint the same thing again with anti-alias. This solution is overly-complicated and doesn't fit well in the current framework.
Given that OpenGL 3-rd party Java bindings: LWJGL and JOGL can't be part of Orbit, because of the IP test failures, Draw2D would be interested in faster SWT rendering at least on Windows 7.

attachments.attach: test project with initial Direct2D support

issue.title: API tooling warnings being suppressed unexpectedly
issue.description:
It took me a while to narrow this down to a small set of reproducible steps. It all started when some API tooling warnings that I know where in the code unexpectedly disappeared on me and then suddenly reappeared. Many hours of troubleshooting led me to a scenario that seems 100% reproducible.
Using Eclipse 3.6M4 1. Create a new workspace 2. Set the workspace's API baseline. This step is not necessary but will let us avoid a distracting, unrelated warning. 3. Extract the attached projects.zip to the workspace directory. 4. Import the projects via File > Import > General > Existing Project into Workspace 5. Wait till the projects finish building 6. Note there are no warnings in 'testproject'. This is the bug. There should be an API warning. We can all of a sudden make the warning appear. 7. Open Whatever.java in the editor. Change the file in a pointless way--e.g., add a newline at the end. Save the file. All of a sudden you'll see the API tooling report a warning for Whatever.foo().
Note the project has a .settings/.api_filters file which references a non-existent resource. That should NOT result in unrelated API warnings being suppressed, which is what's happening.
Note, too, that the broken behavior seems very fragile. Seemingly unrelated changes to the project can make the problematic behavior go away. For example, removing 'testproject's dependency on the core-cdt project hides the problem. It makes no sense. There's something squirrely going one, but as long as you have a 100% reproducible case, you should be able to get to the bottom of it. The above steps are 100% reproducible for me.

issue.title: TypeElement.getEnclosedElements does not respect source order
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
Per the specs, getEnclosedElements should return items in source order. However, it seems to return them in alphabetical order.
I'm making an annotation where method parameters in a generated class are based on the source order of the annotated class. This is what would make the most sense to the user. Alphabetical is at least deterministic, but source order is preferable.
http://download.java.net/jdk7/docs/api/javax/lang/model/element/TypeElement.html
(Also, will debugging, I'm pretty sure I noticed getAllMembers uses hash maps internally and so will result in non-deterministic ordering. I was originally using getAllMembers and so I suspected it to be the culprit. However, removing it is still sorting orders alphabetically. I'd like to use getAllMembers if it would also respect source order--perhaps base class items first, source order, then sub class items next, also source order.)
javac does return source order, which makes building cross-compiler annotation processors more complicated. I'll have to re-sort on own, most likely alphabetically since that is all I can do, so that both Eclipse and javac output is the same.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Make a source class with two fields bFoo first and aFoo second. 2. Make an annotation processor that calls getEnclosedElements and the order is aFoo then bFoo.

attachments.attach: Very dirty/ugly workaround for getting declaration order enclosed elements.

issue.title: [target] New proposed target API breaks API tools
issue.description:
I20100121-0800
Helping test the new API from the branch, I found a few places that the current state of the branch breaks API tools. In our baseline and API use code when building the bundle collection we use IResolvedBundle to get at the BundleInfo and to know if a bundle is a source bundle or not and to get the location information.
In the API branch this type has been removed, and updating our code to use the "new world" i.e. ITargetDefinition.getProvisionedBundles(), does not allow us to know if any of the bundles are source bundles or not.
Affected API tools classes:
ApiBaselineWizardPage ApiUseScanJob

issue.title: [commands] Specialized exceptions to indicate type of GDB error
issue.description:
From the CDT dev list
-----Original Message----- From: cdt-dev-bounces@eclipse.org [mailto:cdt-dev-bounces@eclipse.org] On Behalf Of John Cortell Sent: January-19-10 4:40 PM To: CDT General developers list.; CDT DEV (cdt-dev@eclipse.org) Subject: Re: [cdt-dev] Getting GDB error message in DSF-GDB
It would be nice if we could take it a step further--if the GDB plugin could produce specialized exceptions based on the message, so that handlers further up the call chain could check for specific errors without having to do that parsing. Basically, the knowledge of what messages to expect from a particular gdb would be maintained at the lower levels of the solution, as that is where such backend-specific knowledge belongs. This would help us address issues like https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=288305 in a cleaner way.
At 03:14 PM 1/19/2010, Marc Khouzam wrote:
Hi,
using DSF-GDB, does anyone know of a good way to have access to the GDB error message when an MI command fails? From what I see, we include the error message within a string that says:
Failed to execute MI command: -trace-define-variable marc Error message from debugger back end: Name of trace variable should start with '$'
I just want the last line, so as to show it to the user in an error line.
In AbstractMIControl, this full string is passed back to the requestMonitor as a Status with the full string as the Status message.
Of course I could parse this string, but that doesn't seem very elegant. I don't want to change the format of the string because I don't want to do all the regression tests that come with it.
My thought is to create an Exception and put the backend message in there, and then to pass that Exception in the Status (since right now, no Exception is passed).
If anyone has a better idea, let me know.
Thanks
Marc

issue.title: Better handling for out of sync files
issue.description:
Hello,
frequently I receive a error similar to the following during text search.
------------- Problems encountered during text search. File 'com.example.test/conf/editor.preferences' has been skipped, problem while reading: ('Resource is out of sync with the file system: '/com.example.test/conf/editor.preferences'.'). Resource is out of sync with the file system: '/com.example.test/conf/editor.preferences'. --------------
This problem can be solved by manually refreshing the workspace / or the affected resource.
Would it be possible to add the functionality in search that if search find such a problem that is automatically refresh the affected resource?
Best regards, Lars

issue.title: Support JUnit 4 and new eclipse test framework
issue.description:
I'm having some issues when trying to get Athena working with the new Junit 4 headless support.
[build] [exec] [echo] testPluginDirRoot: /opt/users/hudsonbuild/.hudson/jobs/cbi-wtp-inc-xquery/workspace/build/athena/testing/target/eclipse/dropins/xquery/eclipse/plugins [build] [exec] [echo] testPluginName: org.eclipse.wst.xquery.tests [build] [exec] [for] org.eclipse.wst.xquery.tests: The following error occurred while executing this line: [build] [exec] [for] /opt/public/cbi/build/org.eclipse.dash.common.releng/builder/tests/test.xml:545: *** [build] [exec] [for] Error in builder/tests/test.xml! [build] [exec] [for] Must define 'org.foo.ui.test.suite=org.foo.ui.test.AllTests' in your .releng/testing.properties [build] [exec] [for] to identify which test suite to run, or, for more complex options, must create custom [build] [exec] [for] org.eclipse.wst.xquery.tests_*/test.xml [build] [exec] [for] ***
The testing.properties is unchanged, only the framework has changed. I tried following the directions in:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/Eclipse/Testing/JUnit4_Changes
And changed the map entries to point to the latest version, but still no go.

issue.title: NLS missing message: Unexpected_exception in: org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.metadata.messages org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.SiteFeature cannot be cast to org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.SiteModel
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 1017
NLS missing message: Unexpected_exception in: org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.metadata.messages org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.SiteFeature cannot be cast to org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.SiteModel
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Launch Eclipse 2.Attempt to Add Surround SCM plugin 3.NLS missing message: Unexpected_exception in: org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.metadata.messages org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.SiteFeature cannot be cast to org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.updatesite.SiteModel

issue.title: Missing package export in jst.j2ee
issue.description: I'm sure it was just an oversight, but there is a missing export-package in jst.j2ee for the new package containing participants. As a result, PDE completely blocks all access to this package from downstream plugins instead of it's usual "don't use internals" warning. This blocks adopters from extending these classes and can make it hard to extend the new JEE module delegates as well.

issue.title: [ui] 'Finish' button remains enabled if I go back and select more components to install
issue.description:
I20100119-0800
1. Help > Install New Software... 2. Select the 'Helios - http://download.eclipse.org/releases/helios' site from the combo control. 3. Select 'Collaboration > Mylyn WikiText'. 4. Click 'Next >' and 'Next >' again. 5. Accept the license. 6. The 'Finish' button should enable (maybe not, I talked to Susan, if not just restart from step 1). 7. Click '< Back' and '< Back' again. 8. Select 'Collaboration > Eclipse Communication Framework SDK'. 9. Click 'Finish'.
Installation proceeds without me accepting ECF licenses. :|

issue.title: ROV and RTA leverage path mapping in CCS
issue.description:
CCS 4 supports a path mapping feature (under preferences -> C/C++ -> debug -> Common Source Lookup) which allows TISB users to map Linux paths to Windows drives, e.g. /db/vtree -> V:. This is used to aid in source lookup when debugging.
ROV and RTA should also look at these mappings to help it locate the ROV recap and RTA XML files.
The ROV core cannot have a dependency on this tool, so the process of locating the recap file needs to be abstracted out in a way that would allow the CCS plugins to provide code for locating the files.

issue.title: Move J2EE participants out of jst.j2ee
issue.description:
Most of the existing J2EE flatten participants, e.g.: o.e.j.j2ee.internal.common.exportmodel.AddClasspathReferencesParticipant o.e.j.j2ee.internal.common.exportmodel.AddMappedOutputFoldersParticipant o.e.j.j2ee.internal.common.exportmodel.IgnoreJavaInSourceFolderParticipant o.e.j.j2ee.internal.common.exportmodel.ReplaceManifestExportParticipant o.e.j.j2ee.internal.common.exportmodel.SingleRootExportParticipant
(but maybe not o.e.j.j2ee.internal.common.exportmodel.JEEHeirarchyExportParticipant)
aren't really JEE related at all. They should be useful and reusable for any WTP-based flexible project structure. Can they be moved to (e.g.) jst.common so that they can be reused without a direct dependency on J2EE tools?

issue.title: [target] Icon in target preference page doesn't update on apply
issue.description:
1) Open Target Platform Preference Page 2) Create two targets, one with an error. 3) Have the working target be the active platform 4) Check the error target to make it active 5) Hit apply Result: Resolve/provision fails, details say that an error occurred
If a target with errors is edited, the icon will change. The same thing should happen on apply.

issue.title: Comparison of String Objects using == or !=
issue.description: There are several places in the SSE.core where String Objects or Parameters are being compared with == or !=. Will provide a patch for this.

issue.title: join table join column default name in bidirectional relationship is wrong
Move SingleRootUtil out of jst.j2ee
issue.description:
The SingleRootUtil class is useful, and not just applicable to J2EE projects - it could be used for any project that uses the WTP flexible project structure. Please move it (or a copy/utility methods) out into jst.common or a similar location so that adopters do not need a J2EE dependency.
See bug 300425 for a similar request.

issue.title: [performance] String concatination using + in Loops.
issue.description: There are several places where string concatination is happening in various for loops. This can cause performance issues. Will address and provide a patch for this.

attachments.attach: Fix for String Concatenation in Loops

issue.title: Delete all breakpoints in container question should not delete selected breakpoints in container
issue.description:
I20100121-0800
Steps
1. set grouping in the breakpoints view to be by breakpoint type 2. add a class load and method breakpoint to a Java class (for example) 3. select all breakpoints and groups in the view (Ctrl + A) 4. hit the delete key 5. press "No" in the resulting dialog asking to delete all breakpoints in the selected containers 6. watch as all of your breakpoints get deleted
If however at step 4 you press the remove all breakpoints view action and press "No" in the resulting dialog nothing happens - your breakpoints will not be deleted.
I would expect the response to the dialog to be the same regardless of where it is used - in this case I would expect it to do nothing pressing the delete key when I press "No".

issue.title: Add project files to org.eclipse.cosmos.me.sdd.tooling.pct
issue.description: Eclipse project files are missing from org.eclipse.cosmos.me.sdd.tooling.pct and need to be added.

issue.title: [performance] Some inner classes should be static inner classes
issue.description: There are several inner classes that should be made static for performance reasons. This can reduce the sizes of the classes and help free them sooner for grabage collection. I'll attach a patch to address this.

issue.title: Creating remote directory with spaces should not end up with backslash in final name
issue.description:
If one uses RemoteToolsFileStore.mkdir("/tmp/my path"), then it will end up with the following directory name on the target machine: /tmp/my\ path
We should not end up with having the directory name including the backslash character. The problem seems to occur in PathTools.quote method.
Regards,
Emmanuel.

I20100119-0800

issue.title: Field references are not always resolved to the correct owning member
issue.description:
Created attachment 156877 [details] field resolution
I20100121-0800
When our reference extractor handles field references it does not correctly report references to fields from the class hierarchy- for example setting / getting a field value from a parent class.
I our current state we always consider field get / set instructions to belong to the type that the reference appears in. We should be resolving field get / set to make sure they are talking about the correct field.
The patch provides field resolution for class hierarchies, but I have not tested it to see if it will properly resolve the owning class for a field reference in an inner type where the field comes from the hierarchy of the enclosing type.

issue.title: [find/replace] Find / Replace causes rendering corruption when replacing \n.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
Using the Find / Replace dialog to replace text using \n as the regex causes unexpected results.
Additionally: The caret regex should match the beginning of each line, without needing to match an additional character. It needs to work the same way sed does:
eg: printf "foo\nbar\nbaz" | sed 's#^#SSS#g'
Currently, the Caret operator in Find/Replace needs an additional regex symbol (eg:.?) in order to function.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Find: \n 2.Replace with: \nfoobar 3.tic "Regular Expression" 4.hit "Replace" button

issue.title: [hotbug] [performance] TLDCMDocumentManager repeatedly reloads TLD from jar.
issue.description:
This is a request to back port the fix for bug 297153 to the WTP 3.1.2 code line. The patch attached to the bug has already been committed to the 3.2 code line.
Affiliation : Hotbug request from Oracle Release requested: 3.1.2 Justification: This has a significant improvement in the performance for the adopter product.

issue.title: Agent service lifecycle problems
issue.description:
I20100121
We still rely on the start() and stop() methods in various p2 bundles to do initialization and cleanup. Most of this work should be moved into agent lifecycle methods instead, since the lifecycle of a p2 agent does not necessarily match the lifecycle of the bundles providing the agent services (although it happens to be true in the SDK case for the agent of the currently running system).

attachments.attach: Additional changes to track service removals

issue.title: [Actions] Deadlock occurs when flushing redo stack on diagram during a modal action
issue.description:
Created attachment 156886 [details] patch
While ModalContext thread is running, calling thread flushes async display messages. (UI thread == main thread). If redo stack is flashed from the ModalContext thread then if there are actions updated asynchronously and some synchronously, then the async updates would happen on the caller thread at the same time as sync updates on the ModalContext thread.
When Eclipse's UndoActionHandler is refreshed, it is being refreshed asynchronously and it requires undo-redo lock from the operation history object. The lock however is owned by the ModalContext thread for flushing redo stack. Therefore, undo action handler's refresh is blocked until redo stack is flushing completes.
Redo stack flushing cannot complete because GMF AbstractContributionItem can listen to operation history and do an update of the action synchronously, which cannot be done because it is blocked by the main thread flushing scheduled async messages, in this particular case, the undo action handler blocked by the undo-redo lock on operation history.
GMF should schedule action updates on the UI thread instead of running them right away.

issue.title: [ui] help>check for updates should open on first page of wizard
issue.description:
From bug 300445:
> The update wizard starts on page 2 and assumes I want to update everything. I > _really_ don't want that. I only want to update the SDK so I have to press '< > Back', unselect all the stuff I don't want to update, then press 'Next >' to > get back to where the wizard started, but with the correct list.
The assumption we've had is that most users want to update everything to the latest version most of the time, and we are saving those users a step.
There's some discussion in bug 268166 about having more preferences that would let you say which updates you care about in general (or which you don't care about). That might solve the problem.
Lacking that, we could consider a generic preference controlling which page you land on in the update wizard. (the code is already set up with a flag for this, we just don't use it right now). We previously had bugs saying "why do I have to click next when 99% of the time I just want the latest of everything?"

issue.title: Map file URLs concatenated in IE on Windows
issue.description: - enter a few "short" map file URLs (e.g. http://test1 and http://test2) on map_files.php in IE on Windows platform - save the map file URLs - select the project and version to display the map file URLs again - map file URLs are concatenated and not separated into one per line

issue.title: Finish button in New Project wizard is enabled even if JSF facet does not have library information
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20100119-0800
The Finish button in the New Project wizard is enabled even if JSF facet does not have library information, which leads to errant and inconsistent behavior.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: * In a new workspace, open the File > New > Dynamic Web Project wizard * Enter a project name and target runtime * From the Configuration dropdown, select "JavaServer Faces v1.2 project"
Expected Results: The Finish button should be disabled, as the JSF facet does not have any information about the JSF libraries. (Also see note on inconsistent behavior below)
Actual Results: The Finish button is enabled. When one clicks on it, the JSF project is created, but the JSF taglibs are not available etc.
Notes:
* After the "Steps to Reproduce" above, if you click on the "Next" button till you arrive at the "JSF Capabilities" page, you will see that the Finish button is disabled on that page now.
* At this point if one clicks on the Back button till you arrive at the "Dynamic Web Project" wizard page, one can see that the "Finish" button is disabled, which is inconsistent (it was enabled the first time).

PASV 200 NOOP command successful.
NOOP 250 CWD command successful.

The bug is similar to Bug 255117

The screenshot of error while importing projects from CVS

issue.title: [content assist] Overwrite mode does not replace existing characters fully when new chars are added and caret is moved
semantic highlighting of functions with default argument
EclipseLink should throw a more specific exception than NPE
issue.description:
Build Identifier: GlassFish Tools Bundle For Eclipse Version: 1.2 Based on Eclipse build id: M20090917-080
Missing declaration of @IdClass throws unspecific exception where it could state that there is no primarykey set: Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.metadata.MetadataDescri ptor.setPKClass(MetadataDescriptor.java:1516)
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. generate tables out of attached classes

attachments.attach: Proposed changes (minor updates from previous patch)

issue.title: Open call hierarchy doesn't work for constructors.
Copy AbstractOpenWizardWorkbenchAction and AbstractOpenWizardAction of org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ui to org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.ui after deprecating it.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20090430-2300
AbstractOpenWizardWorkbenchAction and AbstractOpenWizardAction of org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ui is independent of J2EE context.Ideally they should be in a non jst plugin. They can be moved to org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.ui and can be deprecated in org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ui.Attaching a CVS patch (created on head)for the enhancement.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: NPE block to edit aggregation binding
issue.description:
Description: NPE block to edit aggregation binding
Build number: 2.5.2.v20100122-0630
Steps to reproduce: 1, New a table or crosstab binding with data set or cube 2, New an aggregation binding 3, Edit the aggregation binding and modify the function 4, Click OK
Expected result: Editing is successful
Actual result: NPE block the editing

issue.title: [modeling] [masterdetails] Remove button and remove toolbar action should be bound to the EmfActionBarContributor's Delete action
issue.description: When an EmfActionBarContributor is associated with the editor, and that a DELETE action is available, use it preferably.

attachments.attach: Use the DELETE action of the EmfActionBarContributor when available
Reuse the Action already defined for the remove toolbar action to the Remove button

issue.title: Provide capability to remove the invalid default instance of a driver template
issue.description:
An extension of the org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.driverExtension extension point may define a driver template with a defaultDefinitionName. A corresponding default driver definition will then get automatically created, but only if none was previously created. However, the default driver definition may become invalid over time, e.g. its jar file path got moved. But since the default driver definition was created automatically, an application user may not be aware of its existence and does not know to manually fix its jar path.
This enhancement is to provide the API capability to remove an invalid default driver definition. A client application may use it to do clean up, and can then trigger the automatic creation of a new up-to-date default driver definition.

issue.title: Add keyboard mnemonics to EJB Bean wizards
issue.description: The Session Bean wizard and Message-Driven Bean wizard need improvement in keyboard accessibility. This enhancement will: 1) check if there is at least one successful path by using only the keyboard 2) add keyboard mnemonics 3) fix label capitalization

issue.title: Add keyboard mnemonics to XDoclet EJB Bean wizards
issue.description: The XDoclet Bean wizard needs improvement in keyboard accessibility. This enhancement will: 1) check if there is at least one successful path by using only the keyboard 2) add keyboard mnemonics 3) fix label capitalization

issue.title: Cascade Delete logic implemented in wrong place
issue.description:
The logic for cascade delete is implemented in :
The ui plugin - inside TSDeleteAction the visualeditor - inside TSRemoveFromModelAction.
This means that deletes done from the API will never be cascade deleted.
The logic should be moved to the base plugin, whoich will also mean that the preference that contrrols this should alos be moved to the base plugin.
The existing (non functioning) preference has been disabled - see 298971.

issue.title: Action is always disabled
issue.description:
Created attachment 156911 [details] Test Case
This is action with 2-step shortcut (Ctrl+G,R). If the key assist dialog appears, the action will not be triggered.
It works fine on Windows, but not on Ubuntu nor Solaris.
It is reproducible on 3.5.1 and 3.6.
After enabling command tracing, handlers are not computed if the key assist dialog appears.

issue.title: In Module Assembly wizard, too many references are displayed
issue.description:
Created attachment 156912 [details] Showing references that shouldn't exist.
The module assembly page, as of right now, is a thin view of the component.xml file. In a workspace which contains 1 ear and 2 ejb's (all connected to each other), the properties page currently shows one ejb to be bundled inside the other.
This is incorrect and the component.xml shows no such thing. This is due to J2EEModuleVirtualComponent.getReferences() returning references that are not "hard" references. This should be fixed.
Also, the wizard is showing a reference to a jar in the parent Ear project, which clearly does not need to be shown here.

attachments.attach: The fix patch ;) uses getNonManifestReferences instead in case of ignore_derived_reference flag

issue.title: Add keyboard mnemonics to JPA Entity wizards
issue.description: The Entity wizard and Mapping File wizard need improvement in keyboard accessibility. This enhancement will: 1) check if there is at least one successful path by using only the keyboard 2) add keyboard mnemonics 3) fix label capitalization

issue.title: SQL Server functions are not supported in SQL Query Builder
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
In Birt SQL Query builder, When I use the SQL server data source and enter a query with built in functions it is not supporting and says error message.
For example, if I use the below query in SQL query builder,
SELECT LEFT('ABCDEFGH', 2)
BIRT says an error message "SQL syntax is wrong or is not currently supported. Some SQL builder functions have been disabled. To enable these functions change the syntax."
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a new data set 2. Select SQL Server data source 3. Enter a query with built in function/customised functions

issue.title: [Dialogs] [JFace] Provide accessor for dialog messages
issue.description: It would be nice to have access to the Dialog messages (eg. IDialogConstants.OK_LABEL) trough API instead of a field access. This would allow the RAP team to provide a session-based translation for the labels and furthermore improves the usability for our current users. Developers who want to single-source their applications for RCP and RAP cannot use the existing API of JFace as the labels are hardcoded as static fields and RAP has no chance to intervene this behavior without breaking API. I suggest to provide an accessor like SWT.getMessage() to get the translated string as this would allow developers to use the same API in RCP and JFace. I'd be happy to provide a patch once we decided on a possible approach. As suggested above, I'd introduce an accessor on Dialog itself and introduce message keys in IDialogConstants.

issue.title: [Designer] Delete Part breaks the referential integrity
issue.description:
An element is holded always by a containment reference, it can be referenced also by non-containment references. We we delete an element, we need to: 1. remove it from the containment reference 2. Remove all non-containment references
We need to keep all information to undo this operation.
By now, we perfom only 1 operation. Sometime, it breaks completely the referential integrity of the resource file and make it unloadable.

issue.title: containerData of Part gets changed automatically
issue.description:
Created attachment 156916 [details] testcase resource
1. create an e4 Application 2. copy the attached file in this project 3. Open this file with e4 Designer 4. Delete the PartStack at the right 5. Undo the delete
The containerData of "deleted part" gets changed from 500 to 200.

issue.title: New web site and logos.
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
The web site are being rebuilt (the pages and logos are reviewed ) Can you clarify which of the old contents/pages will be removed or added.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Suggestion: www.playframework.org - change the code, hit F5 and do it again
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
Dear Jetty development team,
First of all, thank you for this tool. Jetty is my preferred server, for development and production. Together with the maven jetty plugin, life is a joy.
But it doesn't mean that it can't be better. I've come to know the play framework (www.playframework.org) which does not compare with Jetty, since are different tools, but the play framework has a really interesting development model, I don't know exactly how (the framework developer claims it uses eclipse compiler behind scenes) but you start the web server and don't stop it anymore. Refreshs are light speed fast.
Anyway, I just though this could be some thing interesting to Jetty.
Thank you again.
Best regards, Samuel.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: N/A

issue.title: [Preferences] there is no option in preferences to set view background color
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
I use Window -> Preferences -> General -> Editors -> Text editors -> Background color to setup background for editor. But there is no option for setting background color for view. I expect such option should be added to allow L&F customization.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Failures in [Tree]TableRidgetTest: rounding errors
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
Auto-sizing columns using TableLayout can result in rounding errors, e.g. 3-column table with total width of 85 is split into columns of widths 29, 28, 28, respectively. The tests assert equal widths of (int) totalWidth / 3, i.e. 28. So it fails for the first column.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [Usability] Splash-style login dialog does not appear in task bar
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
When using the "splash login view" (http://wiki.eclipse.org/Riena_Login_support#Provide_own_splash_login_view), there is no indication in the task bar that the Riena app is running.
While this may consistent with what splash screens are originally for (something shown *before* the actual application is actually available for use), it's bad in terms of usability.
Use case: Launch the Riena app -> switch to another application -> forget about the launched Riena app... You will only "remember" that you launched the Riena app when you minimize or close the other active windows covering the splash login view.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [find/replace] Clone of bug 80667 (3.2.2+)
issue.description:
Created attachment 156924 [details] patch for 3.2.2
This is backported version of combined fix for 44422, 80667, and 51530. Target for this patch is 3.2.2+.

issue.title: [All Diagrams] Avoid graphical suppression of External labels
issue.description:
Papyrus does not prevent from deleting labels (directly by selecting and suppr) in diagrams.
To reproduce: - Create a class diagram, 2 packages, 1 dependency between packages - Select dependency label - Hit "Del" key
The label is removed from diagram.

issue.title: unidirectional one-to-many relationship with compound key and join table fails
[Cocoa] System beep (bong) when giving focus to a GMF editor
issue.description:
Created attachment 156931 [details] Beep stack
We are using GMF under MacOSX/Cocoa. When giving the focus from another view to a GMF editor, we here a system beep ("bong"). We get this strange behavior with our editor (cf www.bonitasoft.com), and we could reproduce it in an Eclipse SKK with the STP-BPMN editor.
You can find attached the stack of methods that ends with a Display.beep().
This beep is due to the fact that, on Cocoa, giving focus to a GMF editor refreshes the zoom combobox in toolbar, and this refresh causes an exception, which is caught and user is warned with a "bong". Then I don't know who is really the culprit between GMF, GEF and SWT...
This is Cocoa specific: the same manipulation works well with Windows, Linux, and Carbon.
The workaround we used is to remove the zoomContribution on our editors.

issue.title: org.eclipse.gmt.modisco.infra.browser.custom.examples.java.jdk
issue.description:
Created attachment 156932 [details] org.eclipse.gmt.modisco.infra.browser.custom.examples.java.jdk (plug-in and test)
Hi,
You can find in the attachments an archive containing an example plug-in and its corresponding test plug-in.
This example plug-in contains an example of MoDisco browser customization dedicated to the JDK and Eclipse classes. This example has been presented at ESE 2009.
The contributors of the plug-ins are: - Grégoire Dupé (committer) - Nicolas Guyomar (not committer)
Regards, Grégoire Dupé

"select cri from Criminal cri, City c where cri.attachedCop member of c.cops" "select cri from Criminal cri, City c where cri member c.criminals"

issue.title: [JUnit] Use of require-bundle for org.junit
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090211-1700
The test plugin org.eclipse.jdt.junit.runtime should not get its JUnit dependency via Require-Bundle, but by using Import-Package. Require-Bundle is acceptable for *eclipse*-bundles, but should not be used for JUnit, which can also be retrieved from other places (e.g. SpringSource Repository) and then have a different bundle symbolic name.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Cannot create working branches in ATS except at root
issue.description:
In OSEE 0.9.0, a restriction has been added in ATS that working branches cannot be created from working branches (which is not unreasonable). The parent branch for the version needs to be a baseline.
However, it seems that the only branches that are considered to be baseline branches are those with no parent.
This prevents parallel development of different projects using the same product line (which is our use case, and the example used in the OSEE tutorial).
Is there an undocumented option to change what defines a baseline branch or is this a bug in the code?

issue.title: Too large description creates automatic window/View resize and horizontal scrolling bar
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20080221-1800
Quand il y a beaucoup de texte, la zone Description de l'onglet Properties s'ajuste à la phrase de plus grande longueur. Ce qui provoque la création d'un ascenseur horizontal. Ce n'est vraiment pas pratique.
Quelque soit le texte affiché, il ne faut pas qu'il y ait un ascenseur. Tout le texte doit tenir dans la largeur de l'onglet (qui est d'ailleurs conditionné par la largeur de la fenêtre MelodyAdvance).
L'horizontal scroll bar devrait être automatiquement positionnée dans le cas de longue chaine dans les "text field" (champ "names" par exemple) et un retour à la ligne pour les text Area (champ "Description" par exemple).
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Taper du texte dans les champs description (text area) et nom (text field)

issue.title: [backend] add java method pointcut test
issue.description:
The functionality to advise functions is implemented (and works for b3 functions at least). Tests are needed to test advised java methods, the tests should cover: - advise modifies an input parameter (the java method should get the modified value on proceed) - advise modifies a varargs value (- " -) - advice replaces the entire varargs array (- " -)
Look at testFunctionCrossCuts.b3 for similar tests for b3 function.
Suggest writing a Java class with suitable methods to use for testing.

issue.title: Is it time to retire the RCP Case Studies page?
issue.description:
The old case studies page [1] looks dated. The contents of the page have already been ported over to the resources page [2].
Should we just retire the old case studies page and provide a redirect to the resources page? I'll fix "studys"...
[1] http://www.eclipse.org/community/rcp.php [2] http://www.eclipse.org/resources/?sort=date&category=RCP&type=study

issue.title: [UI] Clean up label provider implementations
issue.description:
Currently, the hierarchy of label providers in Xtext is quite large and a bit unclear. Into the bargain, the naming is not very helpful, e.g. what is the difference between DefaultLabelProvider and SimpleLabelProvider?
We have multiple (orthogonal) features, which are not clearly separated:
0) Base functionality (JFace LabelProvider) 1) Image loading infrastructure 2) Delegation to EMF AdapterFactory 3) Styled text labels 4) Polymorphic dispatch of image() and text()
I'd suggest to have a) an AbstractLabelProvider implementing 1) and 2) b) a subclass StyledLabelProvder containing all code related to styled text c) with another subclass DeclarativeStyledLabelProvider.

issue.title: Italian messages not found (no useful fallback).
issue.description:
Essentially all strings (labels and the like) are replaced by:
NLS missing message: XxxPropertyEditionPart_YyyLabel in it.condarelli.rcp.writer.model.world.providers.worldMessages
I assume I have to do something about internationalization, but I don't know what (unless I have just to do the normal string editing (Externakize Strings Wizard)).
I also have a bunch of (possibly related) errors on the console:
... ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2 1 2010-01-21 17:41:20.203 !MESSAGE NLS missing message: PropertiesEditionPart_AddListViewerLabel in: it.condarelli.rcp.writer.model.world.providers.worldMessages
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2 1 2010-01-21 17:41:20.203 !MESSAGE NLS missing message: PropertiesEditionPart_RemoveListViewerLabel in: it.condarelli.rcp.writer.model.world.providers.worldMessages
This bunch of errors come from the fact I have an Italian locale on my PC, so I understand I have o copy worldMessages.properties to worldMessages_it.properties and, possibly, edit it.
I did that and now I have my labels as they should.
I see this as a bug: If the correct locale is not found EEF should fall-back to the "neutral"(English) file.
About this Stéphane Bouchet said: Yes, because there is actually 3 properties files. one english, one french and one default ( same as english ). EEF should display the default one if it not find the italian :)
We will also move to BABEL to internationalize EEF, i you would like to help for italian internationalization.
This is something I would expect and I surely can live with. Unfortunately this is not what happens in my case: I see only two files xxxMessages.properties and xxxMessages_fr.properties (no xxxMessages_en.properties!!) *AND* my output is completely garbled (no labels) unless I provide an xxxMessages_it.properties (no fallback).
If required I can attach my whole project.

issue.title: Add FUNCTION support to extended JPQL
issue.description:
In order to allow developers to use database functions in their criteria specified queries JPA 2.0 introduced CriteriaBuilder.function method. This enhancement will add comparable functionality into EclipseLink JPQL. The goal is to address custom database operators and common functions not supported by JPQL.
Potential SYNTAX:
FUNCTION('SDO_WITHIN_DISTANCE, :GEOM1, :GEOM2, 'distance = 1000') = 'TRUE'
Additional items to consider in this feature: - using platform registered ExpressionOperator by name - stored functions

issue.title: Statistcal model loader adds CounterDescriptors to model before setting name attribute
issue.description:
This is not a functional defect, but rather a performance enhancement.
Consuming products key off of descriptor and counter descriptor names to perform realtime analysis and aggregation of statistical data. When counter descriptors arrive in the model without names (which happens for all counter descriptors but for no descriptors), we must register a listener to wait for the name to be assigned before we can process it. In the case of very large workflows, this can result in the unnecessary creation, firing, processing and garbage collecting of millions of unnecessary adapter objects. In very extreme cases, we can exhaust the heap simply by pushing too many counter descriptors into the model and being unable to keep up with the garbage collection of all the adapters. If the model loader sets the name before adding the counter descriptor to the model, none of these objects needs to even be created, resulting in a substantial performance and memory utilization improvement.
I'll attach a patch for further discussion and review.

issue.title: Refactor graphics API
issue.description: Currently, the Graphics API (Graphics3D, Graphics3DDraw etc) is very messy. It mixes concerns and abstraction levels. Some of the functions are high level and some are low level, some abstract from the OpenGL API and some don't. This needs to be cleaned up. We need to choose one level of abstraction and define a new API based on that. Also we need to define whether we want to use the Graphics API for things like export because this may have an impact on the level of abstraction possible with such an API. Also there needs to be a more low level API that encapsulates from the OpenGL layer if we want to be able to support different OpenGL layers (JOGL, LWJGL etc).

issue.title: [API] Provide ImageData hooks in JFace
issue.description:
There are several places in JFace where we don't offer API that involves ImageData. As ImageData is now available, we should provide the API as needed.
APIs that are interesting candidates are: * ImageDescriptor (and subclasses)#getImageData * ImageRegistry * Image#getImageData

issue.title: preserve indentation when substituting a multi-line string in a template file
[preferences] Create a problem if a new project specific setting is introduced
issue.description:
I20100121-0800.
Currently when we introduce a new setting (e.g. JDT Core problem) and the project is configured to use project specific settings, it uses the value as configured in the workspace because the new setting is not stored yet.
We should check for new settings (e.g. by attaching ourselves to the builder) and generate a problem on the project that informs about this. Of course this would come along with a quick fix.
The nice side-effect of this is that we can use it to advertise new settings through this mechanism.

issue.title: [KeyBindings] Keyboard shortcuts for clipboard copy command not working in text controls
issue.description: Using CTRL+C or CTRL+INS on a Text control (SWT) does not perform the clipboard copy operation. Note that this occurs on Text controls that are shown in a workspace view or editor (text controls shown on wizards/dialog boxes behave properly). Cut and Paste keyboard shorcuts work fine. Unbinding the copy command in the "Preferences" -> "General" -> "Keys" options (or changing the "When" condition to "Editing Text") seem to make the copy operation work, however, previous versions of Eclipse i.e. 3.3 had identical key preferences configurations yet the copy command worked on Text controls.

issue.title: Change the editor behavior of save-as.
issue.description:
Change the editor behavior of save-as.
Currently, when a test asset is 'copied' using save-as, the current editor instance for the current test asset is reloaded with the new test asset. Our consumers have defined the save-as behavior as open a new editor instance on the new test asset to support the backup use case. The save-as behavior should be changed for all TPTP test assets.

issue.title: [Code Assist] Autocomplete overwrites 1-3 characters in more scenarios and in some situation any CA for self and parent reserved words
[getter setter] Generate attribute and get/set in referenced object
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 3.4
Quite often during development I will have a reference to an object when I realize that I need an extra attribute for that object. Currently I must locate the reference declaration, CTRL-click on the class name, then add the attribute. I then use "generate getters and setters". Finally I must return back to the location I was editing.
Could a new menu and dialogue be created which will automate all of this? I was thinking that I could highlight the reference, then choose a menu item which will allow me to type in the attribute name (and type). Eclipse would then add the attribute to the class and generate the get/set. The new get or set would then be available in quick assist for the reference.
Options could be: - insertion location for the attribute name (usually just above the first constructor) - insert location for the get/set (usually at the end of the class code, but before and nested class) - scope
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [launcher] resolve relative paths for file open
issue.description:
Consider a running eclipse, we want to open a file in that running eclipse. in some directory, we invoke the launcher with --launcher.openFile and pass a relative path.
This new eclipse launcher passes the relative path to the running eclipse but that eclipse won't know how to resolve the path since its current working directory would be different.
The launcher passing off the paths will need to resolve relative paths before sending the open message.

issue.title: Switching through template keys? in fore and forek template is corrupter
[Parser] Refactoring MDT-OCL grammars to remove the use of deprecated macros
issue.description:
The new LPG template/include files introduced in the Bug 299396, discourage the use of some macros commonly used in LPGv1.x grammars such as, $getIToken, $result, etc.
This should be changed in the current MDT-OCL grammars.
Patch coming soon.

issue.title: Compiler setting sin build don't match workspace settings
issue.description:
I20100122
We have a warning in the bundle org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ql:
http://fullmoon.ottawa.ibm.com/downloads/drops/I20100122-0800/compilelogs/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.p2.ql_1.0.0.v20100121-2312/@dot.html#OTHER_WARNINGS
The warning is:
1. WARNING in /src/org/eclipse/equinox/internal/p2/ql/expression/QLFactory.java (at line 12) @SuppressWarnings("hiding") Unnecessary @SuppressWarnings("hiding")
However the field in question ("INSTANCE"), is in fact hiding a field of the same name in the superclass. If I remove the @SuppressWarnings annotation, the warning appears. Thus it appears I can't do anything to be warning-free here: either I get the warning about hiding a field, or I get a warning about unnecessary @SuppressWarnings.

issue.title: Add ability to specify filter-path to build-options that support browsing
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 7.0.0.I201001150805
Currently, build-options of browseType "file"/"directory"/etc allow the user to browse the file-system, but do not give integrators a way to set the default filter-path. So, the Browse dialog by default opens at the root of the file-system.
The attached patch adds a new optional attribute for the <option> element - "browseFilterPath". If the attribute is specified, the Browse dialog uses the supplied value as the default filter-path. Macros in the attribute value are expanded. If the attribute is not specified, the behaviour is unchanged.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a new C Project. 2. Open the Settings property page, and find a build-option that has a "file" browseType (eg. libraries) or a "directory" browseType (eg. include-path). 3. Click on Add... button to add a new entry. 4. Click on Filesystem... to browse the file-system. -> The Browse dialog opens up at the root of the file-system by default.

issue.title: To resolve compatibility issues between Eclipse 3.4 and 3.6, need an internal to be put back in GMF.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: Version: 3.6.0, I20091125-2200
Hello,
We would like to have API compatibility between our Eclipse 3.4 and 3.6 code base. We have code that needs to compile and run against a 3.4 and a 3.6 GMF. The issue that we are facing:- The Util internal API has been removed, we get a compile error in our 3.4 code base when compiled against 3.6 Eclipse. import org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.core.internal.util.Util; fails Can you please get the internal back? Or can you please give us a workaround to resolve the compile error?
Thanks, Rekha
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Review HTTP Application Component
issue.description: In Gyrex HTTP applications can be defined dynamically. They can map to URLs etc. This bug tracks various thoughts/issues/comments/notes collected as part of our continues review efforts. At some point we need to classify them and decide which we are going to address (and how) for our 1.0 release.

issue.title: [build path] user library dialog should allow to select JAR from workspace
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
When adding a jar to a user library, you are give the dialog for selecting a file with an external path.
When attaching the source attachment or native library location you can select either an external path or a workspace path.
It would be useful to also be able to specify the jar location as a workspace path, which would aid in sharing projects with other people.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open preferences, navigate to Java -> Build Path -> User Libraries 2. Click New, and enter a name for the User Library. 3. Click "Add JARs", note the dialog type. 4. Select the "Native libary location" element, click "Edit". 5. Note the dialog type which allows for choosing an External Folder or Workspace path.

issue.title: [ui] Add a "Show Disabled Repository" check box in available software sites
issue.description: I don't know if this is typical, but I have 4 enabled repos and over 20 disabled ones in my Available Software Sites. A checky box to hide the disabled ones (or show the disabled ones) would help make this list a little more manageable.

issue.title: PDE environment descriptions IU is both a category and group...
issue.description:
Created attachment 156990 [details] snapshot showing IUs in question
I20100121-0800, win7, Helios repo....
I noticed recently that the "PDE/API Tools Environment Descriptions" category appears as a subcategory of "General Purpose Tools" in the Helios repo. OK...kinda different, but not a problem.
But then I thought that the same IU was appearing as a child of itself. This is not the case, but the metadata is kind of unconventional. The attached snapshot shows the list of IU's in the repo and the corresponding properties dialog info for each IU.
It seems like the feature group IU is marked as a category. Then, the corresponding feature jar is shown alongside the other feature groups (since the feature group requires the feature jar).
I suppose there's technically not a bug here, but this is different than how most things appear, and could cause confusion because: 1 - we don't install categories, so the user won't see "PDE/API Tools Environment Descriptions" appear in the installed software list 2 - we don't show non-groups in any views or drilldown, so the feature jar of the same name won't be shown either. So it will look like it didn't get installed.
The only clue the user will have that it's installed is that they'll see it marked as installed (grayed) in the install new software list, but they won't see it anywhere else.
For this reason, I think we need to examine why the metadata is the way it is. Ideally the category would be a different IU, not the feature group itself. I also wasn't sure if a tooling bug is at play.

issue.title: "--launcher.openFile" can pick up "old" versions of Eclipse
issue.description:
The remote file open funcitonality (--launcher.openFile) picks up any running Eclipse instance that fits the specified name ("Eclipse" by default).
If an "old" Eclipse application is running (say, Eclipse 3.5 SDK), the launcher will pick it up as the target of the "--launcher.openFile" command even as it can't process this request.
We probably should try to iterate through open Eclipse processes until we find one that can accept the "--launcher.openFile" command.

issue.title: build status / return code not propagated
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
The build status needs to propagate to the returned status of the headless build application or the ant build task: Neither currently happens.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Allow plugin developers to register file extensions
issue.description:
The bug 4922 is about Eclipse <-> OS integration. In the curernt state that bug adds ability for the launcher/SWT/UI chain to open from a command line.
For instance, for Windows, that looks like: <path>\eclipsec.exe -name Eclipse --launcher.openFile <qualified file name>
What's missing is the ability for a plugin author to register file extensions that they can handle.

issue.title: Can't configure descriptor to make sequence override existing negative pk values
issue.description:
In older TopLink versions existing pk value of a registered in uow object was overridden in case it was negative or zero.
Currently there is no way to configure Eclipselink to override existing negative values (only zero is overridden by default).

attachments.attach: Addition to patch - persistence.xml for jpa test.

issue.title: Remove config.ini from equinox.p2.agent build
issue.description:
The p2.ui.admin.rcp/rcp.product file has been updated (Bug 300538) and no longer requires the config.ini file.
The releng build should be updated to not copy this file. See buildAll.xml/packageEclipseDistributables.
The config.ini file still exists in cvs, the build will work fine as it stands, we will remove it once the reference is gone from the builder.

issue.title: Cannot change user name in password required dialog
issue.description:
I selected all my eclipse projects and hit compare with repository I was prompted with a username / password dialog for cvs I mistyped my username and entered the correct password The dialog re-appears (obviously my username / password are not correct) The username field is disabled and I can only change the password -- but it's the username field that's wrong
The only workaround seems to be restart eclipse.

issue.title: Fatal problems are not removed on incremental build
issue.description:
Created attachment 156995 [details] fix
I20100122-0800
If you resolve any fatal problems - a JDT build path problem for example - and do an incremental build, the API tools error about aborting the build will not be removed.

issue.title: Sync with OCL grammar on reintroducing official LPG 2 templates.
issue.description: Stay in sync with OCL grammar modifications described in Bug 299396.

issue.title: [ui] Prov Admin Metadata repos tab does not show repositories
issue.description:
Running the Prov Admin UI (see bug 300484 re updating the launch config). Add a metadata repository and see that it does not show up in the list.
Trying to add the repo again gives a duplicate location error. Notice also that the repository preferences on disk (C:\Applications\eclipse\p2\org.eclipse.equinox.p2.engine\profileRegistry\SDKProfile.profile\.data\.settings in the default launch config) does contain the added repository.
Adding artifact repositories works fine.

issue.title: Executables View should support identical paths on different drives
issue.description:
Created attachment 156997 [details] screen shot
Original note from John:
When I add a file to the Executables view, the path to the file is recreated in the Executables project (see below). I don' tremember it doing that before. Is this a new, intentional behavior? I'm thinking maybe this was added to allow multiple same-named executables to be added? If so, then it continues to have a similar, but less likely encountered limitation. I can't add:
c:\temp\somedir\p1.exe d:\temp\somedir\p1.exe
Clearly, including the drive letter in the path would solve that, but it makes for uglier behavior.

issue.title: Add debug logging to ValidatorStrategy
issue.description: To help us understand which validators are being found and invoked, or not found or skipped, some logging would be useful.

issue.title: New forum for the Remus project
issue.description:
Please create this forum http://www.eclipse.org/forums/eclipse.remus
for this new proposal
http://www.eclipse.org/proposals/remus/
DB entry has been created. Thanks.

issue.title: remove s390* fragments from p2.installer product file in HEAD
issue.description: This is one of the reasons for bug 300567. I'll attach a patch.

issue.title: [planner] no solution when second feature patch installed by drop-in
issue.description:
Build Identifier: multiple
I tried to update a single bundle (hello) originally installed via UI by two consecutive feature patches using drop-in install.
The first patch applies fine.
However when dropping in the second feature patch it does not apply.
A log entry indicates: No solution... This occurs independent of whether the second feature patch has the same or a different id of the first patch.
This behavior was seen in 3.5.1 and 3.6 I20100115-1100. In contrast in 3.4.2 the second patch is applied in either case so that the hello bundle is updated as expected.
I am attaching the used features and feature patches.
What is the envisioned behavior of multiple feature patches applying to the same original feature version?
Without being an expert in the area I believe that in the past (pre P2) when multiple patches were applied the latest bundle versions would be active (at least for singleton).
If patches are mutual exclusive -as it appears to be- it seems one needs a way for the user to figure out what they need to uninstall so that they then can install the intended patch.
Does it matter whether patches overlap (update same bundles) or not?
What role should the feature patch id play if any?
Can/should feature patches apply to other feature patches? (I would think this gets complicated to manage quickly).
Reproducible: Always

attachments.attach: Fix the encoding of requirements when patches do not apply
Alternative solution: global fix including non greedy requirements, but requires Pending class change

issue.title: Move static method gives illegally unqualified static invocation (move to supertype)
[PropertiesView] Maximizing a tabbed properties panel often reverts to simple properties view with property of another view.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
When tabbed property panel is maximized it reverts to a simple property view with the property focus having changed to another panel's focus (ie, package explorer) from the original item of focus.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Download adobe lcds3 modeler plugin and install to eclipse 3.5 2.Install by expanding into dropins/modeler/eclipse 3. Open Data Model perspective. 4. File/New/Project and Data Model 5. In design view/style view create a new style. 6. Put focus on new style and see tabbed property view for the style. Double click this tab and notice it reverts to simple property view of another eclipse view.

issue.title: Eclipse workbench will not start if "user.home" contains invalid characters
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
I tried Eclipse 3.4, 3.5SR1, and the nightly build of 3.6. When I click on the eclipse.exe file, the splash screen loads and then I am prompted to select my workbench. When I select the workbench, the IDE opens for a split second and then crashes. I get an alert to check the log file. Everyone that has upgraded to Windows 7 from XP is experiencing this problem in the company. Here is the contents of the log file:

issue.title: [ql] Make matchExpression and contextExpression consistent
Filter does not allow !, | or & as first character of attr names
issue.description:
Created attachment 157012 [details] 3.5.x patch
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #289384 +++
The filter implementation on the framework and the FrameworkUtil class throw an exception if the attr name starts with !, | or & but these are valid characters in an attr name.
The implementation is not in compliance with the spec.
------------------------------
Opening this bug to backport the fix to 3.5.2.

issue.title: Build Path Problem: A cycle was detected in the build path of project
issue.description:
After workspace restart a plug-in bundle consistently has a build path cycle error. Modifying the bundle manifest and saving it without making any changes to Require-Bundle causes the error to go away. Import-Package is not used in this bundle.
The bundle manifest contains the following:
pre. Hi Frank and co,
I've made some progress on this. I hope you can help me fix it.

issue.title: pre, bc (block modifiers) can cause a leading empty line in the output
issue.description:
pre, bc (such as pre. and bc.) cause a blank line in the output if there's no content following the markup.
For example, here's pre causing a blank line:
pre. some content
And here's pre causing no leading blank line:
pre. some content
There's already at least one blank line preceding the pre, so the leading line of the pre should be ignored if it has no content.

issue.title: NPE thrown when invoking content assist in JavaScript block of HTML or JSP file located in project without JavaScript Nature
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
If you have JSDT installed and are working with a project which does not have JavaScript support enabled, an NPE is thrown when invoking content assist in a JavaScript block of an HTML or JSP file and none of the JSDT content assist options appear in the resulting popup (this last part may be intended behavior).
Adding JavaScript support to the project will stop the NPE from being thrown, and the JSDT content assist options now appear in the popup.

issue.title: Error logged by DsfSuspendTrigger.
issue.description:
I occasionally get the following error in the log when launching DSF-GDB:
Request for monitor: 'RequestMonitor (org.eclipse.cdt.dsf.debug.ui.contexts.DsfSuspendTrigger$4@19fa017): Status ERROR: org.eclipse.cdt.dsf code=0 null children=[Status ERROR: org.eclipse.cdt.dsf code=10001 Target not available. null]' resulted in an error.

issue.title: SWT.SINGLE Text fails to show all content when resized larger (Text.setBounds bug)
issue.description:
Build Identifier: swt-3.5.1-win32-win32-x86
When typing at the right end of a single-line Text (implemented as Edit Control), Windows scrolls the text left to keep caret in view. If the Text is resized to show the full content, it remains scrolled with the start of the text invisible.
This problem is specifically identified in Text.setBounds. The author writes a fix that I believe is supposed to be triggered by testing whether the text width is greater than the control width. However, the control's width is actually compared to the control's margins alone (as in its trim), without adding in the text width. Therefore the fix is not done when it is needed and part of the text remains cut off.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: See attached demo TextResize.java.
A workaround for my particular application is after resizing, to detect that the caret is at the right edge, and then send the caret to the beginning and back to the end. This is demonstrated in the example. But it won't work in general since the shift may occur when the caret is not at the far right.
Solutions I have tried that did not work: 1) Turning off horizontal autoscroll. * int bits = OS.GetWindowLong (handle, OS.GWL_STYLE); * bits &= ~OS.ES_AUTOHSCROLL; * OS.SetWindowLong (handle, OS.GWL_STYLE, bits); The shifting of the caret into view must be unrelated to autoscroll.
2) Sending the message that * is supposed to scroll Edit Controls. Although as usual, MS documentation * is vague about whether this works with single-line controls. * In any case, it also does not work. * OS.SendMessage(handle, OS.EM_LINESCROLL, 2, 2);//-2,-2 also fails
3) Creating the Text with SWT.RIGHT. It does stop the scrolling, but introduces a severe flicker, with redraw errors. (sorry - another bug.)

issue.title: Validate that an Interface param's readonly attribute is inherited by Module implementers
issue.description:
When an Interface declares a config param to be 'readonly', that property should be inherited by Modules that implement that interface.
Then, a Module implementer need not explicitly restate this 'readonly' attribute if they override the default setting. As a result, if the Interface restrictions are lifted (e.g., the Interface removes the 'readonly' attribute making the field writeable), Module producers would not be required to rebuild against the new interface.
Some initial quick testing (with the Interface and Module in the same package) seem to indicate this is supported. So this enhancement is perhaps simply a request for a test to validate the use case is supported.

issue.title: Update to I20100122-0800 deletes eclipse
issue.description:
Wow, that's the funniest p2 bug I've seen so far:
I was running I20100112-something (updated via p2 from M3 I believe). I have the classic SDK plus a number of additional plugins. I tried updating to I20100122-0800, which caused some exceptions, and when I tried to restart Eclipse I found no eclipse any more.

After restarting silently failed, I looked into the eclipse directory and noticed that almost all files where missing, except: eclipse.ini artifacts.xml and the following directories still exist too: dropins p2 configuration plugins features That's all that's left. In particular: the eclipse executable has vanished. Game over - please insert coin.
I might add that in order to find a valid configuration for updating I had to uninstall XML editors from wst and m2eclipse plugins. After uninstalling I chose not to restart Eclipse right away, because I was going to restart after the update any way. Other than that everything was just the normal routine.

issue.title: Director app fails with an NPE
issue.description:
While doing some testing with the director app (20100122):
./eclipse -application org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director -metadataRepository http://download.eclipse.org/releases/galileo -artifactRepository http://download.eclipse.org/releases/galileo -installIU org.eclipse.sdk.ide -bundlepool /home/irbull/.pool/ -destination /home/irbull/bundlepooltest/a -profile Sample -p2.os linux -p2.ws gtk -p2.arch x86 -data /home/irbull/workspaces/directortest/ -vmargs -Declipse.p2.data.area=file://home/irbull/.pool/p2
