issue.title: Can not get Subversive working in I20100122-0800
issue.description:
After I got hit by "resolved" bug 300589, I manually installed the connector like in the old days (*sigh*) but to no avail. After restarting Eclipse I still get NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/equinox/internal/provisional/p2/metadata/query/Query -> connector discovery fails, SVN is dead unusable.
I have these connectors installed: Subversive SVN Connectors 2.2.1.I20091009-1900 Subversive SVN 1.6 SVN Kit Connector 2.2.1.I20091009-1900
Why is connector discovery still triggered when launching the workbench? Why is subversive still not functional? ("Info operation for 'myproject' failed. Selected SVN connector library is not available or cannot be loaded.")
The preferences dialog still doesn't know about any connectors.
-> Subversive in Eclipse I20100122-0800 IS BROKEN!
I usually don't set Severity blocker, but this one effectively blocks any productive work in Eclipse I20100122-0800.

issue.title: NPE in getNationalizedString if Localization is not installed
issue.description:
With Subversive from the weekly update site (20091207) I got this NPE: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.team.svn.core.operation.AbstractActionOperation.getNationalizedString(AbstractActionOperation.java:192) at org.eclipse.team.svn.core.operation.AbstractActionOperation.setOperationName(AbstractActionOperation.java:109) at org.eclipse.team.svn.core.operation.AbstractActionOperation.<init>(AbstractActionOperation.java:38) at org.eclipse.team.svn.ui.discovery.DiscoveryConnectorsOperation.<init>(DiscoveryConnectorsOperation.java:73) at org.eclipse.team.svn.ui.SVNTeamUIPlugin.start(SVNTeamUIPlugin.java:130)
Only after I installed "Subversive SVN Team Provider Localization (Optional)" the exception did not occur any more.
Is Localization optional or not??

issue.title: Suspicious cross package referencing
issue.description:
Class ProcessRepoTask imports and uses org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.jarprocessor.ant.JarProcessorTask. When I imported all p2 projects into a fresh workspace the compiler complained about the import and all uses of JarProcessorTask within ProcessRepoTask. After cleaning project ..p2.repository.tools the compile error disappeared.
I see three bugs: 1. The Java code is inconsistent with MANIFEST.MF, which should actually Import-Package the ..p2.jarprocessor.ant package 2. The compiler should not (after clean) accept that code. 3. Tests seem to be missing that would detect that JarProcessorTask isn't accessible at runtime (or is it accessible? why?)
The compiler part is related to a number of existing bugs: bug 148844, bug 278745 and some duplicates. However, those bugs essentially talk about Require-Bundle, whereas this issue involves only Import-Package. In bug 148844 comment 35 I raised the issue that the compiler is actually too eager to navigate along indirect dependencies.
In the Plug-in Dependencies view I see that ..p2.repository.tools "depends on ..p2.artifact.repository", which "depends on ..p2.jarprocessor", but these dependencies are not accurate, since they're not defined as dependencies between bundles but are Import-Package.

issue.title: [ui] prompt for unsigned content not occurring in M5
issue.description:
I20100122-0800, win7.
Help->Install New Software Paste this site into work with and press enter http://www.eclipse.org/equinox/p2/testing/updateSite
Choose Platform Examples -> Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.0.0
In M4, you'll get the prompt for unsigned content before the install. In M5, you will not.
Somethings amiss in the service registration? This is probably a UI-side issue, I'll investigate.

issue.title: [planner] M5 allows install of two versions of a feature while M4 says it's an error
issue.description:
I've noticed a change in the resolution behavior between M4 and M5 with respect to installing two versions of the same IU. Not sure if this represents an advancement (better handling of singlestons?) or a regression...
At any rate, the same metadata produces different behavior, and the behavior is not fully consistent within M5 wrt to both cases below.
CASE 1:
Help->Install New Software Paste this site into work with and press enter http://www.eclipse.org/equinox/p2/testing/updateSite Ensure that the [ ] Show only latest versions checkbox is unchecked
In the category Platform Examples select both of the following:
Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.0.0 Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.1.0
Choose Next
In M5 (I20100122-0800), both versions of the feature are installed.
In M4, the following resolution error is reported:
Cannot complete the install because of a conflicting dependency. Software being installed: Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.0.0 (Field_Assist_Example.feature.group 1.0.0) Software being installed: Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.0.1 (Field_Assist_Example.feature.group 1.0.1) Only one of the following can be installed at once: Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.0.1 (Field_Assist_Example.feature.jar 1.0.1) Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.0.0 (Field_Assist_Example.feature.jar 1.0.0) Cannot satisfy dependency: From: Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.0.0 (Field_Assist_Example.feature.group 1.0.0) To: Field_Assist_Example.feature.jar [1.0.0] Cannot satisfy dependency: From: Field_Assist_Example Feature 1.0.1 (Field_Assist_Example.feature.group 1.0.1) To: Field_Assist_Example.feature.jar [1.0.1]
CASE 2
Help->Install New Software Paste this site into work with and press enter http://www.eclipse.org/swt/updates/3.6 Ensure that the [ ] Show only latest versions checkbox is unchecked Ensure that [ ] Group by category is unchecked
Select both of the following:
SWT Tools 1.0.1.201001221200 SWT Tools 1.0.1.201001221134
Choose Next
In M5 (I20100122-0800), the conflict is reported. (Why is it caught for SWT and not for FieldAssist?)
Cannot complete the install because of a conflicting dependency. Software being installed: SWT Tools 1.0.1.201001221134 (org.eclipse.swt.tools.feature.feature.group 1.0.1.201001221134) Software being installed: SWT Tools 1.0.1.201001221200 (org.eclipse.swt.tools.feature.feature.group 1.0.1.201001221200) Only one of the following can be installed at once: org.eclipse.swt.tools 3.6.0.200910141657 SWT Tools 3.6.0.201001221200 (org.eclipse.swt.tools 3.6.0.201001221200) SWT Tools 3.6.0.201001221134 (org.eclipse.swt.tools 3.6.0.201001221134) Cannot satisfy dependency: From: SWT Tools 1.0.1.201001221134 (org.eclipse.swt.tools.feature.feature.group 1.0.1.201001221134) To: org.eclipse.swt.tools [3.6.0.201001221134] Cannot satisfy dependency: From: SWT Tools 1.0.1.201001221200 (org.eclipse.swt.tools.feature.feature.group 1.0.1.201001221200) To: org.eclipse.swt.tools [3.6.0.201001221200]

issue.title: NPE in p2 directory -list command
issue.description:
Using M4, this works. Using latest SDK for M5 causes NPE.
Works as expected:
java -jar D:\buildzips\36M4\eclipse\plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_*.jar ^ -application org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director ^ -repository file:\\\D:\standaloneTest\org.eclipse.releng.tools-I20100121-0800 ^ -list
I'm listing as major, since I assume this would be considered "missing funtion". (I've not used it before ... just trying to dig into other bugs, such as bug 300417). Note, I actually saw this first with other repos,and am using "releng tools" in this example just so easier for you to reproduce. I just unzip the archived repo that's provided with the platfrom build.
I've attached log for failing case.

attachments.attach: said log, first one didn't seem to attach.

Denis, comments?

issue.title: add 'palign(4)' to MSP430 .pinit section def in .xdl file (workaround 3.2.2 codegen bug)
issue.description:
CCSv4.1 ships with MSP430 3.2.2.
3.2.2 introduced a bug related to .pinit that was not present in 3.2.1 (SDSCM00034776).
This workaround is only needed for large code and data models on MSP430.
Suggested workaround for this (from bug report above) is:
A workaround would be to ensure that the .pinit section is padded to a 4 byte boundary and that the padding values are zeros. This can be done by adding a 'palign(4)' specification to the linker command file. On the line that specifies the allocation for the .pinit section add the palign command as described in the linker chapter in the Assembler's User Guide. The linker will pad the section with zeros to a 4 byte boundary assuming that the fill value has not been changed from zero (the default fill value).

issue.title: Error 500 when trying to open jgit or egit job in Hudson
issue.description:
Both https://build.eclipse.org/hudson/job/jgit/ and https://build.eclipse.org/hudson/job/egit/ return Error 500. I tried to configure unit tests for egit which need a display hence I enabled the xvnc plugin. I started the JGit job which after successful build triggered the egit build. When I try to lookup https://build.eclipse.org/hudson/job/egit/ I face the following exception:
org.apache.commons.jelly.JellyTagException: jar:file:/opt/users/hudsonbuild/.hudson/war/WEB-INF/lib/hudson-core-1.337.jar!/hudson/widgets/HistoryWidget/index.jelly:28:81: method forName threw exception: hudson.model.Job at org.apache.commons.jelly.tags.core.InvokeStaticTag.doTag(InvokeStaticTag.java:148) at org.apache.commons.jelly.impl.TagScript.run(TagScript.java:262) at issue.title: [content type] XML Schema Editor not used for schemas without XML declaration
issue.description:
Using the standard Galileo Java EE package, the XML Schema editor isn't available for schema files not carrying the an XML declaration at the beginning, such as <?xml version="1.0" ?>
This is caused by an interference between content types org.eclipse.wst.xsd.core.xsdsource and 2) org.eclipse.xsd
When the XML declaration IS present on a valid schema, the content type mechanism finds that both types are deemed VALID by their describers. But when the XML declaration is not found, XMLContentDescriber (the describer used by org.eclipse.core.runtime.xml, which org.eclipse.wst.xsd.core.xsdsource is based on) will return INDETERMINATE. This will rank below the matcher for org.eclipse.xsd, which will return VALID for any XML file with the appropriate 'schema' root element (since it uses the practical XMLRootElementContentDescriber2 available since Eclipse 3.3)
To reproduce: Create an XML Schema using the Wizard, save it, close, right click on the file, choose the "Open With" menu, check that "XML Schema Editor" is present. Now open the file, edit the XML, remove the XML declaration so the file starts with the root element (still valid XML!), close and right click again. Now the "Open With" menu doesn't show "XML Schema Editor", just "Text Editor" and "XML Editor". Also the icon switches to the "X" instead of the "S".
Possible fixes:
A) Adding the <contentTypeBinding contentTypeId="org.eclipse.xsd" /> to the XSD editor: It works, however I get the feeling that there's a reason for not doing so (e.g. the hyperlink detector and validation would not work, that could be extended to work as well, I suppose)
B) Switching to using org.eclipse.xsd exclusively?
C) Add an even more loose describer for org.eclipse.wst.xsd.core.xsdsource which will describe anything with extension XSD or having any root element called "schema" as an XML schema, in effect wiping out the org.eclipse.xsd content type.
Option "A" would be my favourite, perhaps even with lowering the priority for org.eclipse.wst.xsd.core.xsdsource using it as a fall-back just like org.eclipse.wst.xml.core.xmlsource is used when the XML is "mostly" well-formed.
This is actually a pretty annoying bug -- it feels like a regression, but it's probably a by-product of org.eclipse.xsd changing its describer. Any chance for 3.1.2

issue.title: [Validation] Problem markers aren't updated for dependent but not-edited files
issue.description:
In my DSL I have to deal with c-style #includes.
Lets say I have file A including file B and B including A (aka cyclic dependencies).
My validator correctly creates a error annotation (left to the editor) on both files. On saving problem markers in the list are only created for the saved file.
If file A and B both have problem markers and the cyclic dependencies gets resolved both annotations get removed, but only the problem marker of the current saved file is removed.

The Xtend editor creates an error marker when a non static Java extension method is called, but this features is now enabled by the fix of #261603. So this check have to be removed now.

Using the org.eclipse.xpand2.output.XmlBeautifier as post processor has no effect. I noted, that the tests in XmlBeautifierTest all passes. Using the same programmatical way to run the beautifier with my XML file has the same effect as when executed in an oAW workflow (= no effect). Changing the encoding has also no effect. The org.eclipse.xtend.typesystem.xsd.XMLBeautifier out of the XSD typesystem project is able to format the XML.
Reproducible: Always

I20100119-0800
Enable details pane in Breakpoints view, select a Java breakpoint, Show Details As > Breakpoint Settings. On Cocoa, the text field for Hit Count is only a few pixels wide (less than a character). Looks OK on WinXP.

issue.title: Show all breakpoint properties in a single detail pane
issue.description:
I20100119-0800
It would be much more useful if all breakpoint settings from the "Breakpoint Properties" properties dialog page would be in the same details pane inside the Breakpoints view.
After trying to use the details pane a few times now, I've reverted to opening the dialog, since I had to switch the details pane too often (either because I needed the other pane, or because I needed to set a condition and a hit count).

issue.title: [XML Catalog] [patch] External DTD subsets / schemas are attempted loaded for catalogs
issue.description:
Created attachment 157062 [details] Patch which disables validation and instructs parser not to load any external DTD subset
If a user provides a Next Catalog (or Delegate Catalog) which has a DTD reference to an external subset, or a schema location, the current XML Catalog implementation will cause this to be loaded, and fail if it cannot be resolved for whatever reason. This is completely unnecessary. The attached patch will fix this, increasing the likelihood that the catalog will work in e.g. disconnected scenarios.
Hope this patch can make it to 3.2 M5 and 3.1.2.

attachments.attach: Patch which disables validation and instructs parser not to load any external DTD subset

issue.title: Command+. does not work any more in Trees
issue.description:
Broken in I20100119-0800 and 3.5 Cocoa, works in 3.4.2 Carbon.
Command+. does not work any more in Trees. I just get an OS beep, and the KeyDown event for Command+. is missing.
In Eclipse, this is e.g. visible in the Search view, where Command+. should step to the next match. The reverse (Command+Shift+.) still works.
In the Java Editor, Command+. still works (jumps to next annotation).

issue.title: [Hibernate] CDO_Package_Unit type has a field which is too long for Derby
issue.description:
The HibernatePackageUnitDTO has a ePackageBlob field which is a byte[]. For most databases this is correctly mapped to a blob. For derby this is mapped to a varchar. In Derby varchars have a max length of 32kb. In the mapping currently the length is set at 40000.
To let the hibernate store work with derby the max size has to be set to 32700 in the meta.hbm.xml.
See also here: http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/browse/HHH-2651
Some other aspects: - in mysql the field is mapped to a blob, is the size limit ever enforced by hibernate then?
An even better solution probably is to change the mapping to a blob and use the hibernate blob type.
gr. Martin Consider changing the type to a sql.Blob

issue.title: avoid junit4 bundle
issue.description:
Here I am complaining, after you did all that hard work getting your tests working again!
I notice you now prereq org.junit4;version=4.5, but "org.junit4" is deprecated, and all it does is pre-req reexport the org.junit;version 4.x bundle.
So, you should pre-req org.unit;version 4.5 directly ... right? Did you have trouble with that? Solving some other problem I'm not aware of?

issue.title: Speed improvement of directory listing
issue.description:
Build Identifier: CVS HEAD
This enhancement improves the speed of the directory listing using the RemoteTools connection. Before this patch the directory listing was slow because a sftp-stat was performed for each file when listing a directory. It is possible to get the same information for all files in the directory with a single stat call. This call is actually already done previously to get the file names of all files and we simply reuse this information in our patch. This patch removes redundant communication which increases performance especially for directory listings that are containing many files.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Connect with Remotetools 2. Open a directory

issue.title: Unnecessary Table Join in Native Query generated from JPQL
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 2.0.0.v20091127-r5931
version: Eclipse Persistence Services - 2.0.0.v20091127-r5931
A rather simple JPQL query produces an unnecessary table join. Please refer to the attached testcase (NetBeans project).
The generated native SQL is:
SELECT t0.ID , t0.PROVIDERID FROM TRIP t0 WHERE t0.PROVIDERID NOT IN ( SELECT t1.PROVIDERID FROM TRIP t2 , TRIPEXCLUDE t1 WHERE ( ( ( (t1.PROVIDERID = t2.PROVIDERID) AND (t1.SEARCHERID = ?) ) AND (t1.SERVICEID = ?) ) AND (t0.ID = t2.ID) ) )
The SQL should be as follows (not including table t2):
SELECT t0.ID , t0.PROVIDERID FROM TRIP t0 WHERE t0.PROVIDERID NOT IN ( SELECT t1.PROVIDERID FROM TRIPEXCLUDE t1 WHERE ( ( ( (t1.SEARCHERID = ?) ) AND (t1.SERVICEID = ?) ) ) )
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: Please refer to attached testcase

issue.title: Missing include path files and folders from included libraries in PHP Explorer View
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20090611-1540
When I include a user library into a PHP project, the entry appears under the PHP Include Path tree in the PHP Explorer View, however, not all files and folders are visible in the tree.
For example, I've created a user library for Zend Framework 1.9. When I include this, for some reason the entire Zend/Db tree (amongst others) is not visible. I can Ctrl+Click through to classes, just not browse to them.
This appears to happen at random however the missing files / folders are the same each time.
I've tried removing and re-adding the include path entries and user libraries but the results are always the same.
Screenshots: PHP Explorer View - http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1939593/php-explorer-include-path.png Windows Explorer (filesystem) - http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1939593/zend-framework-lib-fs.png
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Add a PHP user library 2. Add user library to project include path 3. Browse PHP Include Path tree in PHP Explorer view

issue.title: Extension Point schemas/declarations that use the same name for the point id as the schema file are reported as errors
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20091210-1301 (3.6M4)
Extension Point declarations which use the same name for the Point ID as for their file name do not have the schema correctly loaded when trying to load/view the schema from a referencing extension declaration.
Basically, if the filename is the same as the Point ID, it doesn't work. This is *new* behavior since 3.6M4.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create an extension point schema called "schema/foo.exsd" 2. Set the extension point id in the schema to "foo" 3. Create an extension point entry in the same bundle's plugin.xml, and reference the id of "foo", and location of "schema/foo.exsd" 4. Create an extension based on this extension point. 5. Click on the "Show extension point description" link. Note the error.
Now, change the id to "fubar" in all places, *except* that of the schema file name. The error no longer occurs.

issue.title: StyledText ignores StyleRange.metrics.width on OS X
issue.description:
Build Identifier: swt-3.5.2RC1-cocoa-macosx-x86_64
StyleRange.metrics is used with StyledText to embed Controls and Images (see Snippet217). On OS X, it seems to ignore the width specified in the GlyphMetrics data placed in metrics. The space reserved by the StyleRange has width zero. Therefore Controls and Images cannot be embedded.
Fails on OS X; works properly on Windows.
Tested with OS 10.6.2 and Windows XP.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run Snippet217 on OS X.
2. See that the embedded widgets are rendered on top on the surrounding text.
3. To further confirm, tell the StyleRange to show its border: style.borderColor = display.getSystemColor(SWT.COLOR_RED); style.borderStyle = SWT.BORDER_SOLID;
See that the StyleRange has the correct height, but zero width. Instead the width should be StyleRange.metrics.width.

issue.title: Docking views vertically causes redraw problems
issue.description:
I have been noticing this since the 3.5 release and even in the 3.5.1 release on windows 7.
Many times if I dock a view vertically to either the left or right side, it never draws itself fully and I have black or white patch in the middle of the view. Even minimizing eclipse doesnt work. Sometimes even closing and reopening the view doesnt work either. I have restart eclipse to make it work.
Most prevalent in the package explorer view since that is the one always open for me but i have seem it happening with other views too.

issue.title: DataModelWizard unnecessarily wrapping some exceptions
issue.description:
DataModelWizard.performFinish() gets an IStatus object from the operations. If the result is an ERROR status type, the wizard randomly wraps this exception in a CoreException.
This means that when the error dialog opens, the *actual* exception is second on the list, while the top exception includes almost no information at all:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Extended Operation failure: your.package.followed.by.your.OperationClass at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.ui.DataModelWizard.performFinish(DataModelWizard.java:189) at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.finishPressed(WizardDialog.java:752) at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.buttonPressed(WizardDialog.java:373) at org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog$2.widgetSelected(Dialog.java:624) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:228) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:84) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:1003) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:3880) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:3473) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:825) at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:801) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.handlers.WizardHandler$Export.executeHandler

issue.title: [Hibernate] Ensure/check that hibernate logging can be enabled in CDO Server
issue.description:
Sometimes it is important for users to be able to see hibernate log statements in detail (for example which sql has been generated). I tried adding log4j.properties to a plugin and making this visible but this did not seem to work (hibernate log4j did not seem to pick it up).
This topic has to be researched further to see what the solution is.
gr. Martin

issue.title: [Hibernate] Ensure that the Teneo extension mechanism works in combination with CDO
issue.description:
Teneo has an extensions mechanism which allows developers to extend/override core components used in the mapping: http://wiki.eclipse.org/Teneo/Hibernate/Extensions
It needs to be tested that this extension mechanism works for the CDO Hibernate Store and the examples project and the wiki need to be updated.
gr. Martin

issue.title: Javax persistence _sometimes_ fails to find suitable drivers with same setup.
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
This is a bug based on this discussion and own experience: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/eclipselink-users/msg02475.html
Using bundle A which is a JPA-PersistenceUnit provider and Bundle B which is trying to use this, javax.persistence will sometimes (more often than not in my experience) fail to find driver. Saying: Internal Exception: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc:postgresql://129.241.219.236/ractest.
Bundle A "correctly" (since this should be handles with JDBC's as services) imports the org.postgresql package.
Entire relevant stack trace:
javax.persistence.PersistenceException: Exception [EclipseLink-4002] (Eclipse Persistence Services - 2.1.0.v20091216-r6086 ): org.eclipse.persistence.exceptions.DatabaseException Internal Exception: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc:postgresql://129.241.219.236/ractest Error Code: 0 at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerSetupImpl.deploy(EntityManagerSetupImpl.java:392) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerFactoryImpl.getServerSession(EntityManagerFactoryImpl.java:15 1) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerFactoryImpl.createEntityManagerImpl(EntityManagerFactoryImpl. java:207) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerFactoryImpl.createEntityManager(EntityManagerFactoryImpl.java:195) at no.telenorobjects.accesscontrol.rac.db.DatabaseAdministrator.openConnection(DatabaseAdministrator.java:50) at no.telenorobjects.accesscontrol.rac.impl.RACProducer.start(RACProducer.java:79) at no.telenorobjects.accesscontrol.rac.impl.RACEndpoint.createProducer(RACEndpoint.java:48) at org.coos.messaging.impl.DefaultEndpoint.postStart(DefaultEndpoint.java:836) at org.coos.messaging.impl.DefaultEndpoint$7.run(DefaultEndpoint.java:803) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619) Caused by: Exception [EclipseLink-4002] (Eclipse Persistence Services - 2.1.0.v20091216-r6086): org.eclipse.persistence.ex ceptions.DatabaseException Internal Exception: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc:postgresql://129.241.219.236/ractest Error Code: 0 at org.eclipse.persistence.exceptions.DatabaseException.sqlException(DatabaseException.java:324) at org.eclipse.persistence.exceptions.DatabaseException.sqlException(DatabaseException.java:319) at org.eclipse.persistence.sessions.DefaultConnector.connect(DefaultConnector.java:138) at org.eclipse.persistence.sessions.DatasourceLogin.connectToDatasource(DatasourceLogin.java:162) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.sessions.DatabaseSessionImpl.loginAndDetectDatasource(DatabaseSessionImpl.java:584) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerFactoryProvider.login(EntityManagerFactoryProvider.java:228) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerSetupImpl.deploy(EntityManagerSetupImpl.java:368) ... 11 moreCaused by: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc:postgresql://129.241.219.236/ractest at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(DriverManager.java:602) at java.sql.DriverManager.getConnection(DriverManager.java:154) at org.eclipse.persistence.sessions.DefaultConnector.connect(DefaultConnector.java:98) ... 15 more
Reproducible: Sometimes
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a bundle with is a JPA-PersistenceUnit provider and defines and imports a jdbc driver 2. use said bundle in another bundle with emf = Persistence.createEntityManagerFactory(name, overrides); em = emf.createEntityManager(); 3. Do this enough times and it will "hopefully" throw the following: Internal Exception: java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver found for jdbc:postgresql://129.241.219.236/ractest Error Code: 0 at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerSetupImpl.deploy(EntityManagerSetupImpl.java:392) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerFactoryImpl.getServerSession(EntityManagerFactoryImpl.java:151) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerFactoryImpl.createEntityManagerImpl(EntityManagerFactoryImpl.java:207) at org.eclipse.persistence.internal.jpa.EntityManagerFactoryImpl.createEntityManager(EntityManagerFactoryImpl.java:195)

issue.title: Add ability to install non-Windows JavaHL in Connectors Discovery
issue.description: Currently Connectors Discovery allows to install only Win32 JavaHL connector and there's no ability to install only platform independent feature of JavaHL connector. We need to provide option to do it, where in case of Windows we'll allow to install full JavaHL (platform independent part + binaries), in case of other OSs we'll allow to install only platform independent feature (without binaries).

issue.title: [implementation] Java Editor scrolls around when I expand selection
issue.description:
I20100124-2000
Java Editor sometimes scrolls around when I expand selection.
Steps: - From JDK 6, open java.lang.String - On the last line of #toLowerCase(Locale), put caret into "String" - Alt+Shift+Up => no matter where in the visible viewport I was, the editor scrolls around and places the line that contains the selection to about 1/3 of the viewport from the top
This is annoying and did not happen in 3.6M4. Reverting bug 298106 solves the problem. I'd revert that bug for M5.

issue.title: [Sync View][Apply Patch] Direction indicator vanishes after merge
issue.description: Switch to "Patch Contents" model and locate a file which has both matched and unmatched hunks. Do "Merge" on that file. Matched hunks are merged and are no longer shown in the view (see bug 300213), but at the same time the direction indicator for the file (blue arrow pointing left) disappears. I believe, the later should not happen.

issue.title: Deadlock when a debuggee process is slow to terminate
issue.description:
Created attachment 157097 [details] Thread dump of deadlocked Eclipse
Build ID: Eclipse 3.6m4
Consider attached Thread dump from my deadlocked Eclipse. Here is what I did:
* Launch Eclipse app as debuggee * File > Exit the debuggee --> My debuggee is terminated, but a child process is still running (I will attach a screenshot to show what this looks like) * Switch from debug perspective to JDT perspecitve --> Indexer started to run * Switch back to debug perspective, right-click on the process to fully terminate it --> Main Thread is blocked
As per attached Thread dump, the "Process monitor" Thread has locked my instance of RuntimeProcess (0x086bf8e0) but does a Thread.join(). It looks like the Thread.join() cannot return because the Thread to be joined depends on other work which cannot finish. It is suspicious that a couple other Threads are waiting to enter my RuntimeProcess monitor: - Worker-14 - Worker-5 - main
Without knowing the exact code, it looks like RuntimeProcess.terminated() is "synchronized" but should not be synchronized because it does a Thread.join() which may be long-running and may depend on other client code. The rule of thumb is to never call out to client code from within a "synchronized" block -- it must be guaranteed that any synchronized block can complete without waiting for external things to happen.

attachments.attach: Screenshot of app with debug view on deadlocked Eclipse

issue.title: [Hibernate] Handle unknown edatatypes as a string
issue.description:
When the CDO Hibernate store encounters an unknown type it uses the Teneo DefaultToStringUserType. This is incorrect (that class is not present in CDO Hibernate Store).
CDO serializes and de-serializes all unknown edatatypes as a string so Teneo should just map the types as a string and not use a custom user type.
Here is the stacktrace one gets when using an unknown type currently:
>>> >>> Line 2728: >>> >>> <property name="value" lazy="false" insert="true" update="true" >>> not-null="false" unique="false"> >>> >>> <column not-null="false" unique="false" name="`value`" >>> length="1024"/> >>> >>> <type >>> name="org.eclipse.emf.teneo.hibernate.mapping.DefaultToStringUserType"> >>> >>> <param name="edatatype">EJavaObject</param> >>> >>> <param >>> name="epackage">http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore</param> >>> >>> </type> >>> >>> </property> >>> >>> >>> >>> Exception: >>> >>> Could not determine type for: >>> >>> org.eclipse.emf.teneo.hibernate.mapping.DefaultToStringUserType, at >>> >>> table: steptelegramcontent, for columns: >>> >>> [org.hibernate.mapping.Column(value)] >>> >>> org.hibernate.MappingException: Could not determine type for: >>> >>> org.eclipse.emf.teneo.hibernate.mapping.DefaultToStringUserType, at >>> >>> table: steptelegramcontent, for columns: >>> >>> [org.hibernate.mapping.Column(value)]

issue.title: Enable rules that controls ranges for feature inclusions
issue.description:
An installable unit that is generated from a feature will always contain requirements with a strict version for all features and bundles that the feature depends on as 'includes'. The only way to specify a range is to instead list the dependency as a 'requires'.
In the old update manager, there was a semantic difference between these two. The things that were listed as 'required' was not installed together with the feature. Instead, they were treated as a prerequisite (had to be installed already) for the feature installation. With p2, I don't believe this distinction is there anymore.
Buckminster however, will currently not include the dependencies listed under 'requires' since they are considered a runtime installation thing. In 3.6, we might change this, but in 3.5 we cannot. Instead, we need to add some way to create more relaxed version ranges for the 'includes' entries. This can be done by two properties that can be added to the 'build.properties' file of the feature:
pde.match.rule.default = perfect | equivalent | compatible | greaterOrEqual (standard match rules) pde.match.rule.retain.lower = true | false
*perfect* Perfect match, i.e. like today. Use the version verbatim.
1.2.3.foo becomes [1.2.3.foo,1.2.3.foo]
*equivalent* Greater or equal to the version using a version with the same major number and the next minor number as a non inclusive upper bound:
1.2.3.foo becomes [1.2.3.foo,1.3.0)
OR if pde.match.rule.retain.lower is false:
1.2.3.foo becomes [1.2.0,1.3.0)
*compatible* Greater or equal to the version using a version with the next major number as a non inclusive upper bound.
1.2.3.foo becomes [1.2.3.foo,2.0.0)
OR if pde.match.rule.retain.lower is false:
1.2.3.foo becomes [1.0.0,2.0.0)
*greaterOrEqual* Greater or equal to the version using a version with the next major number as a non inclusive upper bound.
1.2.3.foo becomes the range 1.2.3.foo (i.e. open ended)

issue.title: TPTP Model regression breaks consuming product's use of Trace model
issue.description:
The root cause of this issue is a TPTP regression introduced by https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=263122 However, it's more complicated than that. The regression is in EMF generated code. The association "method" between TRCMethodInvocation and TRCMethod was marked as transient in the ecore model, and was thus generated as a transient association in the Java code. As such, when the recmodel was persisted, the association was not written to the file.
Interestingly, the genmodel and the ecore files, both of which were checked in at the same time as part of 263122 differ on this point. The genmodel says the association is not transient, while the ecore says it is. Both of these files are generated from the same source -- the Rose models (and the trace cat file which contains this data has not been modified since 2005.)
In order to verify that this was the source of the problem, I set a breakpoint in the debugger during EMF package init and changed the association to non-transient. Testgen then worked fine.
Later today, I tried to regenerate the models from the Rose models using the version of EMF that is in RPT right now (EMF 2.6 M4). Interestingly, in the newly generated ecore and java files, the association is again non-transient as it was before 263122. Diffing this new ecore model with the one from TPTP 4.6 (HEAD), there are a total of 4 associations with became transient as part of the 263122 checkin, and all 4 of them are regenerated as once again non-transient with the latest EMF drop. Also interestingly, if you try to open the genmodel file in the built in editor, you get 4 problems listed, each of which says "The opposite of a transient reference must be transient if it is proxy resolving".
Here is my theory: we have a problem in our Rose models dating back to the beginning of the trace model. We ignored the warnings for this problem, and things always just worked. When Paul regenerated the models as part of 263122, he used a build of EMF that had a genmodel defect that caused these associations to become transient because of the problem in our source model. It's possible that the EMF change was meant to be a fix itself, but someone complained about the behavior change and they corrected it. Thus regenning the models now with the EMF 2.6 M4 driver corrects the issue.
There are several other differences in the newly generated ecore model, at least some of which appear to involve model objects that are not there. I think Paul will need to review the newly generated ecore in comparison to the current one and determine if everything else is okay.
I understand that 4.6.2 is essentially shut down. If so, we'll need to look into getting a 4.7 driver into our 8.2/3.6 adoption stream soon so we can fix this and test with recorders other than http.

issue.title: Simplify New Java Class Creation Wizard
issue.description:
With the creation of a viable NewJavaClassConstructor, we should be able to significantly simplify the New Java Class Creation Wizard. I believe that our requirements are relatively simple: we need fields to capture the name of the new class.
If a Java Project is highlighted when the wizard opens, that project becomes the home of the new class. If a package or class is currently selected, that package or the containing package becomes the home of the new class. If no Java Project is currently selected, but there is a single Java Project in the workspace, that Java Project becomes the home. If there is more than one Java Project, the one named "My Java Project" is used. If no project exists with that name, a drop down is added to the wizard to let the user select the project they want to use. If the workspace has no Java Projects, a new project with the name "My Java Project" is created.
For this first-cut implementation, the created class should contain, at a minimum, a main(String[]) method.
At some point in the future (and this is probably the subject of a different bug), I foresee this wizard being more dynamic and presenting additional options to a more experienced user. In a workspace that already contains several classes, we might include fields to specify the target package. In a workspace that already contains several projects, we might include a page in the wizard that lets the user create a new project with a name of their selection, for example. We might also include such things as automagic creation of unit tests, and other options.

issue.title: Failed to install Subversive in Galileo SR2 RC1
issue.description:
I checked Subversive with Galileo SR2 RC1. I tried to install it from http://download.eclipse.org/releases/maintenance/ update site and got error below. I also tried to install Subversive from http://download.eclipse.org/technology/subversive/0.7/update-site/, the site where Galileo build for Subversive is configured to , and Subversive was successfully installed.

issue.title: Patch contribution: Changes in Tooling SystemTests
Improve information about available queries
issue.description:
I have had a request from a user who wanted to understand what all those options (queries) are, including those sub menu items.
There are several aspects to this.
The query browser doesn't list all the queries, and the UI isn't ideal - there's no way to select with a mouse without invoking the query, it's hard to select all of one category etc..
The query browser isn't available from context menu.
Some queries don't have help.
The HTML help doesn't have a queries reference.

issue.title: [misc] Open Attached JSDoc is not compatible with JSDoc-toolkit
issue.description:
Created attachment 157119 [details] test project
JSDoc-toolkit creates different folders structure that JSDoc (http://jsdoc.sourceforge.net/). It has folder symbols where are stored html files with generated JSDocs. Unfortunately, when we try to open attached JSDoc wrong patch is built. For example, in attached test project and test JSDoc: 1. Import attached test project. 2. Extract testJSDoc. 4. Set JSDoc location for folder with extracted JSDoc. 5. Set focus on Shape() in source editor. 6. Choose Nagivate->Open Attached JSDoc - it try to open ../aaa//Shape.html which doesn't exist. It should be ../aaa/symbols/Shape.html.

issue.title: [search] We should be able to use exclusion patterns on library entries in the .jsdtscope file
issue.description:
In some cases it is necessary to exclude certain files included in libraries.
An example is a built version of Dojo containing layer files that duplicate the declaration of functions and classes.

issue.title: Folder TextField in DirectoryDialog is not getting refreshed after renaming the directory
issue.description:
Build Identifier: Build id: 20090920-1017
The DirectorDialog (org.eclipse.swt.widgets.DirectorDialog) has a "Folder Text Field" followed by Folder Label. When user choose any directory from the tree viewer, the that folder names appears in the foldet Text Field. The DirectorDialog (org.eclipse.swt.widgets.DirectorDialog) has a "Folder Text Field" followed by Folder Label. When user choose any directory from the tree viewer, then choosen directory name appears in the foldet Text Field.
Bugs:
1)Refresh Problem When user selects a folder then the folder name appears in the text field. But if user renames it from the rename popup option then this text field is not refreshed with new value.
2) Behaviour Problem Since this field is editable then its behaviour should be like renaming. i.e. If user edit the folder name in this text field and press enter then treeviewer should get refreshed with new name. and focus should in text field.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.In Eclipse, Choose File->Switch WorkSpace-> Other 2.A Directory Dialog will appear asking the user to choose directory 3.Create a new directory with "Make New Folder" 4.Folder Text Field gets filled with default name like "New Folder" 5.Rename the folder name 6.After renaming, treeviewer gets refreshed with new name but Folder Text Field is still showing the previos value"New Folder"

attachments.attach: Folder Text is not getting refreshed.

issue.title: SWTException: Widget is disposed in JEE5ContentProvider
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
Caused by: org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3884) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3799) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3770) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:463) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:336) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree.setRedraw(Tree.java:4715) at org.eclipse.jst.jee.ui.internal.navigator.JEE5ContentProvider$1.run(JEE5ContentProvider.java:166) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35) at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:134) ... 40 more
The implementation of the method org.eclipse.jst.jee.ui.internal.navigator.JEE5ContentProvider.projectChanged(IProject) looks questionable to me:
1) Why should a content provider trigger the viewer refresh? Is here the right place for this logic?
2) If you do the refresh asynchronously (line 171): Display.getDefault().asyncExec(refreshThread) you should always verify whether the controls are still valid to prevent such SWTException ("Widget is disposed")
Reproducible: Sometimes

issue.title: Ensure compiler compliance level is set correctly in newly created Java projects
issue.description:
My test workspace is running on a J2SE-1.5 JVM, but is set at a Java-6.0 compliance level. I have a project that was created using a J2SE-1.5 library. When I try to run a class from that project, I get a java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError (essentially, the Java 1.5 VM is failing to run code compiled with a Java 6 syntax). I believe that this may just be as a result of my test workspace being a little abused over the past few months (the problem goes away when I create a new workspace).
Regardless of the cause, I believe that we will better serve our users if we guard against this case.
The NewJavaProjectConstructor should explicitly set the compiler conformance level (at the project level) when it creates a project.

issue.title: Performance Improve - Load from InputStream/Reader
issue.description: In general StAX parsing is faster than SAX parsing. We should leverage StAX parsing when possible with inputs such as InputStream and Reader.

issue.title: Authorization while getting CQuery or RMap
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 3.5
A CQuery or a RMap (also reverenced RMap's) can not be accessed through a WebServer with authorization (LDAP used in my case).
The problem seems to be the ConnectContext given to ECF. In my case it was 'null' every time.
There has to be a possibility to access CQuery's or RMap's from a Server with User-Authorization.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: ==== Open CQuery ==== 1. File -> Open a Component Query... 2. enter a url to a CQuery from a Server with User-Authorization. ==== Connect to RMap ==== 1. create CQuery 2. fill the attribute 'resourceMap' with an URL to a RMap from a Server with User-Authorization. ==== Redirect to RMap ==== 1. create a RMap and define a redirect to a RMap located at a Server with User-Authorization. 2. create a CQuery that references the previous created RMap -> Press 'Resolve and Materialize'

issue.title: [ds] FileStorage is not thread safe

issue.title: Setting enablement for Mark as Merged and Overwrite actions in ModelCompareEditorInput is copy-pasted
CDOENumStringType.nullSafeGet require identical name and literal for EEnum
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20091210-1301
In my application I define several EEnums in the ecore file. On initiating the model I get following exception:
[QUOTE] The enum value string is not valid for enumerator: DataType java.lang.IllegalStateException: The enum value string is not valid for enumerator: DataType at org.eclipse.emf.cdo.server.internal.hibernate.tuplizer.CDOENumStringType.nullSafeGet(CDOENumStringType.java:150) [UNQUOTE]
As it seems the value 'string' is not recognized in the enum 'DataType' which I declare in the ecore as follows: <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EEnum" name="DataType"> <eLiterals name="boolean" literal="Boolean"/> <eLiterals name="integer" value="1" literal="Integer"/> <eLiterals name="float" value="2" literal="Float"/> <eLiterals name="string" value="3" literal="String"/> <eLiterals name="complex" value="4" literal="Complex"/> </eClassifiers>
If I debug I find that the method CDOENumStringType.nullSafeGet on line 147 is calling getEEnumLiteralByLiteral passing the enum name as parameter.
System outs from the method shows following: name: 'string' // The name variable getEEnum().getEEnumLiteralByLiteral(name.trim()): 'null' // That's why an exception is thrown getEEnum().getEEnumLiteral(name.trim()): 'String' // The literal returned giving the name as parameter
If I modify the ecore declaration so that name and literal are identical and regenerate the model the code works well.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Invalid tests: sharing embedded objects is not allowed
issue.description:
Both AggregatePrimaryKeyTest and AggregatePrimaryKeyOrderByTest in ComplexAggregateTestModel in jpa tests share the same embeddedId between several Entities. This is not allowed by the spec., in 2.5: Embedded objects belong strictly to their owning entity, and are not sharable across persistent entities.
One might think that because those embedded objects are ids sharing them between two different Entities (of two different classes) is ok because the embeddableIds are supposed to never change. However that's not the case if the embeddableId uses Identity - in that case the value generated during Insert is read back into object - that means the pks will be different and EmbeddedId can't be shared.
This bug surficed after bug 300556 was fixed - it make Identity always override the existing pk value. Before this fix the tests got the id value in the shared embeddedId that corresponded to the first object that used it; and tghis value was out of sync with the value inserted into db for the second object.

issue.title: Add keyboard mnemonics to Java EE Import/Export wizards
issue.description:
The Java EE Import and Export wizards need improvement in keyboard accessibility. This enhancement will: 1) check if there is at least one successful path by using only the keyboard 2) add keyboard mnemonics 3) fix label capitalization
The wizards in scope are: 1) Export > EJB JAR file 2) Export > App Client JAR file 3) Export > EAR file 4) Export > RAR file 5) Export > WAR file 6) Import > EJB Jar file 7) Import > App Client JAR file 8) Import > EAR file 9) Import > Java EE Utility Jar 10) Import > RAR file 11) Import > WAR file

issue.title: [metadata] support mutually exclusive connectors
issue.description:
Currently in Connectors Discovery we can select connectors which we want to install by using check boxes, but there are cases when you need to install only one of the connectors, i.e. connectors are mutually exclusive. For instance, in Subversive we have JavaHL SVN Connector and there are several versions of it: 1.4, 1.5, 1.6 but there's a restriction of JVM that you can install only one of them at the same time; of course, I understand that it's not a common use case, but there may be other use cases where this feature may become helpful as Discovery feature is planed to move to p2.

issue.title: Problem when registering "modeling.gmt.modisco" to Babel
issue.description:
We are currently in the process of preparing an Eclipse-GMT MoDisco release for the next Helios milestone.
To do so, we have to register the MoDisco project to Babel. The problem is that there is currently no "modeling.gmt.modisco" project available from the registration webpage (titled "Babel - Define Map Files"), only a "modeling.gmt" one.
Could you help us solving this issue?
Best regards,
Hugo (MoDisco project lead)

issue.title: Refactor "Model Refactoring Wizard" code for better reuse and realignment.
issue.description:
Refactor "Model Refactoring Wizard" code for better reuse and realignment.
Some changes were made to the rename and move wizards. Both wizards are now functional, but the previous inheritance hierarchy is now broken (some reuse is still possible, but there differences present now that were not there before). This code should be revisited to see if there is a logical opportunity for code reuse, or if the wizards should be independent. If the latter is the case, the "Move" wizard should be cleaned up.

issue.title: [releng] upgrade 3.4 test server to 3.4.4
issue.description: 3.4.4 is now available.

issue.title: Makefile parser should not log errors for unresolved -include statements
issue.description:
Our GNU Makefiles include statements like these:
-include $(PRJ_ROOT_DIR)/*.makefile -include *.makefile
in order to optionally include files when they are found on the disk. Whenever I open our Makefile in the CDT Makefile editor, I see errors like the following logged into the PDE Errorlog: I think that this is wrong because
(1) The include statement is deliberately optional, so it is not expected to be an error when the included file is not found (2) The errorlog view should be reserved for unexpected program errors. Parsing errors like this one should instead be reported by error markers / annotations like the CDT Indexer does (i.e. little blue markers in the gutter of the Makefile editor).
Traceback of incorrectly reported errors looks like this:
java.io.FileNotFoundException: D:\Workspaces\ux\ws\userbuild_standalone_PPCissDiab\*.makefile (The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:106) at org.eclipse.core.internal.filesystem.local.LocalFile.openInputStream(LocalFile.java:362) at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.core.makefile.gnu.GNUMakefile.parse(GNUMakefile.java:104) at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.core.makefile.gnu.Include.getDirectives(Include.java:97) at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.core.makefile.gnu.GNUMakefile.getDirectives(GNUMakefile.java:800) at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.core.makefile.AbstractMakefile.getMacroDefinitions(AbstractMakefile.java:117) at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.core.makefile.AbstractMakefile.getMacroDefinitions(AbstractMakefile.java:128) at org.eclipse.cdt.make.internal.ui.text.makefile.MakefileTextHover.getHoverInfo(MakefileTextHover.java:62) at org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewerHoverManager$4.run(TextViewerHoverManager.java:168)

issue.title: Create jgit-build and egit-build mailing lists
issue.description:
Is it possible for us to create two new mailing lists?
jgit-build egit-build
Also, is there anything special for me to do to get Hudson to send emails there?

issue.title: Add ability to specify file-extension filter for build-options that support file browsing
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 7.0.0.I201001150805
Currently, there is no way for an integrator to supply a file-extension filter for build-options that support browsing of type 'file'.
The attached patch adds a new optional attribute to the <option> element - "browseFilterExtensions". The new attribute accepts a comma-separated list of file-extension filters - eg. "*.lib,*.*". For filters with multiple extensions, a semicolon can be used as a sub-separator - eg. "*.lib;*.a,*.*". If the attribute is not specified, the behaviour is unchanged.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a C project. 2. Open the build-options property page, and go to an option of browseType 'file', such as 'libraries'. 3. Click Add... and then File system... -> the Browse dialog shows everything, giving the user no way to filter the content.

issue.title: [CA] SWT Exception and Code assist did not complete normally dialog
issue.description:
Hi,
import project which is attached, open file 300680.php, type fo| exception in console occurs.
Delete foo and type foo::baz(), then delete foo| and dialog with Code assist did not complete normally dialog occurs.
When it exception didn't occur on the first time, try it more time, but reproducible everytime.

issue.title: [Webapp] Provide the ability to override the Help Contents menu action to support custom help systems
issue.description:
Build Identifier: eclipse-SDK-I20091217-0819-win32
We would like the ability to override the Help Contents menu action to point to a custom help system such as a web 2.0 help system. This would be done via an extension point. The help system will likely be local, but would have a different URL then the original help system. We may want to look at using the BaseHelpSystem interface for this solution, where the custom help is an implementation of a BaseHelpSystem
Reproducible: Didn't try
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Implement a custom help system 2. When Help -> Contents is clicked, show custom help system instead of Eclipse default help system 3.

attachments.attach: Patch for overriding the help contents menu action
Patch for overriding the URL the help system opens to - Extension implementation
Patch for overriding the Help Contents action
Test case for help display implementation
Version 2 of patch, takes port and host
Updated test case which uses port and host parameters
Version 3 of patch which includes host and port parameters and simplifies interface

issue.title: Source Database properties panel has a misaligned dropdown
issue.description: The Source Table label and related drop-down menu appear to be misaligned on Mac OSX Cocoa. (i.e. the dropdown is near the bottom of the page, while the label is near the top)

issue.title: Reversed order of Ok/Cancel on DatabaseQueryDataMapping and DatabaseQuerySearchCriteria Properties Panels
issue.description: These buttons are ordered in static fashion instead of according to the standard alignment of the os.

issue.title: Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.jface".
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
I deleted my prior Eclipse installation in an attempt to get around problems with 300524. I reinstalled galileo and unzipped the OEPE oepe-galileo-11.1.1.3.0.200909171310.zip into the eclipse install dir. I reloaded Eclipse and opened my old workspace, and re-created the Oracle weblogic 10g server. The error dialog reported in 300524 does not show up, but a large number of errors are reported in the error view.
Fri Jan 22 16:55:35 EST 2010 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.jface".
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.provisional.UIDecoratorManager at org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.cnf.ServerDecorator.getStateImage(ServerDecorator.java:142)....
I will attach the log file.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. install eclipse-jee-galileo-SR1-win32.zip 2. install oepe-galileo-11.1.1.3.0.200909171310.zip 3. create an instance of the oracle 10g weblogic server. 4. start the server.

issue.title: [Preferences] [Jface] Add ability to set the filter-path on file/directory field-editors
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 3.6M4
The FileFieldEditor and DirectoryFieldEditor do not expose the ability to programmatically set the initial filter-path for their underlying Browse dialogs.
The attached patch exposes this capability. This patch would enable Texas Instruments to contribute further enhancements to the CDT project (see bugzilla #300539).
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: N/A - this is an enhancement to org.eclipse.jface.preference.FileFieldEditor/DirectoryFieldEditor classes.

issue.title: Derived features are read-only
issue.description:
I don't like that derived features are read-only. I use them a lot in my properties view to show user friendly values.
IE: In my model I store all my values in metric, whatever the user wants to see. Then I have a derived property that shows the value in the user selected unit. My derived property converts it as requested. Using EEF I cannot do the same. I have to manually edit every file to add edit commands.
There is a read-only checkbox, if I don't select it then I don't want it forced upon me! Derived does not mean it is a constant value.

issue.title: Model DnD refactoring is not consistent with other DnD refactoring
issue.description: The DnD model refactoring behavior is not consistent with other eclipse DnD refactoring behavior. For example, when a Java element is DnD in another package there is no UI interaction with a wizard. When a user DnDs a model element a wizard is invoked and user interaction is required.

issue.title: Modify LHTMLParser due to a change in eclipse 3.5
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
org.apache.lucene.demo.html.HTMLParser has been changed since Eclipse 3.5. Create this item to track some modification needed in LHTMLParser due to this change in eclipse 3.5
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [pmi] Simplify CQ Submission Process for Library Updates
issue.description:
I was updating a lot of our dependencies today and I noticed that there is room for optimizations in this process.
Basically, I have to do the following steps for each update:
- Select "[request] to use, reference, or distribute third-party code that is maintained elsewhere" - Go through a search process which performs a search - Select "[enter] new cq..." on the results page - Fill out the form with all details - Submit the form - Open the new CQ in another browser tab - Attach the source
I have to repeat the steps for all libs.
However, IPzilla already knows all the information and I already know the previously approved CQ. I wish I could skip the extra search and form in the portal. Instead, simply enter the existing CQ number plus the new version and a new CQ would be created right away with all the necessary info pre-filled from the foundation database.

issue.title: Breakpoint actions do not get removed immediately when deleted
issue.description:
To reproduce:
1- create a breakpoint 2- open its properties 3- create a new BreakpointAction 4- attach that action 5- Delete that action -> the action is still shown as attached, but if you close the properties and re-open them, it will be gone, but the decorator will still be there.
I think the deleted action should be removed right away.

issue.title: Installer doesn't do agent service lookups
issue.description: The installer hasn't been converted to do service lookups via the agent. The installer is currently failing due to this problem.

issue.title: Ensure DynamicClassLoader returns valid type
issue.description:
When a DynamicClassLoader returns a class, it usually is built by the dcl. However, it is possible that there exists a class - reachable by the dcl's parent loader - with the same name.
The existence of this class may be a mistake, or it make be intentional if a user wished to create a class that conforms to the DynamicEntity interface specification.
DynamicClassLoader should check the 'assignableTo' property of the found class and return an error if it does not conform, otherwise the found class should be used.

issue.title: Fup of bug 235783
issue.description: More methods must be added to CodeSnippetParser. See bug 235783 comment 10.

issue.title: MatchService.resolveAll - Problem when comparing fragment resources with non-fragment ones.
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
A call to doResourceSetMatch as a result of comparing two resources may run into problems when one of the resources contains an object, which is referenced as child by another resource in the resource set (cyclic reference), as it is then marked as a FRAGMENT resource and deleted from the set of resources to be compared.
Reproducible: Always

attachments.attach: Patch to fix MatchService, so it can deal with cyclic references.

issue.title: Web service wizard Service Deployment Configuration view options corrupt each other
issue.description:
Created attachment 157161 [details] screen capture - only 1 ws runtime shows of the 3
The RAD web service wizard page "Service Deployment Configuration" allows users to select between 3 different views: Choose server first, Choose Web service runtime first & Explore options. - User can switch between each of these in turn and provided user makes no changes all views display correctly. - If user expands the Server Types information in any of the views and there are a lot of servers defined (e.g. 6 or more), or 3 or more server types and expands each them in turn, then switches to either the Choose server first or Choose Web service runtime first views, one of the selection boxes becomes a scrollable window displaying only one line of text at a time. Expanding the size of the dialog reveals the other web service runtimes.
See screen capture.

attachments.attach: screen capture - only 1 ws runtime shows of the 3

Please create a forum
http://www.eclipse.org/forums/eclipse.woolsey
for this project:
http://www.eclipse.org/proposals/woolsey/
DB entry has been created. Thanks.

issue.title: Facet support declarations by particular servers should override definitions marked for any server
issue.description:
Build Identifier: WTP 3.2.x
Definitions for the org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtimes extension point to declare facet support for a particular runtime are always overridden by definitions that define the same extension point with applicability scoped to any server.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: For example the JPA tools plugin org.eclipse.jpt.core defines this to enable all versions of the jpa facet for any runtime:
<extension point="org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtimes"> <supported> <runtime-component any="true"/> <facet id="jpt.jpa"/> </supported>
If an adopting product wants to restrict certain versions of the jpa facet to particular versions of it's runtime, like below (to only allow jpa 1.0 for xyz server version 5.0):
<extension point="org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtimes"> <supported> <runtime-component id="com.xyz" version="5.0"/> <facet id="jpt.jpa" version="1.0"/> </supported>
When the user launches the new project wizard or the facet config page, and selects runtime xyz version 5.0 as the target runime, both jpa facets 1.0 and 2.0 are still shown as available for choice. So it seems that the <runtime-component any="true"/> overrides everything else. Can the overriding behaviour be changed such that particular runtime definitions always takes precedence?
It looks like particular runtimes can't define facet support/configurations that are more scoped, if there's a pre-existing definition for the same facet with <runtime-component any="true"/>

issue.title: build path error message needs to be more descriptive

Build Identifier: M20080911-1700
When compiling some projects you can get:
"The project cannot be built until build path errors are resolved"
This is not a very helpful error message - is there any way it could display more information about WHAT those build path errors are?

issue.title: Saving Object Allocation Profiling data is missing
issue.description:
When opening the saved results of a Memory Analysis profile of Object Analysis the method name and instance data is missing. In 4.5.2.1, the instance values exist but are 0 in 4.6.2/4.7.0. The method names appear as ?'s for all entries in 4.5.2.1/4.6.2/4.7.0 except for the last entry and does not take the user to the source.
1. Install the TPTP All In One. 2. Run an application with Object Analysis enabled for Memory Analysis. 3. Verify the Object data is visible and has instance data in the Allocation details view. 4. Restart the workbench and accept the option to save the data on shutdown. 5. When the workbench starts, load the Allocation details tab for the Object opened previously. The method information is not present and data is set to 0.

issue.title: Message for missing source entry
issue.description:
I see an error message as follows in my workspace:
An "source.tools.jar" build entry is missing
It's hard to know when to use "a" vs. "an", so I would suggest:
'source.tools.jar' build entry is missing

issue.title: subproject mode changed to plain file mode
issue.description:
If a tree contains a subproject mode (160000), creating a commit in EGit can convert this to be a plain text file mode (100644), which results in Git assuming the target object is a blob in this project.
If the target object is actually a commit in this project, we get weird failures from JGit trying to cast a RevBlob to a RevCommit, and `git fsck --full` gets confused, claiming a blob was used in a commit context.
This results in a corrupt repository, because the target isn't valid anymore.

issue.title: Initiate bpmn_diagram can´t handle subprocess elements
issue.description:
Hi, the steps to reproduce it:
1) create one bpmn_diagram file (foo.bpmn_diagram) with the editor. The editor has a Subprocess element. File->Save, all ok. The foo.bpmn is generated as well.
2) manually create another file called foo2.bpmn. Copy all the text from foo.bpmn into foo2.bpmn.
3) Select foo2.bpmn, right-click and "Initialize bpmn_diagram diagram file.
4) The resulting foo2.bpmn_diagram cannot be edited, and it isn´t displayed correctly.

issue.title: Eclipse volunteer page
issue.description:
There have been many discussions in the past about how it's difficult for people to get involved at Eclipse. I was reading a blog today about community building and it suggested having a volunteer jobs page.
http://www.feverbee.com/2010/01/volunteer-jobs.html
I just looked at the main eclipse.org page and I couldn't see anything like "how I can help". There is a newcomers page http://eclipse.org/home/newcomers.php but it doesn't really say how people can get help.
I think that this page could be something pretty lightweight. Perhaps it could be generated automatically by submitting bug links in twitter with a common hashtag.
Ideas for volunteer jobs include 1)Ian's request for a new Eclipse Logo https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=300271 2)PDE team needs help testing M5 this week http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/pde-dev/msg01655.html 3)Splash screen contests 4) bugs with helpwanted tags etc.
If we used twitter, people could be updated regarding new volunteer opportunities as they become available. I'm sure most projects have small tasks where volunteers would be able to make contributions and increase the number of people involved in the community.

issue.title: Add support to DynamicSQLBatchWritingMechanism to generate a single batch instead of many
issue.description: Build Identifier: 1.1.4 This bug is about extending the support for batch writing without binding that was done under bug 297908. The bug fix consist to use a different JDBC API to do the work. Instead of using: /** * Retrieves the current result as an update count; * if the result is a ResultSet object or there are no more results, -1 * is returned. This method should be called only once per result. * * @return the current result as an update count; -1 if the current result is a * ResultSet object or there are no more results * @exception SQLException if a database access error occurs * @see #execute */ int getUpdateCount() throws SQLException; Use this one: /** *... * @return an array of update counts containing one element for each * command in the batch. The elements of the array are ordered according * to the order in which commands were added to the batch. * ... * @since 1.3 */ int[] executeBatch() throws SQLException; Latest API gives more information, which is also needed to invalidate only the stale object, instead of all versioned objects involved. Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [extract method] "Ambiguous return value" from within for(;;) { continue; ...
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20100107-1410
for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) { if (cond()) continue; // 5
final String in = "in"; // 7 int a = in.hashCode(); // 8
System.out.println(a); }
Attempting to Extract Method lines 7 and 8 results in: Ambiguous return value: Selected block contains more than one assignment to local variables. Affected variables are: String in int a.
This does not happen if line 5, with the continue statement, is not present; in this case the expected refactoring, where the "String in" is correctly placed in the new method, occurs.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open attached testcase in any Java editor. 2. Hilight lines 7 and 8 in entirety. 3. Alt+shift+m / alt+shift+t,x / however else you feel like extracting a method.

issue.description:

I am using Teneo 1.1.2.v200912130725. Recently I noticed that "HbHelper.INSTANCE.registerDataStoreByPC(this);" was automatically called in "HbDataStore.initializeDataStore()" function. So all new HbSessionDataStores were automatically populated into "HbHelper.dataStoreByPersistentClass". Then it might be a good idea to remove its PC entries from the dataStoreByPersistentClass table while inside "HbDataStore.close()" function. Anyway entries in "dataStoreByPersistentClass" table is useless after the HbSessionDataStore was closed.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Enhancement Request: EAV schema numeric datatype's precision problem
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
I am using Teneo 1.1.2.v200912130725, and noticed two related issues while storing value in EAV schema.
1. Precision issue while dealing with double type.
I have an EClass with an EAttribute or EDouble datatype. EAttribute element = ecoreFactory.createEAttribute(); element.setName("element"); element.setEType(ecorePackage.getEDouble());
Right now the eavvalue's DDL statement is: create table `eavvalue` (eavid bigint not null auto_increment, discriminator varchar(255) not null, eavversion integer not null, feature varchar(255) not null, valueIsSet bit, mandatoryValue integer not null, owner bigint not null, typeNeutralValue varchar(255), type varchar(255), stringValue varchar(255), dateValue datetime, numericValue decimal(19,2), longValue bigint, `reftype` varchar(255), `refid` varchar(255), `conreftype` varchar(255), `conrefid` varchar(255), listkey bigint, `idx` integer, `valuesholderid` bigint, `valuesholderidx` integer, primary key (eavid)) type=InnoDB
So numericValue is only decimal(19,2). And when I try to store a value "2.2222", only "2.22" got saved.
Now if I use NON-EAV schema, the DDL statement was create table `testtype` (e_id bigint not null auto_increment, dtype varchar(255) not null, e_version integer not null, `element` double precision, primary key (e_id)) type=InnoDB Obviously 'double precision' can give me the right result back.
Question here is since EAV schema puts all numeric datatypes (e.g. DECIMAL, NUMERIC, FLOAT, REAL, and DOUBLE PRECISION) in one single column, so shall we pick the database type of highest precision for this column? I understand that might present some round up issues for 'DECIMAL' and 'NUMERIC'. Then another approach could be to use one EAV column of DECIMAL type to handle exact numeric data types (e.g. DECIMAL, and NUMERIC), and use another EAV column (e.g. double precision) to handle the approximate numeric data types (FLOAT, REAL, and DOUBLE PRECISION).
2. Another problem is also related to storing EDouble value in EAV schema. Though it doesn't look like a Teneo issue.
When I try to insert the previous EAttribute into Database, after setting the following value: testeObject.eSet(testeObject.eClass().getEStructuralFeature("element"), new Double (2.3));
The insert statement looks like: 2547 [main] DEBUG org.hibernate.SQL - insert into `eavvalue` (eavversion, feature, valueIsSet, mandatoryValue, owner, typeNeutralValue, type, stringValue, dateValue, numericValue, longValue, discriminator) values (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, 'EAVSingleEAttributeValueHolder') 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.IntegerType - binding '0' to parameter: 1 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.BooleanType - binding 'false' to parameter: 3 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.IntegerType - binding '1' to parameter: 4 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.LongType - binding '1' to parameter: 5 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.StringType - binding '2.3' to parameter: 6 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.StringType - binding 'java.lang.Double' to parameter: 7 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.StringType - binding null to parameter: 8 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.TimestampType - binding null to parameter: 9 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.BigDecimalType - binding '2.29999999999999982236431605997495353221893310546875' to parameter: 10 2562 [main] TRACE org.hibernate.type.LongType - binding '0' to parameter: 11
So it's essentially same as "insert into eavvalue (eavversion, feature, valueIsSet, mandatoryValue, owner, typeNeutralValue, type, stringValue, dateValue, numericValue, longValue, discriminator) values ('0', 'sdfa', 0, '1', '1', '2.3', 'java.lang.Double', null, null, '2.29999999999999982236431605997495353221893310546875', '0', 'EAVSingleEAttributeValueHolder');"
Now this statement works perfectly with MySQL 5.1. But if I try to insert the record into MS SQLServer 2008 through sqljdbc4-2.0.jar. The following error will occur: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: Error converting data type nvarchar to decimal. at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException.makeFromDatabaseError(SQLServerException.java:196) at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.getNextResult(SQLServerStatement.java:1454) ....
Seems like '2.29999999999999982236431605997495353221893310546875' is too long for SQLServer's numeric representation (SQLServer maximum numeric precision is 38).
The second problem is not necessary a Teneo issue. But I am not sure whether there is an easy fix out of it, without changing column type for the 'numericValue' to something like 'double'.
Thanks for help!
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: XML exports to do not include task descriptor step assignments for steps not included in export
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
Define a task with several steps in a plug-in, create another plug-in and define another task with steps and a process that uses both tasks and all the steps from each. Export only the plug-in with the process and the second task using XML and import into another library containing the first plug-in and all the steps. The imported process will show no steps selected for the task from the first plug-in as this information is not contained in the XML export file. Also noticed that the descriptions for the steps were carried along with the descriptors in the XML export file which should not be since those should come from the content.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: EPartService activation and deactivation doesn't quite work
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 1.0M3, I20100121
I've been looking into creating an editor stack using a part stack in e4. I've found that EPartService's methods don't quite do the right thing in activate(), bringToTop(), and deactivate().
In 1.0M3, activate() will cause the stack to create a tab for the editor, but the actual editor content is not shown until the tab is explicitly selected. bringToTop() makes no difference. There is often a mismatch between what the stack believes is the active child and what the underlying ETabFolder believes is the active child. deactivate() does not appear to have much of an effect. Reactivating an editor does not appear to do much either.
I20100121 fixes some of the activation problems: activating a *new editor* will cause that editor to be the active child (at least, it is brought forward). But activating an existing editor has no effect. deactivate() seems to have no effect: the editor is not removed, nor is it disassociated to the stack (e.g., the dirty flag is still responsive).
Reproducible: Always

attachments.attach: Small test app to demonstrate the issues

issue.title: Open Declaration does not resolve external subprograms
issue.description: The Open Declaration should be able to resolve external subprograms and interfaces, just as the Rename refactoring does. Currently, it can only open a declaration in another file when that subprogram is imported from a module.

issue.title: Bring Eclipse window to the front when opening file from command line
issue.description: With the new support for opening a file in Eclipse from the command line (or through associating file types with Eclipse), we should bring the Eclipse window to the front when opening a file.

issue.title: VersionParser.valueOf throws exceptions frequently
issue.description: While running tests for the performance problems in bug 300417 I hit a situation where we generate lots of ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsExceptions. I'm not sure if this is the source of the problem however I suspect this optimization is not optimal and we would be better off doing an int check.

issue.title: [Designer] DnD a "Command" from palette to Hierarchical outline fails
