issue.title: Process Controller no longer accepts new process launch requests on AIX after x number of launches
issue.description:
The process controller on AIX seems to become partially unresponsive after a certain number of launches, making the agent controller unusable for any agents that attempt to launch after this condition is reached. My simple tests put the number of launches required to get into this state at about 4 command line launches (e.g. processes not launched by process controller), or 14 regular launches.
Either of these conditions could be met on an agent controller that is running for a sufficient period of time.
The problem is due to the stack size limit of AIX. When the agent controller was originally ported, the default stack size for a thread was set to high (4MB). Solution will be to update this value without impacting stack-intensive parts of the application.
AIX is the only platform in which our code is required to deviate from the OS default stack size, and the only platform we have seen this problem on.

issue.title: Enable explicit activation of repository
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20091210-1301
In order to be able to add additional properties (e.g. database properties) to a repository before activation, it would be needed to have an option to explicit activate the repository after calling RepositoryConfigurator.configure(configFile).
Currently calling RepositoryConfigurator.configure(configFile) will implicit activate the repository through the call CDOServerUtil.addRepository(container, repository), which in its turn calls LifecycleUtil.activate(repository). By adding an optional boolean parameter to RepositoryConfigurator.configure(configFile) and CDOServerUtil.addRepository(container, repository) one can achieve an explicit activation of the repository. The programmer will have to call LifecycleUtil.activate(repository) by himself at a later point in the initialization.
See also discussion under: http://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php?t=msg&th=161297
Cheers Bjoern
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Add support for vectorized charts in PDF
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
Hello BIRT-Team,
currently if I export a report to PDF all charts will be automatically converted to jpg or png images.
I noticed that you already offer a PDF Render device in your chart api which seems to work perfectly to create vector based charts for PDF. I wonder why you are not using this render device for your PDF report creation ? It would be a great benefit for printing and viewing PDF reports online.
If you don't want to use this API for certain reasons then you could transform any chart to SVG and use the Batik API or FOP API inside your pdf emitter to convert the SVG chart to vector based PDF charts.
If I can support you in any way please let me know.
Thanks and best regards Tobias
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: Export a report with svg chart to PDF and the image will be rendered as JPG or PNG.

There is a JavaClassCastException in the WeaverUtil class from the org.gmt.weaver plugin. It comes in line 223. To correct it, it is needed to change EClassImpl and EObjectImpl in EClass and EObject.
The bug comes from switching from EMF 2.4 to EMF 2.5 which have different inheritance hierarchies.
Best regards,
Guillaume

issue.title: When using eclipse events and doing a delete the commit is skipped
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 2.0.0
This is a complex problem, but it is reproducible. - there are two entities in a master detail relation - on the child relation an eclipse "postDelete" event is present - this event gets there by adding a listener to the event manager of the class descriptor and that routes the event to the entity (emulating JPA @events) - the jdbc connection runs in a delayed constrained mode, checking the on commit. - In order to do this, a custom jdbc driver and connection implementation is used that executes a "set constraints all deferred" on the appropriate moments
When the master is deleted, the foreign key of the child results in an exception upon commit. However, if the postDelete method executes a native query the commit is never called! All connections are just closed.
In the attached zip a totally stripped example is present. This is the output without the event method:

issue.title: Split IResourceServiceProvider into UI dependent and runtime part
issue.description:
The IResourceServiceProvider provides access to language specific services form the outside by means of its Registry.
We need UI dependent services, such as a label provider for EObjectDescriptions, as well as runtime services. To avoid API dependencies we should split that up.
Proposed structure: 1) IResourceServiceProvider for the runtime services 2) IResourceUIServiceProvider for UI services, inherits from 1) 3) DefaultResourceServiceProvider implementing 1), registered in the language's standalone setup 4) DefaultResourceUIServiceProvider implementing 2) and delegating to an instanceof 3) for methods of 1), registered in the language's UI plugin.xml to the interface 2)
That we, both service interfaces / implementations are easily extensible without messing up the module bindings.

issue.title: [Import/Export] NPE when import zip
Make IResource(UI)ServiceProvider for Ecore Guice aware
issue.description:
Currently, the reosurce services for Ecore resources are hand coded. This is annoying and error prone when adding new services.
We should register Ecore resource services just like any other language, using Guice for the configuration etc.

issue.title: allow clients to extend composite artifact/metadata repo
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 3.6 M4
We have requirement to construct a composite repo from our special definition files. So we contribute ourselves composite factory to load the composite repo. The existing concrete ICompositeRepository is a common implementation and could be reused. Because ICompositeRepository doesn't have many special methods, just add/remove/get the children's uri. Yes, the concrete implementation is internal, we should not depend on it. But I think it's general, any implementation of ICompositeRepository would use list to record the children. And the risk of using it is less than copying it in our code.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Text field listeners

issue.title: Objects modification in 'wizard' mode
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20080221-1800
- l'objet est dupliqué pour le présenter dans le wizard afin de ne pas modifier l'objet courant. Il aurait mieux valu conserver l'objet réel et différer l'exécution des commandes de modifications sur "finish" lorsque l'affichage est en mode wizard.
- De plus sur "finish" ça envoie trop de notifications. En effet, même si un attribut n'a pas été modifié, il est tout de même "resetté" entraînant des ViewerNotification. Il faut uniquement reporter sur l'objet réel, les modifications qui ont été faites. En gros, il faut savoir quelles sont les features modifiées plutôt que de ressetter tout l'objet.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Keybinding for 'Terminate and Relaunch' does not work (as expected?)
issue.description:
I20100125-1800
1. Make a hello world Java application. 2. Put a breakpoint in the println statement. 3. Window > Preferences > General > Keys 4. Search for 'Terminate'. You should see 'Terminate' and 'Terminate and Relaunch'. 5. Bind 'Terminate and Relaunch' to Ctrl+Shift+F2. Click 'OK'. 6. Debug the application. 7. The breakpoint is hit. 8. In the 'Debug' view, select the stack frame and hit Ctrl+F2. 9. The application termiantes as expected. 10. Repeat steps 6 and 7. 11. In the 'Debug' view, select the stack frame and hit Ctrl+Shift+F2. 12. Nothing happens. 13. Bring up the context menu, it clearly says 'Ctrl+Shift+F2' for the 'Terminate and Relaunch' action. 14. Select the action. It works as expected.
Is this a bug or am I doing something incorrectly?

issue.title: Ensure that AC does not depend on deprecated libs in Linux.
issue.description:
Ensure that AC does not depend on deprecated libs in Linux.
Over the past few years, the RHEL and SuSE Linux distros have moved to newer versions of the libstdc++ libraries, while providing the deprecated APIs and bits in optional "compatibility" libraries. The TPTP 4.5.2.1 Agent Controller and earlier is compiled against the older libs.
To ensure that the AC works on Linux, the consuming product's installation checks for the presence of the older libs and blocks until they are installed. On RHEL4 and RHEL5 systems, they remain available and supported yet, but I don't know about RHEL6. On SLE10 systems, they are available, but on SLE11 systems they are not available on some platforms and available but not supported on others.
This has forced a recompilation of the AC to use the newer libs, at least for SuSE. The following was created to address this case:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=240677
We'll need to ensure that this set of bits runs on RHEL also, or compile for those also.

issue.title: [eclipse] Can not update root folder jre on windows
issue.description:
I ship a JRE with my RCP product. To add a JRE I define a root folder in one of my features pointing to the JRE:
bin.includes = feature.xml root.win32.win32.x86.folder.jre=jre/win32
This leads to having a jre folder next to the products executable when exporting the product, which is great. Now I try to do an update using p2. p2 tries to replace the jre folder when updating the feature containing the jre root folder. Unfortunately on windows this fails because it is not possible to delete the jre folder because some files of the jre are locked.

attachments.attach: JavaUninstallAction doing nothing and their registration

issue.title: MatchService.resolveAll fails to resolve proxies (and thus to detect fragment resources) within resources loaded with RevisionComparisonHandler
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
The relative file uris the RevisionComporisonHandler uses to load its resources lead to a problem within the MatchService.resolveAll method, where unresolvable proxies (due to relative proxy uris) cannot be resolved and thus fragment resources cannot be detected. This leads to a problem e.g. when comparing a fragment resource with its local history.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Exported product contains root folder twice
issue.description:
I ship a JRE with my RCP product. To add a JRE I define a root folder in one of my features pointing to the JRE:
bin.includes = feature.xml root.win32.win32.x86.folder.jre=jre/win32
This leads to having a jre folder next to the products executable when exporting the product, which is great. But I realized that the products size dramatically increased: There is a new folder jre in the root folder of size 86 MB, which is expected of course. But there is also the file eclipse\p2\org.eclipse.equinox.p2.core\cache\binary\foo.bar.product.jre.feature_root.win32.win32.x86_1.6.17 with size 30MB which is about the size of the zipped JRE folder. I assume the root folder is stored twice, once as jre root folder, once packed into this binary jre.feature file. Which seems like a substantial waste of space.

issue.title: Failure in testBug289719 on I20100125-0800 build
issue.description:
The I20100125-0800 build had the following failure. This indicates that the STARTING event is being fired before the RESOLVED event for the bundle. This is really strange because nothing has changed in this area since the fix to bug 289719 went in on December 14th. It also only failed on RHEL4, SUN 1.6.0 test machine.

issue.title: DiagramDocumentEditor should not call setInput on dispose
issue.description:
DiagramDocumentEditor calls super.setInput(null) in its dispose() method. super.setInput(...), among other things, calls configureDiagramEditDomain(). If the client editor returns null for diagram editing domain when input is null (which is a reasonable thing to do), then this method fails with NPE.
There doesn't seem to be a good reason for calling super.setInput(null) as part of dispose. stopListening() method, called from super.setInput(...) is needed in dispose, but it is called from super.dispose() anyways.
I attached the patch that removes this call. Cherie, do you mind double-checking this? Thanks!

issue.title: Better configurability for pde.convertSchemaToHTML
issue.description:
When generating schema documentation via the pde.convertSchemaToHTML ant task, configurability is currently limited:
I can define a cssURL but it *must* have a protocol, so "../../css/book.css" is illegal whereas "file:../../css.book.css" is legal but doesn't work. Is there a better way to specify the URL? I also tried a platform:/my.plugin/path URL but to no avail. Alternatively could checking be relaxed to allow protocol-less URLs?
Actually the generated html refers to two CSS but the other one ("../../schema.css") is not configurable. Would be great if both could be configured consistently.

issue.title: "The JVMTI agent org.eclipse.tptp.jvmti is not available" for 64-bit Eclipse
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
Although Java application profiling works fine in an up-to-date 32-bit install of Eclipse 3.5.1 "Galileo" on a Slackware Linux 13.0 system, when I try the same thing on a 64-bit install of the same I see (briefly) the console message:
Error occurred during initialization of VM Could not find agent library on the library path or in the local directory: JPIBootLoader
and then the Error popup message:
The JVMTI agent org.eclipse.tptp.jvmti is not available. Make sure that the libraries for the agent are available and that it is configured properly.
I've used only the Eclipse 'Help' -> 'Install New Software' to install features, TPTP included.
ACServer can be run manually:
$ TEMP=/temp $ LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$ECLIPSE/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.a c.linux_em64t_4.4.201.v200909111644/agent_controller/lib $ export TEMP LD_LIBRARY_PATH $ cd $ECLIPSE/plugins/plugins/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.ac.linux_ em64t_4.4.201.v200909111644/agent_controller/bin $ ./ACServer Creating default Agent Controller configuration file. Security is turned off. Access is set to Local. Run the SetConfig script to change the default settings. ... ^C $ cat ../config/servicelog.log <CommonBaseEvent creationTime="2010-01-18T11:54:38.916834Z" globalInstanceId="AB544BFE000DFD58156C83CE3FA5C283" msg="Native file server started listening on port 10005" severity="10" version="1.0.1"> <sourceComponentId component="AgentController" componentIdType="TPTPComponent" executionEnvironment="ClientCTL.c, line 606" instanceId="1004" location="pc118" locationType="IPV4" processId="4623" subComponent="Client Compatibility TL" threadId="4623" componentType="Eclipse_TPTP"/> <situation categoryName="ReportSituation"> <situationType xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="ReportSituation" reasoningScope="INTERNAL" reportCategory="LOG"/> </situation> </CommonBaseEvent>
after which Java program profiling does work. But it should start automatically.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start Eclipse and create and build a Java project. 2. Right-click on project name and choose 'Profile As .. Java Application'
Error messages appear.

issue.title: Setup public EGit download site
issue.description:
Hello,
according to http://aniszczyk.org/2010/01/25/egit-and-jgit-builds-available/
the update site:
https://build.eclipse.org/hudson/job/egit/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/org.eclipse.egit-updatesite/target/site/
should be replicated to:
http://www.eclipse.org/egit/updates
Best regards, Lars

issue.title: [UMLTypes] User shall be warned when deleting a property related to an association
issue.description: When a property that is associated to an association is deleted ,the corresponded association has to be removed. If not an association can have only one or zero member end. see 300311: [Class Diagram] IndexOutOfBoundsException on Association. https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=300311

issue.title: [Wizards] Conflicting mnemonic in 'New Folder' wizard
issue.description:
I20100125-1800
1. File > New > Folder 2. Complete the wizard page. 3. Click the 'Advanced >>' button. 4. Hit Alt+F to finish the wizard. 5. A dialog pops up instead.

issue.title: [IDE] 'Edit Resource Filter' dialog has a strange layout
issue.description:
Created attachment 157264 [details] Screenshot depicting the problem in question.
I20100125-1800
1. Select a project. 2. Alt+Enter to access its properties. 3. Go to the 'Resource Filters' property page. 4. Click the 'Add...' button. 5. Expand the dialog vertically. The description text should follow the text field immediately instead of being "centered".

attachments.attach: Screenshot depicting the problem in question.

issue.title: New Java project from Ant build file uses JRE_LIB instead of JRE System Library
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 3.5
When using the New Java Project from Ant build file dialog, the created project has JRE_LIB in the Referenced libraries instead of using JRE System Library (as set in the workspace default).
The problem is that when using endorsed libraries (such as for JAX-WS 2.2 with JDK 6), JRE_LIB will not work. One needs to use JRE System Library.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Use any build.xml with a javac task. 2. File | New Java Project from Ant build file 3. Look at the Referenced Libraries of the created project

issue.title: [breakpoints] Breakpoints View shows full selection and doesn't show dotted lines between nodes
issue.description:
Build id: I20100124-2000
I will attach screenshots showing the issue.

issue.title: ZoomManager "beeps" on Mac Cocoa
[Class diagram] problem to add a branch on an existed multi-dependency
issue.description: Create a multi dependency. Now it is impossible to add a new branch

issue.title: [backend] reafactor pre and post condition to IFunction
issue.description:
The pre and post conditions available on builders are useful to have on all functions. It is clear that they contain code that performs asserts and checks - they can therefore be easily turned on or off using preferences, or be adviced separately.
(The build specific postinput condition should remain on Builer, or possible migrate to a generalized Task).

issue.title: [Class Diagram] problem at the construction of a multi association
issue.description: when we add a branch on a association, the binary link is not removed

issue.title: [backend] add support for default properties in concerns
issue.description: It is currently possible to specify properties in a concern, but it is not possible to define default properties (i.e. properties that are set if not already set to values). This involves grammar changes, but implementation should be easy as there already is a default properties set to evaluate).

issue.title: Purge Bug 300746 from Bugzilla
issue.description: Is it possible to remove a bug completely from bugzilla? Bug 300746 was filed by an Oracle customer including Oracle internal service request, bug, and email exchanges that should probably not be published. I closed the bug as a duplicate but would ideally like to it purged.

issue.title: [backend] make guards adviseable
issue.description: It is currently possible to specify a guard for an IFunction (an expression or a function (only expression available in b3 grammar though). It should be possible to advice these (if something is wrong with a specified guard).

issue.title: [Commands] [Contributions] 'Open Resource' dialog menu has extra separator
issue.description:
I20100125-1800
1. Ctrl+Shift+R 2. Click the drop-down arrow in the top right. 3. A trailing separator menu item can be seen at the bottom.

issue.title: [search] [performance] Inferred anonymous types do not need to be added to the typeDeclaration category in the index
issue.description:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #299943 +++
Back port this performance fix to 3.0.5p.
Inferred anonymous types are never used as typeDeclarations in the JSDT index. Not adding them speeds up search, especially when dealing with large libaries such as Dojo.

issue.title: Add "Resolve Values" switch to Path Variables property page
issue.description:
HEAD
Table showing path variables for a resource has 3 columns: Name, Value and Resolved Value. Given the fact that values are rather long the third column is hardly visible. My suggestion is to remove the third column and add a switch to resolve variables in the second column.
I'll put up a mockup in a minute...

attachments.attach: New cleaned up UI with tooltip support.
Patch for removing the resolved value column, and showing the tooltip

issue.title: TableColumnLayout does not resize scrollbar after column resize
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20080911-1700
Enlarging a column does not show or update the scrollbar. This leads to columns which are not accessible anymore.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run the attached snippet. 2. It already shows a horizontal scrollbar. 3. Enlarge the first column, so that the second column is not shown completely anymore. 4. The scrollbar is not updated and therefore it is not possible to make the second column visible.

issue.title: [content assist] HTML/Javascript Content Assist autocompletes writeln as writeIn (EYE, not EL)
issue.description:
+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #300304 +++
Back port this fix to 3.0.5 p.
Build Identifier: Build id: 20090920-1017
In html mode when using the alt+/ keyboard to autocomplete the writeln option you get writeIn instead. writeIn is not a function supported by standard javascript.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Create html document 2.Create script tags 3. Within the script write "document.w" 4. press alt+/ for content assist 5. Select writeln option (The only options should be write and writeln )

issue.title: Selection changes in Breakpoints View unexpectedly when a context menu is clicked
issue.description:
Build id: I20100126-0100
Steps: 1) Add breakpoints in couple projects 2) Open Breakpoints View and use 'Group By > Projects' 3) Select couple breakpoints in the view, but from different projects 4) Open the context menu and click 'Disable' 5) Selection is changed and contains only one breakpoint now

attachments.attach: Selection before 'Enable' is clicked in the context menu

Syntax coloring broken for comments

Back port this fix to 3.0.5 p.
Created an attachment (id=124406) Screenshot of broken syntax coloring
Eclipse Build ID: I20090129-1800
Steps To Reproduce: see attached screenshot. The syntax coloring for comments is broken in I-3.1-20090131041147

issue.title: eclipselink persistence.xml connection and options settings problems
issue.description: If you create an eclipselink persistence.xml and set some of the settings on the Connection and Options tab and save and restart you will notice that the UI is not displaying these settings. The persistence.xml file has the properties set correctly.

issue.title: Problems with breakpoints when "Group by > Resource Working Sets" is used
issue.description:
Build id: I20100126-0100
I will attach a screenshot showing my set-up projects and describe steps.

issue.title: Do not allow Path Variables with empty location
issue.description:
HEAD
I'm able to create a path variable without location. Next, when I want to edit the variable, Edit Variable dialog opens with error saying "You must provide a file or folder path as variable value.". I guess I should not be able to create such variable in the first place.

issue.title: Can not drop-in new languages into deployed rcp
issue.description: 1. Create a new rcp using the mail template 2. create a product for the rcp 3. Export chose to 'Generate metadata repository' 4. Start the product with eclipse.exe -nl en Is: English platform, close the rcp 5. Follow instruction to install a new language: http://wiki.eclipse.org/Babel_/_Installing_Language_Packs 5.1. Download http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/technology/babel/babel_language_packs/BabelLanguagePack-eclipse-fr_3.5.0.v20091121043401.zip 5.2. create a dropins folder 5.3. unzip the French language pack into dropins folder 6. Start the product with eclipse -nl fr Is: Ohlala, no French, still English Should: Platform should be French

issue.title: [backend] better story for exceptions
issue.description: b3 functions does not distinguish between Errors and Exceptions, and subsequently exceptions are not declared on functions. It is naturally possible to catch Exceptions, Errors, Throwables etc. but it is not possible to help the user when exceptions are not declared per function, and not possible to flag unhandled and non thrown checked exceptions.

issue.title: Snippet66 does not draw
issue.description:
3.6M5 test build, observed on 32-bit RHEL4 and 64-bit RHEL5
- run Snippet46 - drag around within the Shell and note that nothing is drawn

issue.title: Snippet46 does not work
issue.description:
observed on 32-bit RHEL4 and 64-bit RHEL5
- run Snippet46 - try to drag the Button around and note that it does not move

issue.title: [ui] Support event tracing
issue.description:
Many of the UI bugs surrounding oddities in the "work with" combo of the install wizard, or button enablement issues, have been associated with incorrect handling of repository events. In some cases, the event was wrong (a bug), in other cases the UI is overresponding or underresponding to some event.
To better debug these situations, we need a trace on the eventing.
We could really use one in general in p2, but for these specific cases, doing at the UI listener level is necessary to interpret things like event batching.
Should also look into the dynamic trace API (ie, dynamically turning on tracing in the running eclipse) as these bugs are often hard to reproduce in a self-hosted environment.

issue.title: [target] Target platform definition gets overridden
Change buttons order in PathVariableDialog
issue.description: IMHO more intuitive order for buttons in PathVariableDialog would be [File...][Folder...][Variable...] instead of [File...][Variable...][Folder...]. I can provide a patch if the swap makes sense to you too ;)

issue.title: Change buttons order in PathVariableDialog
issue.description: IMHO more intuitive order for buttons in PathVariableDialog would be [File...][Folder...][Variable...] instead of [File...][Variable...][Folder...]. I can provide a patch if the swap makes sense to you too ;)

issue.title: install fisheye on build.eclipse.org to integrate into Hudson for change auditing
issue.description:
In the old Common Modeling build, we have SearchCVS; in Dash Athena, we do not... and it doesn't scale very well, nor do I want to maintain it anymore.
So, here's a possible replacement, which supports CVS, SVN, and even Git:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/fisheye/
An actual working example of drilling into a file's history by revision, tag, author, date, etc, linked from a Hudson build page:
http://fisheye.jboss.org/browse/JBossTools/trunk/jbpm/plugins/org.jboss.tools.jbpm.common/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF
It also appears you can link from Fisheye back into Eclipse:
http://blogs.atlassian.com/devtools/2010/01/protip-open-in-eclipse-intellij-shortcuts.html
Could this be installed on build.eclipse.org?

issue.title: Need to Update Javax.Servlet to include jsp_2_0.xsd
issue.description: The current version of javax.servlet is missing the jsp_2_0.xsd due to a prior license incompatibility. The license has been updated and the appropriate file attached to CQ 3457. We should update the javax.servlet existing bundle to include this xsd file. This is requested by the jetty runtime project so they can include this jar in their builds.

issue.title: 'Step Into Selection' has bad default keybinding on the Mac
issue.description:
I20100126-0100
The 'Step Into Selection' command has a bad default keybinding on the Mac. "M1+F5" translates to "Command+F5", which is an OS-reserved shortcut that starts Voice Over.
Suggest to turn this into "CTRL+F5".

issue.title: [flex root] classes not found when run/debug and class files are outside bundle root
issue.description:
Created attachment 157306 [details] sample project to import
Using a non-default bundle root location for a project, with the source & class files (output folder) contained outside the bundle root, OSGi cannot find the classes at run/debug time from the IDE.
For example, the bundle root is at /bundle/root, the source is in /src and the output folder is /bin (all project relative). Dev.properties specifies the location of the classfiles as /bin, but I suspect OSGi is looking for this relative to the bundle root rather than the project.

issue.title: TigerstripeProjectAuditor indexing holding stale project references.
issue.description:
Created attachment 157313 [details] eclipse log.
The issue can generally be replicated by the following:
1. Delete existing workspace and open eclipse (new workspace) 2. Create new Tigerstripe project (TestProjectOne) 3. Create new Tigerstripe project (TestProjectTwo) 4. Create a new package (at root level) in TestProjectOne named "root" 5. Create two new entities under "root" package in TestProjectOne 6. Refactor "root" to be renamed to "root1". Note that entities create created in 5 are now gone but no error messages are present in log. 7. Delete TestProjectOne and TestProjectTwo. 8. Create new Tigerstripe project (TestModelOne) 9. Create new Tigerstripe project (TestModelTwo) 10. Create a new package (at root level) in TestModelOne named "root" 11. Create two new entities under "root" package in TestModelOne (Named as above) 12. Refactor "root" to be renamed to "root1". Note that entities create created in 11 are now gone. 13. See attached log file. This was generated by step 12.

issue.title: Error during schemagen when referenced element is not found
issue.description:
If we try to make a reference to an element that is not global we currently create the following in the XSD
<xsd:complexType name="someType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="arg0" /> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType>
Instead we should set the name and type of the element like this
<xs:complexType name="someType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="arg0" type="xs:base64Binary" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>

issue.title: Using sftp instead of ssh exec of cat to transfer files
issue.description:
Build Identifier: HEAD
RemoteTools was using ssh exec of cat to transfer files. This had the disadvantages: - being slow - no guarantee of file being saved when stream is closed. As a consequence files were not available when stat or read was done right after save (e.g. when creating project) - no error handling of transportation problems
With this patch sftp is used for uploading and downloading of files. This solves all above problems. No fall-back to exec are used, because sftp works reliable in all our tests. The fall-back which was there is removed by the patch because it causes a thread dead-lock.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [BiDi] how to pass around extra String information?
issue.description:
The TextProcessor - both current implementation and the future enhanced version (bug 183164) need to have knowledge of the String contents. Something like: is it a file? is it an XML element?
However, the common situation is that this information is available to the string's Originator, but not to the string's Consumer. Moreover, typically the string woudl be passed through several layers of APIs:
Originator -> API1 -> API2 -> Consumer
(See bug 241856 for one concrete example.)

Reproducible: Always

issue.title: only testSetup() of JPA StructConverterTestSuite failed on GlassFish V3
issue.description:
This is first time we run JPA tests on GlassFish V3.0 GA, all tests of the whole test model passed on GlassFish V2.1 UR2.
For running the test model, we already copy sdoapi.jar to GLASSFISH_HOME/domains/domain1/lib, and the remained five tests of this test suite passed, only testSetup() failed with "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: oracle/spatial/geometry/JGeometry", that's strange. Becuase if I remove sdoapi.jar from GLASSFISH_HOME/domains/domain1/lib, then all tests failed with this NoClassDefFoundError. So this test failed while the rest five tests passed, that means the sdoapi.jar is under classpath at that time, it seems that the jar can't loaded only when running testSetup().
The suite is org.eclipse.persistence.testing.tests.jpa.structconverter.StructConverterTestSuite.

issue.title: Control.print(gc) produces various side effects
issue.description:
Build Identifier: SWT N20100120
When printing a component, there are various side effects.
This is a follow up on the discussions from bug 299714. Other related bugs are bug 223590, bug 223800, bug 267466, bug 267468 and maybe bug 225091.
1. Windows XP (tested on 32 bit computer JDK6u18)
- Painting artifacts when a window is dragged over the control. - The control is reparented at the wrong location if the window is moving.
- These can be fixed with this "improved method": Rectangle bounds = control.getBounds(); control.print(gc); control.setLocation(bounds.x, bounds.y); control.redraw(0, 0, bounds.width, bounds.height, true); control.update(); -> But I think the containers in the control hierarchy can occasionaly get painting artifacts too which are not cleared by this approach. Still, it is way better.
- The NativeSwing hack works fine but incurs a performance penalty.
2. Windows 7 (tested on 64 bit computer with 32-bit JDK6u18 and 32-bit JDK6u11, and on 32 bit computer JDK6u11)
- When print happens, the window is brought to front. There is some sort of focus stealing/restoring. This is a big issue because you cannot work with other windows when a component is being printed.
- The NativeSwing hack has the same focus issue. If fixPrintWindow is forced to false in Control.printWidget(int, int, GC), then the hack works fine (but with that aforementioned performance penalty).
-> It seems that activating the NativeSwing hack in addition to the SWT fix (fixPrintWindow not forced to false) can result in the unusable state (bug 299714) so they have to be exclusive.
We need a way out, even a temporary solution. Could there be an undocumented system property that would force fixPrintWindow to false? That way, we could activate the hack of our choice depending on the OS and configuration without having to alter the SWT sources. This would greatly help while waiting for a fix.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Control.print(gc)

issue.title: Add ability to specify additional prerequistes for non-custom build files
issue.description:
Build Identifier: I20090528-2000
When custom build is used it is possible to add additional input files. It would be good to have this ability also for non-custom build files, i.e., files for which a tool is used. These files should be respected within the dependency graph of CDT. This feature is useful in a custom build setting, in which a source file is generated from a custom build file, which in turn is needed for the non-custom build file. Build variables should be supported to support different configurations.
Ideally, one could select the inputfile from all available output files to make this more convienent.
Reproducible: Always

issue.description:
I20100125-1800
1. Make a Java file like the one below. 2. Invoke Ctrl+Alt+H on v(), you'll get something like "w() : void - Test (2 matches)" 3. Window > Preferences > General > Appearance > Colors and Fonts > Basic > Counter Color 4. Change the colour to something else. 5. Hit 'Apply'. Nothing happens. 6. Hit 'OK'. Nothing happens. 7. Try invoking call hierarchy again to force a "refresh". No dice.
This seemed to work on Boris's Mac though.

issue.title: Director shouldn't require an artifact repository to be specified
issue.description:
I20100126-0100
Run the following from the command line:
eclipsec.exe -application org.eclipse.equinox.p2.director -m http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/3.6-I-builds -list
This fails with:
Installation failed. Unable to load repositories.
It is failing because I didn't specify any artifact repository, although this isn't needed for the -list command to work. If I use "-r" instead of "-m", it works just fine.

issue.title: Enhancement Request: Change the access level of function ClassicSQLNameStrategy.getEntityName() from private to protected
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
Teneo version: 1.1.2.v200912130725.
We have a special requirement that 1. can't use our own EntityNameStrategy to replace default EntityResolvingNameStrategy. 2. but while extending TeneoSQLNameStrategy, still needs to overwrite the behavior provided by the function ClassicSQLNameStrategy.getEntityName(). However this function is private right now.
Thus, is it possible to change the access level of function ClassicSQLNameStrategy.getEntityName() from private to protected, so it can be overwritten?
Thanks
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Avoid interfaces that mislead EDC adopter into thinking more than one TCF peer per launch is supported
issue.description: Currently, EDC requires there to be a single TCF peer that provides all the services needed by the debug session. The interfaces in AbstractFinalLaunchSequence suggest otherwise, and is misleading.

issue.title: EDC is registering a service proxy from an invalid location
issue.description:
The javadoc for TCF's IChannel.setServiceProxy(Class<V>, IService) say:
"This method can be called only from channel open call-back."
EDC is calling it from within a launch sequence step, which disregards the requirement.
Eugene provided the following explanation of the requirement
"We don't allow registering service proxies at arbitrary time, because it would require all clients to listen and react to service life-cycle events. That would make clients more complicated and error prone without providing significant benefits."

issue.title: Disabling tracing does not notify listeners
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 3.6.0 I20100119-0800
As reported in bug 296631#c17 when tracing is disabled the corresponding listeners are not notified. As a result the performance impact of tracing code being executed is (mostly) hit - only the code to write the trace string to a file is not done. I will attach a patch that can be used to correct this problem.
Reproducible: Always

attachments.attach: possible patch for this problem. This will set all options with a value of 'true' to 'false' when tracing is disabled.

issue.title: Launcher fails on Solaris Sparc and Solaris x86
issue.description:
I20100126-0100
Eclipse doesn't start on Solaris Sparc and Solaris x86 when the launcher is used (it crashes with a segmentation fault). If you copy over the old M4 launcher library (eclipse_1304.so) into the plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.gtk.solaris[verison]/ directory, eclipse will launch again.
We believe this is caused by the changes made to the launcher to support file associations.

issue.title: remove references to uncertain capabilities bundles
issue.description:
Created attachment 157336 [details] patch to remove some capabiltiy bundles
See bug 299344 for reference.
This patch will remove bundles that were previously built by the Galileo builder. Once the Helios build is changed to no longer build them, the EPP build will break, without this (temporary) fix.
Later, I will need to determine if the bundles need to go back in this feature (as the WTP ones are) or if I need to copy/paste capability information into our jee capabilities plugin, as I do for Eclipse SDK.

attachments.attach: patch to remove some capabiltiy bundles
patch to re-add capabilities from WTP

issue.title: [ui] filtering the "installed new software" list appears to stop due to wait on load job
issue.description:
Build id: I20100126-0100, WinXP
While verifying bug 298806, I noticed long lags where the filter box is unresponsive (you can type, but events are ignored and the eraser is not shown).
It is expected that there is a window of time where filter events are ignored (while the repo is loading), but the window seems too long.
I have been clearing out all my p2 repo caches to test other bugs, so the problem seems much more severe.
I think that the load job triggered by the filter box should be more selective. For example, it should only load the repo in question, not all of them. It should also set a higher priority for itself so that it doesn't get blocked by other parallel load jobs that are loading all repos.
Note that this behavior has not changed since 3.5. I don't believe this to be a regression, but it's possible that the performance is worse, or that I just noticed it in the course of doing lots of repo adding/loading with clean caches. Once the repositories are loaded, everything is fine. (So, for example, if you are running with auto updates on, you wouldn't see this problem.)

issue.title: newly created breakpoint not selected when group by working sets
issue.description:
I20100126-0100
* Change the breakpoint view to group by breakpoint working sets * Create a couple working sets, set one as default * Create a new breakpoint
Two issues
* the first time a breakpoint is added, the group does not expand * after manually expanding, and creating another breakpoint, the newly added breakpoint is not selected. When using other groupings breakpoints are properly selected on creation

issue.title: Creating a breakpoint in an external file does not result in qualified names
issue.description:
I20100126-0100
* Open an external .java file from the file system (not contained in the workspace). * Double-click to create a line breakpoint * The breakpoint appears, but only the simple type name is shown (even when "show qualified names" is on) * Debug to a program in the workspace with the same qualified name (note that the breakpoint is not hit/installed)
Breakpoint creation should be generating qualified names for external files via use of the AST (package statement).

issue.title: need a new version of XL C/C++ Compiler properties page
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 2.1.4
need a new version of XL C/C++ Compiler properties page to cover the remote directory browsing for RDT.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.right click on a remote project 2.select properties -> C/C++ Build/XL C/C++ Compiler 3.You will see a warning message "Compiler path does not exist on the local machine." which make no sense to a remote project.

attachments.attach: an updated patch should be applied on top of the first two patches.

issue.title: I try to scroll in the release tool wizard, but get drag feedback instead
issue.description:
I20100124-2000, Cocoa
This is happening in the release tool wizard, on the page where you can see the changed files. There is a tree with files and folders in the upper half, and two StyledTexts in the lower half for the textual comparison.
1. Click on one of the files in the upper half. Lower half updates 2. Try to scroll the text
-> Instead of scrolling, you instead drag the selected item from the tree (or, sometimes, you end up with a multi-selection in the tree)

issue.title: Cannot remove empty launch from debug view
issue.description:
If a launch delegate throws a runtime exception and has not added anything to the launch object - it remains in the launch view and cannot be removed. For example:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: This delegate does not work, as it has not been implemented at org.eclipse.debug.examples.mixedmode.internal.ProfileDelegate.launch(ProfileDelegate.java:15) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:853) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:702) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:893) at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$8.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:1096) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
Generally, this indicates a programming error, but as a platform it would be good to remove the empty launch.

issue.title: [translation] Invalid EL not being translated
issue.description:
If you have an invalid EL statement such as
${ pageContex } (missing a 't')
Then the ELGeneratorVisitor will not translate it. This means that an error will not be reported on it making it apear valid. Even invalid EL should be translated, that way the JSP Java validator can do its work.
Patch to follow.

issue.title: Need target namespace parameter for JAXB Schema generation
issue.description:
We need a way to specify the default targetNamespace for generated schema. The reason is, some of the value type classes could be specified only in the OXM (xml overrides) xml elements or files, and the content of the xml overrides is not visible to webservice layer; ws layer cannot generate the <xml-schema> for these classes/packages because we do not aware of their existence.
We would propose adding a defaultTaregetNamespace to the 'properties' parameter (2nd param) of the JAXBContextFactory.createContext method.

issue.title: Weekly update site does not work - Error resolving hostname
issue.description:
Created attachment 157345 [details] proxy
Hi,
If I try to install subversion via the weekly update site I receive an error during the connector installation.
Screenshot attached.
This might be because I'm behind a proxy. The proxy settings in Eclipse are correctly maintained.
Best regards, Lars

issue.title: Add an extension point to start different internal web servers
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
Currently when calling the BIRT preview in the design mode, BIRT starts an internal web server (jetty). It would be good to add a possibility to contribute any other server. See http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/newsLists/news.eclipse.birt/msg19755.html This could be done by creating an extension point instead of calling org.eclipse.birt.report.viewer.utilities.AppServerWrapper. I will create a patch for this feature.
This way we could integrate the embedded JBoss AS, embedded Glassfish, Tomcat ...
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Add a possibility to place BIRT OSGi engine out of BIRT web application
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
When deploying a BIRT application, the BIRT OSGi engine is placed within the application. It would be good if we could set BIRT so that the engine is somewhere in the file system. This would decrease BIRT applications for about 30 MB. I will create a patch.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: [shared] Install area calculated incorrectly when launcher and framework not co-located
issue.description:
A product that stores the launcher and eclipse.exe in a folder separate from the framework has run into a problem when running in shared mode. What happens is that we go to write the users bundle.info we end up calculating the location of the launcher bundles incorrectly from the information in shared bundle.info. On the next run this difference is recognized and we will redirect the user's install to use the shared bundles.info
The problem is in how simpleconfigurator manipulator calculates the install folder and subsequently the location of the launcher bundles when in shared mode. What needs to happen is that we the shared eclipse.ini to get the correct layout.

issue.title: [publisher] Convert PublisherResult to use IUMap
issue.description:
Created attachment 157350 [details] patch
John has created a helper class called IUMap which holds a collection of IUs and has optimizations for InstallableUnitQuery queries. We should take advantage of this class and one instance where it would be useful is in the PublisherResult class.
Note that in order to do this the IUMap class should be moved to a more "common" bundle where others can access it. (currently it resides in the metadata.repo bundle)
Attached is an initial patch for comments/review.

issue.title: Mapped by combo not populated
issue.description:
The Mapped by combo is not being populated when switching between two 1-M mappings (in the Structure View) with MappedBy annotations in Java.
Upon first selection the Mapped by combo is populated, but if you then select another mapped 1-M in the structure, notice that the Mapped by combo is not populated. If you then switch back to the first 1-M the same unpopulated behavior can be seen.
I can reproduce this 100% of the time on my machine. Karen seems to have less success on her machine.

issue.title: Ability to define custom artifact location in managed build
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 7.0.0.I201001150805
When one project depends on another, and the dependent project's build-artifact is set to an absolute path, Gmake always fails for the referencing project with a 'multiple target patterns' error.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create two projects 'a' and 'b', such that project 'a' references the active configuration of project 'b'. 2. Set project 'b's build-artifact to an absolute path, like C:/${ProjName}.lib. 3. Build project 'a'. -> Gmake fails for project 'a' with a 'multiple target patterns' error.
The GnuMakefileGenerator assumes the dependent build-artifact is always a relative path, and always prepends <referenced_project_loc>/<referenced_config>/ to it.
The attached patch fixes the makefile-generation to handle this scenario.

issue.title: incorrect syntax error for character declaration
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
This is reported as a syntax error in the outline, but is valid Fortran AFAIK: CHARACTER(KIND=A,LEN=B) :: NAME
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Type CHARACTER(KIND=A,LEN=B) :: NAME in a free-form fortran editor 2. 3.

issue.title: templated builds fail to publish when releng failure
issue.description:
For some reason, templated builds, such as for JSDT and JAXWS fail to publish any test results. It may occur only when a JUnit failure occurs?
The "final" error message has to do with a releng test failure that started showing up when we did away with tests being in 'dropins' folder.
286 Caused by: /shared/webtools/tests/jsdt-R1.2.0-I/test.xml:80: The following error occurred while executing this line:$ 287 /shared/webtools/tests/jsdt-R1.2.0-I/eclipse/dropins/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.wtp.releng.tests_1.1.0.v201001240030/test.xml:182:
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /shared/webtools/projects/jsdt-R1.2.0-I/workdir/I-1.2.0-20100126154427/versioningReportToHTML.xsl (No such file or directory)$
The issue, I realize now, is that the tempalted folders still do use the dropings folder.
A general purpose solution would be best, even if templated folders eventually also do not use the dropins folder.

issue.title: Refactor AbstractConnector to use concurrent objects for collecting statistics
issue.description: Eliminate locking while collecting statistics to improve performance and reduce overhead.

issue.title: ROV holding lock on file
issue.description:
ROV is causing problems in CCS because it is holding a lock on the file. This results in the "Invalid File Format" error people see in CCS after rebuilding their application on Linux.
ROV uses an IOFReader instance to lookup static strings from the .out file. The object file reader opens the file for reading when you call 'parse'. To ensure that the OFReader doesn't maintain a lock on the file, you need to call 'close' after calling 'parse'. The OFReader will close the file, then reopen it temporarily whenever a string is retrieved.
'parse' does not automatically close the file at the end because some (theoretical) users of the OFReader (other than ROV and RTA) may not be concerned with the file handle, and may not want the overhead of closing and re-opening the file.
ROV was missing the call to 'close' after the call to 'parse'. This was causing the OFReader to maintain its handle on the file.

issue.title: [commands] Race condition when inferior terminates
issue.description:
When letting the inferior finish on its own, I sometimes see GDB 7.0 be automatically terminated but sometimes not. With GDB 7.0 there is a new =thread-group-exited event. In GDBControl_7_0 we trigger off this even to potentially shutdown GDB. From the traces below we can see that in some cases, the state of the inferior has not yet been updated, so we don't shutdown GDB.
055,255 [MI] 20-exec-continue --thread 1 055,256 [MI] 20^running 055,257 [MI] *running,thread-id="all" 055,257 [MI] (gdb) 055,292 [MI] =thread-exited,id="1",group-id="5060" 055,308 [MI] =thread-group-exited,id="5060"
is terminated is RUNNING <============= this is the current inferior state when getting the =tread-grou-exited event
055,310 [MI] *stopped,reason="exited-normally" 055,311 [MI] (gdb) 055,314 [MI] 21-data-evaluate-expression $_exitcode 055,318 [MI] 21^done,value="0" 055,319 [MI] (gdb)

issue.title: IMasterDetailsDelegate - selection lifecycle methods
issue.description:
We discussed the need for two (instead of one) methods, that are notified during a selection change:
- delegate.prepareItemSelected(item) is notified first, at the beginning of a selection change - delegate.itemSelected(item) is notified last, at the end of a selection change

issue.title: IMasterDetailsDelegate - reduce calls to isChanged(...)
issue.description:
Further reduce the calls to delegate.isChanged(...).
New ideas:
- ignore the "text" event - only "textAfter" is important - ignore events generated from delegate.prepareItemSelected(...) - ignore events generated from delegate.itemSelected(...)

issue.title: Bugzilla doesn't seem to like Firefox 3.6
issue.description:
Since I installed Firefox 3.6, I am getting lots of weird problems when I commit changes to bugzilla: no bugs has been modified, invalid OS,...
Is this something known ? Is it a problem with Firefox 3.6?

issue.title: Parameter value cannot be edit in Drill through dlg[04]
issue.description:
Created attachment 157363 [details] screenshot
Description: [Smoke] Parameter value cannot be edit in Drill through dlg[04]
Build: <2.5.2.v20100127-0630>
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a report with a parameter and a label 2. Set drill through on label 3. In Drill through dlg, select parameter created in step1 and try to define value
Actual: Value cannot be edit and "..." button beside it does not work
Expect: Value can be edit.

issue.title: Failures opening and using synchronize view
issue.description:
Created attachment 157364 [details] Log file
I20100126-0800
1) I started up an existing workspace with this build. I had left the synchronize perspective open, but when I restarted the perspective was gone.
2) Opened the synchronize perspective
3) I clicked the button in the sync view to create a new synchronization.
4) On the first page of the wizard I chose "CVS synchronization", clicked Next.
-> The wizard failed with a NullPointerException. At this point I was unable to synchronize anything so I had to shutdown. I am attaching the log which has many errors.

issue.title: Default launchers not persisted across workbench restart
issue.description: * I installed the mixed-mode launching plug-in, that provides alterante launchers for Java applications. * In the "Run/Debug > Launching > Default Launchers" preference page, I select the "Eclipse JDT Launcher" as the default launcher for run and debug modes. * Re-start the workspace, re-open the pref page, there is no default launcher anymore

issue.title: "Open Declaration" (F3) Feature does not work when function is a variable assignment
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
When a function is set as the value of a variable eg.:
proc foo {a b} { puts "$a $b" }
set myProc foo <-- pressing F3 on foo does not work
set arga "bar" set argb "baz"
executeStep $myProc $arga $argb
The open declaration will not work unless it is enclosed in execution brackets[] or used to start a new line of code.
In the example I have shown here, the name of the procedure is to be passed in as an argument to another procedure. Our current TCL environment has on the order of 5,000 files using this format. (this is for tracking and reporting step level details for all execution of code).
For our particular environment the severity is MAJOR as this has a huge impact as our code declarations are inaccessible.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. create a valid procedure 2. set it as the value of a variable 3. mouseover the value from step 2 and press F3

issue.title: Recursive definition of Eclipse runtime option -arch
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
While building a man page for /usr/bin/eclipse, I found that your Eclipse runtime options documentation at:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/reference/misc/runtime-options.html?view=co#osgiarch
has the -arch option recursively defined:
-arch <architecture> (OSGi) equivalent to setting osgi.arch to <architecture>
then it describes that property as:
osgi.arch {-arch} see -arch
which of course begs the question of what does -arch actually do.
(I'm led to believe -arch relates to the underlining architecture of the machine running eclipse, but that's not obvious, as OSGi is an architecture itself.)
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: jaxws standalone build fails
issue.description:
It failed when got to the tests and said "org.eclipse.jst.ws.cxf.tests" not found. I think this was because of a "mismatch" ... jaxws was pre-reqing the M4 version of WTP, but that version of WTP doesn't work with the near M5 version of Platform (I think due to some APIs added to P2 that rippled into server tools).
So, step 1 as to use last week's near M5 I-build of WTP as the pre-req.
I think it still failed, but in a different way.
Continuing to investigate.

issue.title: deadlock during junit test which calls Display.syncExec on additional thread
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
Our application runs a Jetty Server, and in response to some POST http requests, opens an editor on a worker thread of the server using Display.syncExec. The test code for this function, using HTTPClient to post to localhost. A deadlock occurs while running the junit test. The WorkbenchTestable Thread is also calling Display.syncExec at the time of the deadlock. My guess/analysis is that this is the cause of the deadlock.
(I am going to attempt to simplify the scenario)
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Have code that matches the RCP app description and test case under the details. 2. Run the junit plugin test (junit4), I suggest using the debugger. 3. It deadlocks. If using the debugger, you can suspend all the threads and inspect to guess at what's gone wrong.

attachments.attach: two stack traces, from original presenting problem
simple test file that illustrates bug (java code)
key stack traces using sample test code
sampe test suite that spins event loop

issue.title: jaxws unit tests fail in standalone build
issue.description:
While fixing bug 300949, I got it to the point where the standalone build runs, but then ends by saying "no runnable tests found".
I'm not exactly sure what that means but 1) I think JUnit 4 is being used in the standalone build, and JUnit 3 _might_ be being used in the massive WTP build. More important, 2) I did find reference to this problem on the internet. You might search or start at this following link to get some insight into the issue:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/672466/junit-how-to-avoid-no-runnable-methods-in-test-utils-classes

issue.title: [DataBinding] Make ControlDecorationSupport official API
issue.description: ControlDecorationSupport is still internal, provisional API. In the past year there have been lots of positive comments and no complaints about the API itself, so I think we can proceed and move this class into the "official" API packages.

issue.title: [DataBinding] Make ControlDecorationSupport official API
issue.description: ControlDecorationSupport is still internal, provisional API. In the past year there have been lots of positive comments and no complaints about the API itself, so I think we can proceed and move this class into the "official" API packages.

issue.title: wrong aspects shown for preferences
After creating a new Bundle from an jar, the build.properties should not contain a src folder
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
Since creating a bundle from an existing jar does not require a source folder (only binary content), the build.properties file should not contain the "source" directive. It generates a warning which has to be removed manually.
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Stereotype Profil
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
When apply a stereotype to uml element ,
org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element element=.... org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Stereotype stereotype= ...
element.applyStereotype(stereotype);
if isn't possible to apply a stereotype methode launch a IllegalArgumentException(String.valueOf(stereotype)).
is it possible to have a more explicit message ? ex: The profil is not apply to the neaster package ....
Reproducible: Sometimes

issue.title: canStart(...) canRestart(etc) often don't check inside delegate
issue.description:
The Server.class code which checks whether the server can stop, start, or restart, often does not slip into the delegate because the delegate has not yet been loaded.
This often makes the result inaccurate.

issue.title: Server.canStart(etc), canRestart(etc), canStop(etc) often do not check delegate
issue.description: These actions access the behaviourDelegate directly, which often times is null. This means that the results are often innacurate, with the start action being enabled when the server can't possibly start.

attachments.attach: uses getBehaviourDelegate(etc) instead of accesing hte delegate directly

issue.title: "What's New", "Samples", and "Tutorials" links on welcome page don't work
issue.description:
Build Identifier: Build id: 20090920-1017
clicking on any of these three icons does nothing.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. click on icon 2. wait forever 3.

issue.title: [Navigation] find references should also work on cross-references
issue.description: "Find reference" action on cross references should search for the referneces of the x-refed element as in JDT.

issue.title: Postpone indexer setup until all refresh jobs have been completed

issue.title: [Navigation] Find references sometimes does nothing
issue.description: From time to time the "Find references" action does not update the search view. Could be a multi-threading issue.

issue.title: EGit seems to ignore .gitignore's contents
issue.description:
Though I have the following lines in my .gitignore, EGit continues to mark the files/folders with a ? in the Navigator and adds them to Git when I select "Add to Version Control" on the project node.
.classpath .project .settings target META-INF
This affects when I have created a bunch of new files and would like to add them alone to Git.

issue.title: [UI] Rearrange actions in context menu of Xtext elements
issue.description:
The context menu of an Xtext element should be as close to JDT as possible.
Neccessary adaptions include: - add a menu group for search actions - add menu groups for "Declaration" and "References" - move actions into appropriate groups

issue.title: Aspects are not refreshed for elements without annotation
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
If selecting an element in the workflow editor for which a profile was defined (and activated), all aspect properties are shown in the custom properties section correctly. However, if the selection will be switched from an element with defined annotations to an element for which no profile was defined or activated the properties view still shows aspect information of the "old" element instead of showing an empty properties section.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Annotate a workflow element, e.g. Action A, for which a profile was defined and activated before 2. Switch your selection to an element, e.g. StructuredActivityNode B, for which no profile was defined 3. => The properties view shows the same aspect properties as for the first workflow element A

issue.title: [planner] unexpected dependencies brought by the installation of the french language pack
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
Installing french language pack via babel update site, restarting Eclipse : import/export menu become unavailable (gray). Same result for some other perspectives, or some options. Tried with french and german language pack.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1.install french language pack 2.restart eclipse : got the problem 3.uninstalle language pack : all is working again

attachments.attach: screen shots from Eclipse in word file

issue.title: History of file impossible to track when working with tags and branches
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20090920-1017
When looking at the history of a file (list of revisions) it is impossible to see the following information: - which revision was "tagged" - the changes that have been made to this file in a branch
This makes it extremely difficult to work with branches and merge changes back in the trunk, since you cannot see which changes were made in the branch from the history view or which changes have been released in which version (it is a good practice to tag a release in source control).
What I was thinking was an option, a little similar to "Stop on copy", but in the other way: it would be VERY nice to be able to keep track of the changes of copies of the file in the history view (so you would get all revisions of the file in the branch in the same history). This way you could as well see that the file has been copied as part of a "tag".
I don't know how difficult this is, and if this can be done only in subversive or requires support for it in subversion, but for my company, it is a really big problem (from that perspective, CVS is much better as you get the full history of the file, with tags and changes in branches).
Reproducible: Always

If the title of a submodule is long enough to trigger displaying the tooltip this tooltip is not cleaned up if the module is closed. If the mouse is moved to leave he toltip a wiget disposed exception is thrown.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. file in the patch attached 2. start example client 3. click on 'Module 1.1.2 (closeable)' 4. click on 'Navigation' 5. click the button 'Add Sub-Module this Node' a few times, until the submodule title gets abbreviated with '...' 6. click into the submodule working area to give it the focus 7. move the mouse over the submodule title and leave it there to display the tooltip 8. without moving the mouse: use arrow down key to move the button focus to the new button 'Remove Module-Group' and press the enter key
-> the module closes and the tooltip remains -> if moving the mouse out of the tooltip you'll get the 'widget is disposed' exception. The tooltip remains...

attachments.attach: this adds the 'Remove Module-Group' Button to NavigationSubModule[Controller|View] classes

issue.title: Drop non-functional support for OPML
issue.description:
Buckminster contains code that stems from an attempt to support OPML as part of the recognized meta-data. The code was never put to use and the intended integration with RSSOwl was not maintained. The implementation is however fairly invasive and requires a lot of support moving forward.
I suggest we remove the OPML support completely at this point. We can reinstate it later, should we feel the need to do so, but maintaining code that isn't used doesn't make anyone happy.

issue.title: javascript in javadoc gets executed when view (might be a security hole)
Deploying BIRT Report Engine on WASCE
issue.description:
Build Identifier:
Deploying BIRT Runtime 2.5.1 on websphere application server community edition( WASCE ) 2.1.1.3 : - I am able to install birt.war in WASCE using Administrator Console, but while running test report , that is already a part of birt.war, birt viewer goes into infinite processing. And in log file, it shows error - ERROR [[ViewerServlet]] Servlet.service() for servlet ViewerServlet threw exception java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space
It seems that similar error is resolved for AIX, but I am not able to understand the solution in the context of Birt Runtime and WASCE. Please help me in this issue.
Thanks & Regards,
Sanket Gadiya
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install WASCE and BIRT Runtime 2.Run WASCE by using command prompt, eg. C:\WASCE 2.1.1.3\bin>start-server.bat >> C:\WASCEstart.log 3. open Administrative Console and deploy new application http://localhost:8080/console/portal//Applications/Deploy%20New 4. browse to ENGINE_HOME (e.g. C:\BIRT\birt-runtime-2_5_1) and select birt.war file to deploy 5. Click on install, that will successfully deploy the application 6. Go to browser, and open the link - http://localhost:8080/birt/ It shows that BIRT viewer has been installed. Viewer Version : 2.5.1 Engine Version: 2.5.1 JRE version: 1.6.0_12 View Example 7. Click on View Example. It'll open test report and start processing for infinite time 8. Now open C:\WASCEstart.log and see the error message ERROR [[ViewerServlet]] Servlet.service() for servlet ViewerServlet threw exception java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space

issue.title: Feature request: Include XSD types search dialog in the API
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 20080921203356 (WST feature build ID)
It would be great if the functionality for selecting XSD types (and maybe elements) is included in the Web Tools API. Currently to use the dialog for searching XSD types, we refer to some internal classes, namely:
org.eclipse.wst.common.ui.internal.search.dialogs.ScopedComponentSearchListDialog in the org.eclipse.wst.common.ui plugin
and
org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui.internal.editor.search.XSDTypesSearchListProvider from the org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui plugin.
Is there a possibility to expose this functionality?
Regards, Dinko
P.S. Also it would be great if the XSDTypesSearchListProvider could work only with XSDSchema(s) and does not require to provide also an IFile instance. Currently we have such usecase where we provide XSD schemas as search scope, but no IFile is available. In this case the null IFile instance causes a NPE to be printed (in the superclass constructor).
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: N/A (feature request)

Cocoa:Combo.setListVisible not working on cocoa
[TextSizeDetermination] fails with disposed fonts
issue.description: There are cases when we access fonts during the dispose phase of a widget. In case the font itself is disposed before (eg. listing to Display dispose event to dispose the resources) can cause exceptions as we try to access these disposed fonts. Not yet sure how to handle this correctly but I think we should prevent accessing the text size determination during dispose.

issue.title: [Tree] Background image is ignored

issue.title: [Sequence Diagram] Ease the creation of a message

When creating a message, we have systematically a pop up asking for a signature for the message. This pop up shouldn't appear when it is not possible to select a signature.
This will ease the creation of a message.

issue.title: [api] The StringVariableSelectionDialog for core.variables should support filtering
issue.description:
Build Id: Eclipse 3.6m4
The StringVariableSelectionDialog, which typically is behind a "Variables..." button in a number of places, currently displays all defined Eclipse variables.
This is problematic, because many variables are valid in certain contexts only. The ${build_project} variable, for instance, is only valid in context of external tool builders.
End users who are prompted to pick a variable from the StringVariableSelectionDialog get the impression that they can use all the variables -- and once they picked one that fails to work in their context, they do not understand why it fails to work.
Proposed solutions: ------------------- 1.) In the simplest case, the StringVariableSelectionDialog should allow product builders to explicitly hide variables which are known to fail in the context where the "Variables..." button is used. For instance:
svsd = new StringVariableSelectionDialog(parent); svsd.hide(new String[] { "build_project" }); int code = dialog.open();
This simple improvement would already allow product builders to get it right in a "closed" environment for the occurrences of a "Variables..." button that they can control.
2.) For more advanced and configurable environments, the org.eclipse.core.variables.dynamicVariables extension point should add an attribute that allows variable providers define a list of String context name in which the variable can be resolved. Variables without context name are expected to be universally available (to provide backward compatibility). The StringVariableSelectionDialog can then support filtering by a list of context names that are known to work in the concrete situation.

issue.title: [api] The ${build_project} Eclipse variable fails for builders other than Ant/ExternalToolBuilder
issue.description:
Build ID: Eclipse 3.6m4
The "${build_project}" Eclipse variable is documented to "return the location of the project currently being built".
But looking at how the corresponding variable resolver is implemented, it turns out that this can only work for builders that extend the ExternalToolBuilder.
This is a problem for consumers like the CDT Makefile Build. The CDT Makefile Build allows specifying the make command, and allows using Eclipse Variables when doing so. End Users may try using the "${build_project}" variable in order to use a shellscript as make command which is defined in the current project; but this currently fails since the CDT MakeBuilder extends IncrementalProjectBuilder, and not ExternalToolBuilder.
Suggested Solutions: -------------------- 1) As the simplest first step, documentation of the ${build_project} variable should be change to indicate that this only works for external tool builders, e.g. Ant (within the context of external tools).
2) Functionality should be refactored such that the IncrementalProjectBuilder directly supports it. This should be relatively straightforward: 1. Add package-private method InternalBuilder#setProject(IProject proj) 2. In BuildManager line 627, add a call to currentBuilder.setProject(proj) 3. Add public API InternalBuilder#getProject() to get the current project 4. Refactor the build_project variable resolver to use the new API, and have it contributed by the core.resources plugin rather than the external tools plugin --> voila, the variable is universally valid.
3) Only slightly related -- The StringVariableSelectionDialog which displays a list of available variables to the end user should support filtering, such that end users do not see variables which are known not to work in a particular context. I have filed bug 300988 for this improvement.

issue.title: css support for number/date/string format
issue.description:
Build Identifier: 2.5.1
Support for numberFormat / dateFormat / stringFormat in css styles would be helpful.
I have reports which contain dozens of tables and each table can contain about a dozen detail fields with numbers. I want to define a number format for these number fields. As it is now I have to specify the format for each and every number field. If I have to change the format, I have to adapt the format specification of each and every field again.
With the visual report editor I can specify a format only at data field level, but not on a higher level. In the xml view I can copy a format definition and apply it to the table element. The table cells and the contained data fields inherit the format from the table element. This gives me some relief, but still it is not possible to do this in the visual editor, only in the xml editor.
Even better would be if I can specify a format at report or page level. I also tried this in the xml tab of the report editor, but when I try to switch to a different tab it gives me an error that I have to correct the xml first.
Finally I would like to be able to specify the format in an external css file. For now I get a Error.StyleSheetParserException.PROPERTY_NOT_SUPPORTED
Reproducible: Always

issue.title: Line breakpoint properties dialog has problems when target class is not available
issue.description:
I20100127-0100
The 'Suspend Policy' option is missing in the line breakpoint properties dialog. The option is available in the Breakpoints view details pane, but not in the dialog any more (it's there in latest 3.5.x build).

issue.title: AbstractPartRenderer's API-ness is ambiguous
issue.description:
AbstractPartRenderer seems to be a class that should be API but it's currently in an API package. It's also in a bundle that depends on SWT when it has no SWT dependencies itself. SWTPartRenderer, which _is_ API, extends it, but it does not override all of its methods which causes a leaking of internal methods.
APR should either be made API or SWTPR should reimplement all of its methods (even if blank) like how it is with Job and InternalJob so that the methods are documented properly and not exposed to subclasses because of a "leak".
While we're at it, it may be worth renaming these two classes because they're not exactly about rendering "parts".

issue.title: Team actions do not provide a RemoteResourceMappingContext to ResourceMappings
issue.description:
Build Identifier: M20090917-0800
Subversive's Team context menu actions (such as CommitAction/UpdateAction) don't provide a RemoteResourceMappingContext for determining the relevant remote state of the model resources. Although some ResourceMappings don't need to worry about a context supplied to the getTraversals method, there are those that crucially depend on the remote context's availability.
Imagine a 'Forms' logical container element which maps to all *.form files in a given folder. Let's assume that some of the element's files were deleted and then Commit action is invoked on the element. If a remote context is not provided, the element's ResourceMapping will only consider resources that exist locally in the workspace. Therefore, deleted files will not be included in the commit operation. Similarly, update operation on the element will not include any new files from the repository. In other words, if a remote context is not provided, team operations on the logical model elements may exclude resources. (See http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/platform-team/team3.1/logical-physical-mappings.html for a detailed discussion)
A real (although somewhat contrived) example of a ResourceMapping that uses the remote context is o.e.jdt.internal.corext.util.JavaElementResourceMapping.PackageFragmentResourceMapping. It uses the context to determine all IFolders inside the package that don't correspond to any of the package's subpackages.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Checkout the org.eclipse.team.examples.filesystem project from dev.eclipse.org:/cvsroot/eclipse into a 'host' workspace. Lauch a 'child' workbench to debug it. 2. In the child workbench open a 'Project Explorer' view. 3. Create a new 'Model Project' (File -> New -> Other -> Team Logical Model Example -> Model Project) and share it (Team -> Share Project... -> SVN). 4. Create a MOD file in the project ('Create MOD file' in the project's context menu). 5. Create a MOE file for the MOD file ('Create MOE file' in the MOD file's context menu). 6. Commit the changes. 7. Now delete the MOE file ('Delete' in the context menu). 8. Invoke Commit action on the MOD file. 9. Notice that the list of resources to commit contains only the modified MOD file and doesn't contain the deleted MOE file. If you are to commit the changes, the MOE file will NOT be deleted from the repository.

issue.title: New Dynamic Web Project unexpectedly resizes itself after a JSF preset configuration is selected
issue.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. File->New->Dynamic Web Project 2. Type in a name for the project 3. Resize the dialog so that it is bigger width-wise 3. Select the JavaServer Faces v1.2 Project preset config
RESULT: The dialog unexpectedly resizes
Analysis: pack() should be done when entering the JSFFacetInstallPage, not when the page is created.
